original: mā cidanyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata
analyzed: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata
translated: Do not think of anything else, O friends, do not be dispirited

original: indramitstotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhurukthā ca śaṃsata
analyzed: indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata
translated: Praise Indra, the mighty one, together with the pressed (Soma), and repeatedly recite the hymns

original: avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuraṃ gāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham
analyzed: avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā ājuram gām na carṣaṇīsaham
translated: The unretreating bull, as swift as thought, like a cow, conquering men

analyzed: vidveṣaṇam saṃvanana ubhayaṃkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam
translated: Causing enmity, conciliating, bringing both sides together, most bountiful, going to both sides

original: yaccid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye
analyzed: yat cit hi tvā janāḥ ime nānā havante ūtaye
translated: Whatever these people here call upon you for help, in various ways

original: asmākaṃ brahmedamindra bhūtu te 'ha viśvā ca vardhanam
analyzed: asmākam brahma idam indra bhūtu te ha viśvā ca vardhanam
translated: Let this prayer of ours, O Indra, be for your exaltation, and for the increase of all

original: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito 'ryo vipo janānām🔽upa kramasva pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye
analyzed: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścitaḥ ryaḥ vipaḥ janānām  upa kramasva puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye
translated: The wise ones are contending with each other, O mighty one, the noble thoughts of the people🔽Come, bring the most desirable strength for our protection

original: mahe cana tvāmadrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām
analyzed: mahe cana tvām adrivas parā śulkāya deyām
translated: Even for a great bride-price I would not give you away, O thunderbolt-wielder

original: na sahasrāyanāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha
analyzed: na sahasra ayana ayutāya vajrivas na śatāya śatāmagha
translated: Not for a thousand, not for ten thousand, O Indra, the performer of a hundred sacrifices, not for a hundred

analyzed: vasyān indra asi me pituḥ uta bhrātuḥ abhuñjataḥ
translated: You are dearer to me than my father or my brother who provides me with food

original: mātā came chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase
analyzed: mātā came chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase
translated: My mother and you, O good one, cover me together for the sake of wealth and bounty

original: kveyatha kvedasi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ
analyzed: kva iyatha kva idasi purutrā cit hi te manaḥ
translated: Where are you going? Where are you? For your mind is in many places

original: alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt purandara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ
analyzed: alarṣi yudhma khaja kṛt purandara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ
translated: You have started, O warrior, the performer of sacrifices, O Purandara, the Gāyatrī verses have sung out

analyzed: pra asmai gāyatram arcata vāvātuḥ yaḥ purandaraḥ
translated: Sing to him the Gayatri hymn, let him blow who is the lord of the brave

original: yābhiḥkāṇvasyopa barhirāsadaṃ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ
analyzed: yābhiḥkāṇvasya upa barhiḥ āsadam yāsat vajrī bhinat puraḥ
translated: By which (songs) he came to the sacrificial grass of Kanva, by which the wielder of the thunderbolt broke down the forts

original: ye te santi daśagvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ🔽aśvāso yete vṛṣaṇo raghudruvastebhirnastūyamā gahi
analyzed: ye te santi daśagvinaḥ śatinaḥ ye sahasriṇaḥ  aśvāsaḥ ye te vṛṣaṇaḥ raghudruvaḥ tebhiḥ naḥ tūyamā gahi
translated: Those which are thine, O Indra, in the possession of the Dasagvin people, those which are in the possession of the Satins, those which are in the possession of the Sahasrins🔽Those thy strong horses which are swift-moving, come to us with them when we praise thee

analyzed: ā tu adya sabardughām huve gāyatra vepasam
translated: To thee I call the milch-cow, easy to milk, who is moved by the Gayatri (hymn),

analyzed: indram dhenuṃsudughām anya āmiṣam uru dhārā maraṃkṛtam
translated: Indra, the cow who yields abundant food, the cow of many streams, the cow who is not barren

original: yat tudat sūra etaśaṃ vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā
analyzed: yat tudat sūraḥ etaśam vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā
translated: When the sun struck down Etaṣa, the crooked one, with the wing of the wind,

analyzed: vahat kutsam ārjuneyam śatakratuḥ tsarat gandharvam astṛtam
translated: Śatakratu carried off Kutsa, the son of Arjuni, and pierced the Gandharva who was obstructing him

original: ya ṛte cidabhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ṛte cit abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhyaḥ ātṛdaḥ
translated: He who, even when not pressed, from before the collar-bones, is the one who pierces

analyzed: sandhātā asandhim maghavā purūvasuḥ iṣkartā vihrutam punar
translated: The bountiful one, having much wealth, the one who joins what was disjoined, the one who restores what was torn asunder

original: mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvadaraṇā iva🔽vanāni na prajahitānyadrivo duroṣāso amanmahi
analyzed: mā bhūma niṣṭyāḥ iva indra tvad araṇāḥ iva  vanāni na prajahitāni adrivas duroṣāsaḥ amanmahi
translated: Let us not be like those who dwell in the desert, O Indra, like those who are without a home🔽We have not considered the forests, O you who are like a mountain, as being far away, (for) they are hard to reach

analyzed: amanmahi id anāśavaḥ nugrāsaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: We have not considered (you) as slow, O Vṛtra-slayer, nor as one who swallows (everything)

original: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasānu stomaṃ mudīmahi
analyzed: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi
translated: Once, O hero, with thy great bounty, we will rejoice in thy praise-song

analyzed: yadi stomam mama śravat asmākam indram indavaḥ
translated: If my praises resound, may the Soma juices🔽flowing through the filter, swift, gladden Indra,

original: tiraḥ pavitraṃ sasṛvāṃsa āśavo mandantu tugryāvṛdhaḥ🔽ā tvadya sadhastutiṃ vāvātuḥ sakhyurā gahi🔽upastutirmaghonāṃ pra tvāvatvadhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim
analyzed: tiras pavitram sasṛvāṃsaḥ āśavaḥ mandantu tugryāvṛdhaḥ  ā tvā adya sadhastutim vāvātuḥ sakhyuḥ ā gahi  upastutiḥ maghonām pra tvā avatu adhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim
translated: the increaser of Tugrya.🔽Come to the assembly for praise, to the friend who calls,🔽the praise of the generous ones, I seek your good praise.

original: sotā hi somamadribhiremenamapsu dhāvata🔽gavyā vastreva vāsayanta in naro nirdhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
analyzed: sotā hi somam adribhiḥ ema enam apsu dhāvata  gavyā vastrā iva vāsayantaḥ id naraḥ nirdhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
translated: For the Soma has been pressed with stones, bring it forward in the waters,🔽the men, as if clothing with a garment of cows, are milking it from the udders.

original: adha jmo adha vā divo bṛhato rocanādadhi
analyzed: adha jmaḥ adha vā divaḥ bṛhataḥ rocanāt adhi
translated: Now on earth, or from the lofty sky, or from the luminous realm above,

original: ayā vardhasva tanvā girā mamā jātā sukrato pṛṇa
analyzed: ayā vardhasva tanvā girā mamā jātā su krato pṛṇa
translated: O born one, O very wise one, grow with my song, fill (yourself).

original: indrāya su madintamaṃ somaṃ sotā vareṇyam
analyzed: indrāya su madintamam somam sotā vareṇyam
translated: Press the Soma, most delightful, for Indra, the best,

original: śakra eṇaṃ pīpayad viśvayā dhiyā hinvānaṃ na vājayum
analyzed: śakraḥ eṇam pīpayat viśvayā dhiyā hinvānam na vājayum
translated: Shakra has made it swell with all thought, urging it like one eager for strength.

original: mā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācannahaṃ girā
analyzed: mā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācan aham girā
translated: Never may I, with the noose of Soma, always beg of you with a song,

original: bhūrṇiṃ mṛgaṃ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṃ ka īśānaṃ na yāciṣat
analyzed: bhūrṇim mṛgam na savaneṣu cukrudham kaḥ īśānam na yāciṣat
translated: who would not beg of the fierce one, like a wild beast, at the libations?

analyzed: madena iṣitam madam ugram ugreṇa śavasā
translated: Urged by intoxication, the fierce one's fierce strength,

original: viśveṣāṃ tarutāraṃ madacyutaṃ made hi ṣmā dadāti naḥ
analyzed: viśveṣām tarutāram mada cyutam made hi sma dadāti naḥ
translated: the one who crosses over all, who drips with joy, in joy he grants us strength.

original: śevāre vāryā puru devo martāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: śevāre vāryā puru devaḥ martāya dāśuṣe
translated: In the time of rest, the god must bestow good things on the mortal worshipper

original: sa sunvate castuvate ca rāsate viśvagūrto ariṣṭutaḥ
analyzed: sa sunvate castuvate ca rāsate viśva gūrtaḥ ariṣṭutaḥ
translated: He must give to the presser and the praiser, all-praised, unpraised

original: endra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā
analyzed: ā indra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā
translated: O Indra, come and rejoice in the wondrous gift, O god

original: saro na prāsyudaraṃ sapītibhirā somebhiruru sphiram
analyzed: saraḥ na prāsi udaram sapītibhiḥ ā somebhiḥ uru sphiram
translated: Like a lake, with the sounds of joy, with the Soma juices, wide and vast

original: ā tvā sahasramā śataṃ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye
analyzed: ā tvā sahasramā śatam yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye
translated: On your thousand, on your hundred, yoked to the golden chariot

original: brahmayujo haraya indra keśino vahantu somapītaye
analyzed: brahma yujaḥ harayaḥ indra keśinaḥ vahantu soma pītaye
translated: The bay horses yoked by prayer, O Indra, with flowing manes, shall carry you to drink the Soma

original: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūraśepyā🔽śitipṛṣṭhā vahatāṃ madhvo andhaso vivakṣaṇasya pītaye🔽pibā tvasya girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrvapā iva
analyzed: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūra śepyā  śiti pṛṣṭhāḥ vahatām madhvaḥ andhasaḥ vivakṣaṇasya pītaye  pibā tvasya girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrva pāḥ iva
translated: On your golden chariot, may your two bay horses, with tails like peacocks' plumes,🔽With spotted backs, carry you to drink the sweet juice of the Soma, the well-pressed🔽Drink of this, O lover of song, as of the first draught

analyzed: pariṣkṛtasya rasinaḥ iyam āsutiḥ cāruḥ madāya patyate
translated: The well-purified juice, the sweet, is ready for you to delight in

original: ya eko asti daṃsanā mahānugro abhi vrataiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ asti daṃsanā mahān ugraḥ abhi vrataiḥ
translated: He who is alone, of great might, with his terrible vows

original: gamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣadā gamad dhavaṃ na pari varjati
analyzed: gamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣadā gamat havam na pari varjati
translated: May he come, the handsome one, he should not come as a woman, he does not avoid the call

original: tvaṃ puraṃ cariṣṇvaṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya saṃ piṇak
analyzed: tvam puram cariṣṇvam vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya sam piṇak
translated: You crushed the moving fortress of Sushna with your weapons

original: tvambhā anu caro adha dvitā yadindra havyo bhuvaḥ
analyzed: tvambhāḥ anu caraḥ adha dvitā yat indra havyaḥ bhuvaḥ
translated: You followed him for two nights, if, O Indra, you are to be worshipped

original: mama tvā sūra udite mama madhyandine divaḥ
analyzed: mama tvā sūre udite mama madhyandine divaḥ
translated: I of you at sunrise, I at midday of the sky

analyzed: mama prapitve apiśarvare vasavā stomāsaḥ avṛtsata
translated: In my winter dwelling, O Vasus, let the hymns of praise be turned to me

original: stuhi stuhīdete ghā te maṃhiṣṭhāso maghonām🔽ninditāśvaḥ prapathī paramajyā maghasya medhyātithe
analyzed: stuhi stuhi id ete gha te maṃhiṣṭhāsaḥ maghonām  nindita aśvaḥ prapathī paramajyāḥ maghasya medhyātithe
translated: Praise, praise, these are indeed the most bountiful of the bountiful🔽The one with praised horses, the leader, the best bowman, the most worthy of offerings in the sacrifice, O Atithi

original: ā yadaśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayāhaṃ rathe ruham
analyzed: ā yat aśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayā aham rathe ruham
translated: When I, with faith, mounted the chariot, following the horses

original: utavāmasya vasunaściketati yo asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ
analyzed: uta vāmasya vasunaḥ ciketati yaḥ asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ
translated: He also thinks of the wealth of the one who has cattle, the animal that is to be given

original: ya ṛjrā mahyaṃ māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā
analyzed: yaḥ ṛjrā mahyam māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā
translated: He who with speed offers to me, together with skin of gold

analyzed: eṣa viśvāni abhyastu saubhaga āsaṅgasya svanat rathaḥ
translated: He who surpasses all others, the one with good fortune, the one with a rattling chariot

original: adha plāyogirati dāsadanyānāsaṅgo agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
analyzed: adha plāyaḥ girati dāsa danya an āsaṅgaḥ agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: Now the one with a yoke, O Agni, with ten thousand, seeks the gifts of the one who is to be served

original: adhokṣaṇo daśa mahyaṃ ruśanto naḷā iva saraso niratiṣṭhan🔽anvasya sthūraṃ dadṛśe purastādanastha ūruravarambamāṇaḥ
analyzed: adhokṣaṇaḥ daśa mahyam ruśantaḥ naḷāḥ iva sarasaḥ niratiṣṭhan  anu asya sthūram dadṛśe purastāt anasthaḥ ūruḥ avarambamāṇaḥ
translated: The ten bright ones who are to be sprinkled have stood for me like reeds in a lake🔽The great one is seen following him, the one who is not to be moved, the thigh that is not to be grasped

analyzed: śaśvatī nārī abhicakṣya āha su bhadram arya bhojanam bibharṣi
translated: The eternal woman looks upon him and says: You bear, O good one, the most auspicious food for the noble one

analyzed: idam vaso sutam andhaḥ piba su pūrṇam udaram
translated: Drink, O Vasu, this pressed Soma, fill your belly well

original: anābhayin rarimā te🔽nṛbhirdhūtaḥ suto aśnairavyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ
analyzed: anābhayin rarimā te  nṛbhiḥ dhūtaḥ sutaḥ aśnaiḥ avyaḥ vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ
translated: O navel-less one, we offer you🔽Pressed by men, pressed with stones, purified with woolen filters

analyzed: aśva ūna niktaḥ nadīṣu
translated: The horse, purified in the rivers

original: taṃ te yavaṃ yathā gobhiḥ svādumakarma śrīṇantaḥ
analyzed: tam te yavam yathā gobhiḥ svādum akarma śrīṇantaḥ
translated: We mix that barley for you, as with cows, making it sweet,

analyzed: indra tvā asmin sadhamāde
translated: O Indra, in this assembly.

original: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ
analyzed: indraḥ id soma pāḥ ekaḥ indraḥ suta pāḥ viśvāyuḥ
translated: Indra alone is the drinker of Soma, Indra is the presser of Soma, he is the life of all,

analyzed: antar devān martyān ca
translated: between the gods and mortals.

original: na yaṃ śukro na durāśīrna tṛprā uruvyacasam
analyzed: na yam śukraḥ na durāśīḥ na tṛpraḥ uru vyacasam
translated: The bright one, the ill-willed one, the sharp one cannot reach

analyzed: apaspṛṇvate suhārdam
translated: the wide-ruling one, the good friend.

original: gobhiryadīmanye asman mṛgaṃ na vrā mṛgayante
analyzed: gobhiḥ yadi īmanye asmat mṛgam na vrāḥ mṛgayante
translated: If others than us seek the deer with cows, they do not find it,

analyzed: abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ
translated: they surround it with milch cows.

original: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya
analyzed: trayaḥ indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya
translated: May the three Soma juices of Indra, the god, be pressed

analyzed: sve kṣaye suta pāvnaḥ
translated: in his own abode, O you who have good Soma.

analyzed: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraḥ camvaḥ su pūrṇāḥ
translated: Three jars drip, and three cups are well filled

original: samāne adhi bhārman🔽śucirasi puruniṣṭhāḥ kṣīrairmadhyata āśīrtaḥ
analyzed: samāne adhi bhārman  śuciḥ asi puru niṣṭhāḥ kṣīraiḥ madhyatas āśīrtaḥ
translated: on the same surface of the altar.🔽You are pure, O you who have many supporters, in the middle you are sweetened with milk,

analyzed: dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya
translated: with curds you are the most delightful of the hero.

original: ime ta indra somāstīvrā asme sutāsaḥ
analyzed: ime te indra somāḥ tīvrāḥ asme sutāsaḥ
translated: These, O Indra, are your Somas, the strong, the pressed ones for us,

analyzed: śukrāḥ āśiram yācante
translated: the bright ones ask for the sweet.

analyzed: tān āśiram puroḷāśam indra imam somam śrīṇīhi
translated: Make this Indra drink this Soma, the sweet cake,

original: revantaṃ hi tvā śṛṇomi🔽hṛtsu pītāso yudhyante durmadāso na surāyām
analyzed: revantam hi tvā śṛṇomi  hṛtsu pītāsaḥ yudhyante durmadāsaḥ na surāyām
translated: for I hear that you are very generous.🔽The drunk ones fight in the hearts, the ill-tempered ones like Sura,

analyzed: ūdhar na nagnāḥ jarante
translated: the naked ones do not grow old like a udder.

original: revānid revata stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ
analyzed: revān id revataḥ stotā syāt tvāvataḥ maghonaḥ
translated: The singer of the rich man's praise should be rich, O you who have much to bestow,

analyzed: predu harivas śrutasya
translated: Go forward, O you of the bay steeds, of the famous one

analyzed: uktham cana śasyamānam agoḥ ariḥ ā ciketa
translated: Even the unpraised hymn of the one who is not a bull has been thought of,

analyzed: na gāyatram gīyamānam
translated: Even the ungraced Gāyatrī has been thought of

original: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ
translated: Do not give up to the greedy one, O Indra, to the one who strives,

analyzed: śikṣa śacīvas śacībhiḥ
translated: Teach us, O mighty one, with your might

original: vayamu tvā tadidarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: vayam u tvā tad id arthāḥ indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
translated: We, your friends, O Indra, have come to you for this purpose,

analyzed: kaṇvā ukthebhiḥ jarante
translated: The Kaṇvas serve you with hymns

analyzed: na ghemanyadā papana vajrin apasaḥ naviṣṭau
translated: Not even then, O Indra, when we have served you, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the new sacrifice,

analyzed: tava idu stomam ciketa
translated: Then we have thought of your praise

original: ichanti devāḥ sunvantaṃ na svapnāya spṛhayanti
analyzed: ichanti devāḥ sunvantam na svapnāya spṛhayanti
translated: The gods desire the one who presses (Soma), they do not long for sleep,

analyzed: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ
translated: They go to heedlessness, being ever watchful

original: o ṣu pra yāhi vājebhirmā hṛṇīthā abhyasmān
analyzed: ā u su pra yāhi vājebhiḥ mā hṛṇīthāḥ abhi asmān
translated: Go forth now, O Indra, with your powers, do not be angry with us,

analyzed: mahān iva yuva jāniḥ
translated: Like a great young woman

original: mo ṣvadya durhaṇāvān sāyaṃ karadāre asmat
analyzed: mā u su adya durhaṇāvān sāyam karadāre asmat
translated: Do not be like a wicked husband to us today, O Indra, in the evening,

analyzed: aśrīraḥ iva jāmātā
translated: Like an inauspicious son-in-law

analyzed: vidma hi asya vīrasya bhūri dāvarīm sumatim
translated: For we know the abundant favor of this hero,

analyzed: triṣu jātasya manāṃsi
translated: The thoughts of the one born in three places

original: ā tū ṣiñca kaṇvamantaṃ na ghā vidma śavasānāt
analyzed: ā tu siñca kaṇvamantam na ghā vidma śavasānāt
translated: Pour out to him who has Kaṇva's spirit, for we know none greater in strength

analyzed: yaśastaram śatamūteḥ
translated: Than the hundredfold one

analyzed: jyeṣṭhena sotar indrāya somam vīrāya śakrāya
translated: With the eldest, O Indra, pour out the Soma to the hero, to Śakra

analyzed: bharā piban naryāya
translated: Drinking the milk for manly strength

original: yo vediṣṭho avyathiṣvaśvāvantaṃ jaritṛbhyaḥ🔽vājaṃ stotṛbhyo gomantam
analyzed: yaḥ vediṣṭhaḥ a vyathiṣu aśvāvantam jaritṛbhyaḥ  vājam stotṛbhyaḥ gomantam
translated: Who, most worthy of worship, for the singers🔽Bring the prize, the steed, with milk

analyzed: panyampanyamit sotāraḥ ā dhāvata madyāya
translated: Pour on, pour on the Soma for the rapture, O pressers,

analyzed: somam vīraya śūraya
translated: Soma for the hero, O hero

original: pātā vṛtrahā sutamā ghā gaman nāre asmat
analyzed: pātā vṛtrahā sutamā ghā gamat nā āre asmat

analyzed: yābhiḥ narā trasadasi umāvatam kṛtvye dhane

analyzed: tābhiḥ su asmān aśvinā prāvatam vājasātaye

analyzed: pra asmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ yuyutam yāḥ arātayaḥ

analyzed: ye vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ
translated: The sages who have tested your deeds, O Aśvins,

analyzed: eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam

analyzed: ayam vām gharmaḥ aśvinā stomena pari sicyate

analyzed: ayam somaḥ madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtram ciketathaḥ

analyzed: yat apsu yat vanaspatau yat oṣadhīṣu puru daṃsasā kṛtam

analyzed: ā nūnam raghu vartanim ratham tiṣṭhāthaḥ aśvinā

analyzed: yat vā vāṇībhiḥ aśvinā iva id kāṇvasya bodhatam

analyzed: pṛthī yat vām vainyaḥ sādaneṣu eva idataḥ aśvinā cetayethām

analyzed: varti stokāya tanayāya yātam

translated: We, O Indra, sing praises to thee

original: achā ca tvainā namasā vadāmasi kiṃ muhuścid vi dīdhayaḥ
analyzed: achā ca tvā enā namasā vadāmasi kim muhuścit vi dīdhayaḥ
translated: And with homage we address thee. What is there to think twice about?

original: santi kāmāso harivo dadiṣ ṭvaṃ smo vayaṃ santi no dhiyaḥ
analyzed: santi kāmāsaḥ harivas dadiḥ tvam smaḥ vayam santi naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: The desires are thine, O lord of bays, to give. We are thine, and our thoughts are thine.

original: nūtnā idindra te vayamūtī abhūma nahi nū te adrivaḥ
analyzed: nūtnāḥ id indra te vayam ūtī abhūma nahi nu te adrivas
translated: O Indra, we have become thy new helpers. For we are not thine, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

analyzed: vidma purā parīṇasaḥ
translated: We know of the former troubles.

original: vidmā sakhitvamuta śūra bhojyamā te tā vajrinnīmahe
analyzed: vidma sakhi tvam uta śūra bhojyam ā te tā vajrin nīmahe
translated: We know the friendship and the feast of the hero. We ask thee for these, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: uto samasminnā śiśīhi no vaso vāje suśipra gomati
analyzed: uta u samasmin ā śiśīhi naḥ vaso vāje su śipra gomati
translated: And in this (battle) sharpen us, O bountiful one, in the contest, O thou of fair visage, for the sake of the possession of cattle.

original: yo na idamidaṃ purā pra vasya ānināya tamu va stuṣe
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe
translated: He who in the past has brought us this and that good thing, him I will praise.

original: sakhāya indramūtaye🔽haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indramūtaye  haryaśvam satpatim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata
translated: O friends, Indra for help🔽The lord of the people, whose horses are the two bay (steeds), for he has gladdened us.

original: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyamaśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam
analyzed: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam
translated: May the bountiful one, for the singers, extend to a hundredfold the possession of cattle and horses.

original: tvayā ha svid yujā vayaṃ prati śvasantaṃ vṛṣabha bruvīmahi
analyzed: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam prati śvasantam vṛṣabha bruvīmahi
translated: O bull, with thee as our ally we would speak to the panting one

original: saṃsthe janasya gomataḥ🔽jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇo 'bhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ
analyzed: saṃsthe janasya gomataḥ  jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇaḥ bhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ
translated: in the gathering of the people rich in cattle🔽We would win the forts, O much-invoked one, and overcome the wicked ones

original: nṛbhirvṛtraṃ hanyāma śūśuyāma cāverindra pra ṇo dhiyaḥ
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ vṛtram hanyāma śūśuyāma ca aveḥ indra pra naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: We would slay Vrtra with heroes, and rejoice, O Indra, impel our thoughts

analyzed: a bhrātṛvyaḥ anā tvam anāpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi
translated: Thou art without a rival, O Indra, from birth, without an enemy, from the beginning

analyzed: yudhā idāpi tvam ichase
translated: Thou seekest to win the lordship of the fight

original: nakī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
analyzed: nakir revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
translated: Thou dost not find a friend who is so rich, they drink thy Soma, O good charioteer

original: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṃ samūhasyādit piteva hūyase
analyzed: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanum samūhasya adit pitā iva hūyase
translated: When thou makest the river swell, O father, thou art invoked

original: mā te amājuro yathā mūrāsa indra sakhye tvāvataḥ
analyzed: mā te amājuraḥ yathā mūrāsaḥ indra sakhye tvāvataḥ
translated: Let not thy friends, O Indra, like the foolish, be childless in thy friendship

original: ni ṣadāma sacā sute🔽mā te godatra nirarāma rādhasa indra mā te gṛhāmahi
analyzed: ni ṣadāma sacā sute  mā te go datra nirarāma rādhasaḥ indra mā te gṛhāmahi
translated: Let us sit together by the pressed (Soma)🔽Let not thy bounty, O giver of cattle, be far from us, O Indra, let not thy house

original: dṛḷhā cidaryaḥ pra mṛśābhyā bhara na te dāmāna ādabhe
analyzed: dṛḍhā cidaryaḥ pra mṛśa ābhyā bhara na te dāmānaḥ ādabhe
translated: Even the strong foe thou wouldst crush, I do not transgress thy bond

original: indro vā ghediyan maghaṃ sarasvatī vā subhagā dadirvasu
analyzed: indraḥ vā ghediyat magham sarasvatī vā subhagā dadiḥ vasu

analyzed: tvam vā citra dāśuṣe
translated: Or thou, O wondrous one, to the worshipper

original: citra id rājā rājakā idanyake yake sarasvatīmanu
analyzed: citraḥ id rājā rājakāḥ id anyake yake sarasvatīm anu
translated: The wondrous king, the other kings, the people, according to the will of Sarasvatî

original: parjanya iva tatanad dhi vṛṣṭyā sahasramayutā dadat
analyzed: parjanyaḥ iva tatanat hi vṛṣṭyā sahasram ayutā dadat
translated: Like Parjanya spreading with rain, giving thousands and myriads

analyzed: ā u tyam ahve ā ratham adya daṃsiṣṭhamūtaye
translated: Today you have called the most bountiful chariot for help

original: yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ
analyzed: yam aśvinā su havā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ
translated: You, O Aśvins, who are easily invoked, who follow Rudra, have stood by the sun

original: pūrvāyuṣaṃ suhavaṃ puruspṛhaṃ bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrvyam
analyzed: pūrva āyuṣam su havam puruspṛham bhujyum vājeṣu pūrvyam
translated: The prosperous, easily invoked, much-desired, powerful one in battles, the ancient one

analyzed: sacanāvantam sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasam anehasam  iha tyā puru bhūtamā devā namobhiḥ aśvinā

analyzed: arvācīnā su avase karāmahe gantārā daśuṣaḥ gṛham
translated: We make you come hither, O lords of splendor, to the house of the worshipper, with our own power

analyzed: yuvoḥ rathasya pari cakramīyataḥ īrmānyat vā amiṣaṇyati

analyzed: asmān achā sumatiḥ vām śubhaḥ patī ā dhenuḥ iva dhāvatu

analyzed: rathaḥ yaḥ vām tri vandhuraḥ hiraṇya bhīśuḥ aśvinā

analyzed: tā vām adya sumatibhiḥ śubhaḥ patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi

analyzed: upa naḥ vajinīvasū yātam ṛtasya pathibhiḥ

analyzed: ayam vām adribhiḥ sutaḥ somaḥ nara vṛṣaṇvasu

analyzed: yat adhrigāvaḥ adhrigū idā cit ahnaḥ aśvinā havāmahe

analyzed: tau id doṣā tau uṣasi śubhaḥ patī tā yāman rudravartanī

analyzed: mā naḥ martāya ripave vājinīvasū paras rudrāvati khyatam

analyzed: ā sugmyāya sugmyam prātar rathena aśvinā vā sakṣaṇī

analyzed: huve pitā iva sobharī

analyzed: ārāttāt cit bhūtam asme avase purvībhiḥ puru bhojasā  ā naḥ aśvāvat aśvinā vartiḥ yāsiṣṭam madhu pātamā narā

analyzed: gomat dasrā hiraṇyavat
translated: O you who possess horses, O you who are rich in horses, O you who are rich in cows, O you who are rich in gold

analyzed: su prāvargam su vīryam suṣṭhu vāryam anādhṛṣṭam rakṣasvinā
translated: O you who are rich in good choice, good strength, good excellent food, not to be assailed by the Raksases

analyzed: asmin ā vāmāyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
translated: in this most excellent chariot, O you who are rich in wealth, we will think of all good things

analyzed: cariṣṇu dhūmam a gṛbhīta śociṣam

analyzed: dāmānam viśvacarṣaṇe gnim viśvamanaḥ girā

original: uta stuṣe viṣpardhaso rathānām🔽yeṣāmābādha ṛgmiya iṣaḥ pṛkṣaśca nigrabhe
analyzed: uta stuṣe viṣpardhasaḥ rathānām  yeṣām ābādhaḥ ṛgmiyaḥ iṣaḥ pṛkṣaḥ ca nigrabhe

analyzed: upavidā ahniḥ vindate vasu  udasya śociḥ asthāt dīdiyuṣaḥ vyajaram
translated: the all-knowing Agni finds wealth🔽his bright flame has arisen, shining, unaging

analyzed: tapuḥ jambhasya su dyutaḥ gaṇa śriyaḥ

analyzed: udu tiṣṭha su adhvara stavānaḥ devyā kṛpā

analyzed: abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ

analyzed: agne yāhi su śastibhiḥ havyā juhvānaḥ ānuṣak

analyzed: yathā dūtaḥ babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ

analyzed: agnim vaḥ pūrvyam huve hotāram carṣaṇīnām

analyzed: mitram na jane sudhitam ṛtāvani

analyzed: ṛtāvānam ṛtāyavaḥ yajñasya sādhanam girā

analyzed: upa u enam jujuṣuḥ namasaḥ pade

analyzed: achā naḥ aṅgirastamam yajñāsaḥ yantu saṃyataḥ
translated: Let the sacrificial rites come to him, well-controlled,

analyzed: hotā yaḥ asti vikṣvā yaśastamaḥ
translated: The priest who is most famous among all people.

original: agne tava tye ajarendhānāso bṛhad bhāḥ
analyzed: agne tava tye ajara indhānāsaḥ bṛhat bhās
translated: O Agni, these thy ancient kindlers, O imperishable one, have great light,

analyzed: aśvāḥ iva vṛṣaṇaḥ taviṣīyavaḥ

analyzed: sa tvam naḥ ūrjām pate rayim rāsva su vīryam

analyzed: prāva naḥ toke tanaye samatsva

analyzed: yat vai u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ su prītaḥ manuṣaḥ visi

analyzed: viśvedagniḥ prati rakṣāṃsi sedhati

original: śruṣṭyagne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate
analyzed: śruṣṭi agne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate

analyzed: ni māyinaḥ tapuṣa rakṣasaḥ daha

original: na tasya māyayā cana ripurīśīta martyaḥ
analyzed: na tasya māyayā cana ripuḥ īśīta martyaḥ

analyzed: yaḥ agnaye dadāśa havya dātibhiḥ

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ
translated: The Rṣi Vyāṣva, the seeker of wealth, has gratified you,

analyzed: mahaḥ rayā itamu tvā samidhīmahi

analyzed: bhūri poṣam sa dhatte vīravat yaśaḥ

analyzed: nūnam arca vihāyase stomebhiḥ sthūra yūpa vat

analyzed: ṛṣe vaiyaśva damyāya agnaye

analyzed: atithim mānuṣāṇām sūnum vanaspatīnām

analyzed: viprāḥ agnim avase pratnam īḍate

analyzed: mahaḥ viśvān abhi sataḥ bhi havyāni mānuṣā
translated: Overpowering all great offerings of humans

analyzed: agne ni satsi namasā adhi barhiṣi

original: vaṃsvā no vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ
analyzed: vaṃsva naḥ vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ

analyzed: su vīryasya prajāvataḥ yaśasvataḥ

analyzed: viṣu druhā iva yajñam ūhathuḥ girā
translated: Like two ploughmen you yoke the sacrifice with your song

original: vāhiṣṭho vāṃ havānāṃ stomo dūto huvan narā
analyzed: vāhiṣṭhaḥ vām havānām stomaḥ dūtaḥ huvat narā
translated: Best bearer of our calls, the hymn, the messenger, O Heroes, is invoked

analyzed: yuvābhyām bhūtu aśvinā
translated: To you, O Aśvins, as young men

original: yadado divo arṇava iṣo va madatho gṛhe
analyzed: yat adaḥ divaḥ arṇave iṣaḥ vaḥ madathaḥ gṛhe
translated: When, O ye bounteous ones, ye rejoice in the wave of heaven and in food in the house

analyzed: śrutamin me amartyā
translated: Famous with me, O Immortals

original: uta syā śvetayāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vāṃ nadīnām
analyzed: uta syā śveta yāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vām nadīnām
translated: And may the most rapid of your rivers, with white waves,

analyzed: sindhuḥ hiraṇya vartaniḥ
translated: The river with golden windings,

analyzed: smat etaya su kīrtyā aśvinā śvetayā dhiyā
translated: With this fair fame, O Aśvins, with the white thought

analyzed: vahethe śubhra yāvānā
translated: Ye are to be borne away, O ye of fair gifts

original: yukṣvā hi tvaṃ rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso
analyzed: yukṣvā hi tvam rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso
translated: Yoke thou, O thou who art strong in chariots, prosper thou, O good one, for increase

original: ān no vāyo madhu pibāsmākaṃ savanā gahi
analyzed: āt naḥ vāyo madhu piba asmākam savanā gahi
translated: Drink the sweet drink, O Vâyu, come to our libations

analyzed: tava vāyo ṛtaspate tvaṣṭuḥ jāmātar adbhuta
translated: O Vâyu, of thee, O lord of truth, the son-in-law of Tvastr, wondrous,

analyzed: avāṃsyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose the most acceptable

analyzed: tvaṣṭuḥ jāmātaram vayam īśānam rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: We implore the son-in-law of Tvastr, the lord of wealth,

analyzed: sutāvantaḥ vayum dyumnā janāsaḥ
translated: The people with the pressed (Soma) and with bright glory

original: vāyo yāhi śivā divo vahasva su svaśvyam
analyzed: vāyo yāhi śiva ā divaḥ vahasva su su aśvyam
translated: O Vâyu, come with the blessings of heaven, bring the good gift of horses

analyzed: vahasva mahaḥ pṛthu pakṣasā rathe
translated: Bring on the chariot the great one with wide wings

analyzed: tvām hi su psarastamam nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe
translated: For we invoke thee, O best of the sweet, in the assemblies of men

original: grāvāṇaṃ nāśvapṛṣṭhaṃ maṃhanā🔽sa tvaṃ no deva manasā vāyo mandāno agriyaḥ
analyzed: grāvāṇam na aśva pṛṣṭham maṃhanā  sa tvam naḥ deva manasā vāyo mandānaḥ agriyaḥ
translated: Like a stone, like a horse's back, with abundance🔽Do thou, O god Vâyu, being gladdened in thy spirit, O firstborn,

analyzed: kṛdhi vājānapaḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Make our thoughts rich in food and strength

analyzed: agniḥ ukthe purohitaḥ grāvāṇaḥ barhiḥ adhvare
translated: Agni is the priest in the praise, the pressing-stones in the sacrifice, the sacred grass in the rite

original: ṛcā yāmi maruto brahmaṇas patiṃ devānavo vareṇyam
analyzed: ṛcā yāmi marutaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patim devānavaḥ vareṇyam
translated: With the Rc I invoke the Maruts, the lord of prayer, the gods, the desirable one

original: ā paśuṃ gāsi pṛthivīṃ vanaspatīnuṣāsā naktamoṣadhīḥ
analyzed: ā paśum gāsi pṛthivīm vanaspatīn uṣāsā naktam oṣadhīḥ
translated: I call to the animal, to the earth, to the trees, to the dawns, to the night, to the plants

original: viśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso dhīnāṃ bhūta prāvitāraḥ
analyzed: viśve ca naḥ vasavaḥ viśva vedasaḥ dhīnām bhūta prāvitāraḥ
translated: And may all the Vasus, who know all, be the promoters of our thoughts

original: pra sū na etvadhvaro 'gnā deveṣu pūrvyaḥ🔽ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛtavrate marutsu viśvabhānuṣu
analyzed: pra su naḥ etu adhvaraḥ gnāḥ deveṣu pūrvyaḥ  ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛta vrate marutsu viśva bhānuṣu
translated: May the Adhvara come to us, O Agni, the ancient one among the gods🔽Among the Adityas, among Varuna of firm vow, among the Maruts who shine everywhere

original: viśve hi ṣmā manave viśvavedaso bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ
analyzed: viśve hi sma manave viśva vedasaḥ bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ
translated: For they are all the all-knowing ones for Manu, for prosperity, the destroyers of enemies

analyzed: ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ viśva vedasaḥ yanta naḥ vṛkam chardiḥ
translated: With your unfailing protections, O all-knowing ones, provide us with a home free from injury

original: ā no adya samanaso gantā viśve sajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ adya samanasaḥ ganta viśve sajoṣasaḥ
translated: May all of you come to us today with one mind, all of you with the same intention

original: ṛcā girā maruto devyadite sadane pastye mahi
analyzed: ṛcā girā marutaḥ devi adite sadane pastye mahi
translated: O Maruts, with the Rc verse, with the song, O divine Aditi, in the house, in the dwelling, in the great one

original: abhi priyā maruto yā vo aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana
analyzed: abhi priyā marutaḥ yā vaḥ aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana
translated: O Maruts, to your dear ones, to your horses, to your offerings, O Mitra, you go

original: ābarhirindro varuṇasturā nara ādityāso sadantu naḥ
analyzed: ābarhiḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ turāḥ naraḥ ādityāsaḥ sadantu naḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuna, the impetuous men, the Adityas sit with us on the sacred grass

analyzed: vayam vaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ hita prayasaḥ ānuṣak
translated: We, with well-prepared sacrificial grass, with well-prepared food, in due order

analyzed: suta somāsaḥ varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvat iddha agnayaḥ
translated: With Soma pressed, O Varuna, we invoke you, with fires kindled like Manu,

original: ā pra yāta maruto viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā
analyzed: ā pra yāta marutaḥ viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā
translated: Come, O Maruts, Vishnu, Asvins, and you, O bountiful one, with your most kindly thought.

original: indra ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhirvṛṣā yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe🔽vi no devāso adruho 'chidraṃ śarma yachata
analyzed: indraḥ ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhiḥ vṛṣā yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe  vi naḥ devāsaḥ adruhaḥ chidram śarma yacchata
translated: Let Indra come first, the strong, the Vr̥itra-slayer, whom we must praise with those who long for booty.🔽Ye Gods, vouchsafe us shelter free from sorrow, which, O ye Vasus, neither near nor distant.

original: na yad dūrād vasavo nū cidantito varūthamādadharṣati
analyzed: na yat dūrāt vasavaḥ nu cit antitas varūtham ādadharṣati
translated: Can injure, which no foe can overthrow.

original: asti hi vaḥ sajātyaṃ riśādaso devāso astyāpyam
analyzed: asti hi vaḥ sajātyam riśādasaḥ devāsaḥ asti āpyam
translated: For with you is kinship, O ye R̥ishislayers, and with the Gods is help.

original: pra ṇaḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase🔽idā hi va upastutimidā vāmasya bhaktaye🔽upa vo viśvavedaso namasyurānasṛkṣyanyāmiva
analyzed: pra naḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase  idā hi vaḥ upastutim idā vāmasya bhaktaye  upa vaḥ viśva vedasaḥ namasyuḥ ānasṛkṣyan yām iva
translated: Speak to us for that earliest bliss of ours, that we may gain new happiness.🔽For now is the time to praise you, now to give you of our best.🔽To you, O ye who know all wealth, I come with adoration, as to one who is most near.

original: udu ṣya vaḥ savitā supraṇītayo 'sthādūrdhvo vareṇyaḥ
analyzed: udu sya vaḥ savitā su praṇītayaḥ sthāt ūrdhvaḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: Now hath your Savitar risen, well-guided, high, excellent,

analyzed: ni dvipādaḥ catuṣpādaḥ arthinaḥ viśran patayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: The bipeds and the quadrupeds have settled down, the eager, restless creatures, for their needs.

analyzed: devam devam vaḥ vase devam devam abhiṣṭaye
translated: To each God for your aid, to each God for your praise,

original: devaṃdevaṃ huvema vājasātaye gṛṇanto devyā dhiyā
analyzed: devam devam huvema vājasātaye gṛṇantaḥ devyā dhiyā
translated: To each God let us pray, singing with holy song for the sake of strength.

original: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākaṃ sarātayaḥ
analyzed: devāsaḥ hi sma manave samanyavaḥ viśve sākam sa rātayaḥ
translated: For the Gods are of one mind with Manu, all the Gods are our allies.

original: te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ
analyzed: te naḥ adya te aparam tuce tu naḥ bhavantu varivaḥ vidaḥ
translated: Be they our helpers now and hereafter: may they be bounteous unto us.

analyzed: pra vaḥ śaṃsāmi adruhaḥ saṃsthe upastutīnām
translated: I proclaim you, O ye who are free from guile, in the assembly of the praisers.

original: na taṃ dhūrtirvaruṇa mitra martyaṃ yo vo dhāmabhyo 'vidhat
analyzed: na tam dhūrtiḥ varuṇa mitra martyam yaḥ vaḥ dhāmabhyaḥ vidhat
translated: That mortal, O Varuna and Mitra, whom ye have not deprived of your abodes,

original: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati🔽pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas paryariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate
analyzed: pra sa kṣayam tirate vi mahī riṣaḥ yaḥ vaḥ varāya dāśati  pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ paryariṣṭaḥ sarvaḥ edhate
translated: He passes over the place of destruction, and the great treasures, who offers you for a boon.🔽He is born again and again through offspring, and is prosperous in the observance of the law. He prospers in every way.

analyzed: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sugebhiḥ yāti adhvanaḥ
translated: By the good paths he goes on his way, winning the battle without (the help of) the bow.

original: aryamā mitrovaruṇaḥ sarātayo yaṃ trāyante sajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: aryamā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ sa rātayaḥ yam trāyante sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, the allies, who protect him in unison,

original: ajre cidasmai kṛṇuthā nyañcanaṃ durge cidā susaraṇam
analyzed: ajre cit asmai kṛṇutha nyañcanam durge cit ā su saraṇam
translated: Even on the steep path make ye a downward slope, and on the difficult path an easy one.

original: eṣā cidasmādaśaniḥ paro nu sāsredhantī vi naśyatu
analyzed: eṣā cit asmāt aśaniḥ paras nu sā a sredhantī vi naśyatu
translated: Even from him may this dart of the lightning, flying afar, be turned away.

original: yadadya sūrya udyati priyakṣatrā ṛtaṃ dadha
analyzed: yat adya sūrye udyati priya kṣatrāḥ ṛtam
translated: Whatsoever, O ye of righteous sway, ye establish as the law, when the sun rises today,

original: yan nimruci prabudhi viśvavedaso yad vā madhyandine divaḥ
analyzed: yat nimruci prabudhi viśva vedasaḥ yat vā madhyandine divaḥ
translated: Whatsoever, O ye all-knowing ones, ye awaken at the time of setting, or at midday of the day,

original: yad vābhipitve asurā ṛtaṃ yate chardiryema vi dāśuṣe
analyzed: yat vā abhipitve asurāḥ ṛtam yate chardiḥ yema vi dāśuṣe
translated: Or whatsoever, O ye Asuras, ye establish as the law at the time of the evening libation, for the worshipper to go on his way,

original: vayaṃ tad vo vasavo viśvavedasa upa stheyāma madhya ā
analyzed: vayam tat vaḥ vasavaḥ viśva vedasaḥ upa stheyāma madhye ā
translated: That, O ye Vasus, all-knowing ones, we may attain to in your lap,

original: yadadya sūra udite yan madhyandina ātuci
analyzed: yat adya sūre udite yat madhyandine ātuci
translated: Whatsoever, O ye of righteous sway, ye establish as the law, when the sun rises today, or at midday, or in the evening,

original: vāmaṃ dhattha manave viśvavedaso juhvānāya pracetase
analyzed: vāmam dhattha manave viśva vedasaḥ juhvānāya pracetase
translated: You have the left for Manu, O all-knowing ones, for the offering priest, for the wise one

original: vayaṃ tad vaḥ samrāja ā vṛṇīmahe putro na bahupāyyam
analyzed: vayam tat vaḥ samrājaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe putraḥ na bahu pāyyam
translated: We choose that from you, O kings, as a son chooses his father's wealth

analyzed: aśyāma tat ādityāḥ juhvataḥ haviḥ yena vasyaḥ naśāmahai
translated: May we obtain that, O Ādityas, the oblation of the offerer, by which we may attain what is better

original: ye triṃśati trayas paro devāso barhirāsadan
analyzed: ye triṃśati trayaḥ paras devāsaḥ barhiḥ āsadan
translated: Those thirty-three gods who have sat down on the sacrificial grass

analyzed: vidan ahat vita asanan  varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā smat rātiṣācaḥ agnayaḥ
translated: knowing the two-fold hospitality🔽Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the bountiful fires

analyzed: patnīvantaḥ vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ
translated: accompanied by their wives, with the exclamation Vasat!

original: te no gopā apācyāsta udak ta itthā nyak
analyzed: te naḥ gopāḥ apācyāḥ te udak te itthā nyak
translated: They are our protectors in the west, in the north, here below

analyzed: purastāt sarvayā viśā
translated: in the east, with the whole people

original: yathā vaśanti devāstathedasat tadeṣāṃ nakirā minat
analyzed: yathā devāḥ tathā id asat tat eṣām nakirā minat
translated: As the gods wish, so let it be. None of them can thwart it

original: arāvā cana martyaḥ🔽saptānāṃ sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnānyeṣām
analyzed: arāvā cana martyaḥ  saptānām sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnāni eṣām
translated: Not even an immortal man🔽The seven have seven spears, they have seven kinds of glory

analyzed: sapta u adhi śriyaḥ dhire
translated: Seven are established in their splendor

analyzed: babhruḥ ekaḥ viṣuṇaḥ sūnaraḥ yuvān jyaṅkte hiraṇyayam
translated: One is brown, one is piercing, one is a young man. He anoints the golden one

original: yonimeka ā sasāda dyotano 'ntardeveṣu medhiraḥ🔽vāśīmeko bibharti hasta āyasīmantardeveṣu nidhruviḥ
analyzed: yonim ekaḥ ā sasāda dyotanaḥ ntar deveṣu medhiraḥ  vāśīm ekaḥ bibharti haste āyasīm antar deveṣu nidhruviḥ
translated: One has sat down in the luminous one, the womb, among the gods, the wise one🔽One bears in his hand the iron one, the axe. He is firmly established among the gods

original: vajrameko bibharti hasta āhitaṃ tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate
analyzed: vajram ekaḥ bibharti haste āhitam tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: One bears in his hand the weapon, the thunderbolt. With it he slays the Vr̥itras

original: tigmameko bibharti hasta āyudhaṃ śucirugro jalāṣabheṣajaḥ
analyzed: tigmam ekaḥ bibharti haste āyudham śuciḥ ugraḥ jalāṣa bheṣajaḥ
translated: One alone bears in his hand a sharp weapon, pure, terrible, the medicine for the water-born.

original: patha ekaḥ pīpāya taskaro yathā eṣa veda nidhīnām
analyzed: pathaḥ ekaḥ pīpāya taskaraḥ yathā eṣa veda nidhīnām
translated: One alone has gone forth on his way, like a thief; he knows the treasures.

original: trīṇyeka urugāyo vi cakrame yatra devāso madanti
analyzed: trīṇi ekaḥ urugāyaḥ vi cakrame yatra devāsaḥ madanti
translated: One, the far-striding one, has gone forth over the three; where the gods rejoice.

original: vibhirdvā carata ekayā saha pra pravāseva vasataḥ
analyzed: vibhiḥ dvā carataḥ ekayā saha pra pravāsā iva vasataḥ
translated: With two he moves, with one; they dwell like those who dwell far away.

original: sado dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpirāsutī
analyzed: sadaḥ dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpiḥ āsutī
translated: They have made two seats, a model in the sky; the two kings, rich in ghee.

original: arcanta eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryamarocayan
analyzed: arcantaḥ eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryam arocayan
translated: Some have praised the great Sāman, by that they have made the sun shine.

original: nahi vo astyarbhako devāso na kumārakaḥ
analyzed: nahi vaḥ asti arbhakaḥ devāsaḥ na kumārakaḥ
translated: For you, O gods, there is no youth, no boy.

analyzed: viśve satomahāntaḥ id
translated: All of you are great, indeed.

original: iti stutāso asathā riśādaso ye stha trayaśca triṃśacca
analyzed: iti stutāsaḥ asatha riśādasaḥ ye stha trayaḥ ca triṃśat ca
translated: Thus praised, you have sat down, O you who destroy evil, you who are thirty-three,

analyzed: manoḥ devāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: O gods who are worthy of sacrifice.

original: te nastrādhvaṃ te 'vata ta u no adhi vocata
analyzed: te naḥ trādhvam te vata te u naḥ adhi vocata
translated: Do you protect us, do you deliver us, do you speak to us.

original: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryān mānavādadhi dūraṃ naiṣṭa parāvataḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryāt mānavāt adhi dūram naiṣṭa parāvataḥ
translated: Do not lead us far away from the path of our fathers, from the path of men, to a distant place.

original: ye devāsa iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarā uta
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarāḥ uta
translated: O you gods who dwell here, all of you, and also the all-pervading ones,

analyzed: asmabhyam śarma saprathaḥ gave śvāya yacchata
translated: Grant us wide protection for the cow and the horse.

original: yo yajāti yajāta it sunavacca pacāti ca
analyzed: yaḥ yajāti yajāte id sunavat ca pacāti ca
translated: He who sacrifices, who has sacrificed, who grinds and cooks,

analyzed: brahmā id indrasya cākanat
translated: Has desired the Brahman of Indra.

original: puroḷāśaṃ yo asmai somaṃ rarata āśiram
analyzed: puroḷāśam yaḥ asmai somam rarate āśiram
translated: He who has offered to him the cake, the Soma, and the libation,

analyzed: pādit tam śakraḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: Shakra has delivered him from distress.

original: tasya dyumānasad ratho devajūtaḥ sa śūśuvat
analyzed: tasya dyumān asat rathaḥ deva jūtaḥ sa śūśuvat
translated: His radiant chariot sits in the seat, urged by the gods, it speeds on,

analyzed: viśvā vanvan amitriyā
translated: Conquering all enemies.

analyzed: asya prajāvatī gṛhe saścantī dive dive
translated: In his house, rich in offspring, the unfailing

analyzed: iḍā dhenumatī duhe
translated: Iḷā milks the cow that yields abundantly.

original: yā dampatī samanasā sunuta ā ca dhāvataḥ
analyzed: yā dampatī samanasā sunutaḥ ā ca dhāvataḥ
translated: The two who pour libations with one mind and run together,

analyzed: devāsaḥ nityayā āśirā
translated: The gods who are ever to be invoked,

analyzed: prati prāśa vyānitaḥ samyañcā barhiḥ āśāte
translated: Facing each other, sit on the strewn grass, ready to be tasted,

analyzed: na tā vājeṣu vāyataḥ
translated: They are not to be hindered in their strength.

original: na devānāmapi hnutaḥ sumatiṃ na jugukṣataḥ
analyzed: na devānām api hnutaḥ sumatim na jugukṣataḥ
translated: They do not diminish the favor or the desire to give of the gods,

analyzed: śravaḥ bṛhat vivāsataḥ
translated: They dwell in great fame.

analyzed: putriṇā tā kumāriṇā viśvam āyuḥ vyaśnutaḥ
translated: The two with sons and grandsons enjoy the whole life,

analyzed: ubhā hiraṇya peśasā  vītihotrā kṛtadvasū daśasyantā amṛtāya kam
translated: Both of them with golden cheeks.🔽The two who have made much wealth, the two who have offered oblations, may they honor the immortal one.

original: samudho romaśaṃ hato deveṣū kṛṇuto duvaḥ
analyzed: samudhaḥ romaśam hataḥ deva iṣū kṛṇutaḥ duvaḥ
translated: The two who have made the ocean and the hairy one subject, have performed service to the gods.

analyzed: ā śarma parvatānām vṛṇīmahe nadīnām
translated: We choose the protection of the mountains and the rivers,

analyzed: ā viṣṇoḥ sacābhuvaḥ
translated: And of Vishnu who shares the same abode.

analyzed: aitu pūṣā rayiḥ bhagaḥ svasti sarva dhātamaḥ
translated: May Pūṣan, wealth, and Bhaga come, most auspicious of all givers,

analyzed: uru radhvā svastaye
translated: For wide prosperity.

analyzed: aramatiḥ anarvaṇaḥ viśvaḥ devasya manasā
translated: The blameless one, all of the god's mind,

analyzed: ādityānām anehait
translated: Has come to the Ādityas here.

original: yathā no mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ santi gopāḥ
analyzed: yathā naḥ mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ santi gopāḥ
translated: As Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna are our guardians,

analyzed: su gāḥ ṛtasya panthāḥ

analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam narā

analyzed: prātaryāvabhiḥ ā gatam devebhiḥ jenyāvasū
translated: Come with the morning offerings, O you who are to be gained by the gods, O you who are rich in treasures,

analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: O Indra and Agni, for the drinking of Soma!

analyzed: śyāvāśvasya sunvataḥ trīṇām śṛṇutam havam
translated: Listen to the call of Shyavasha, the son of Atri, who is pressing (Soma),

analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: O Indra and Agni, for the drinking of Soma!

original: evā vāmahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ🔽indragnī somapītaye
analyzed: eva vāmahve ūtaye yathā ahuvanta medhirāḥ  indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: Thus I call you for help, as the wise ones have called,🔽O Indra and Agni, for the drinking of Soma!

analyzed: ā aham sarasvatīvatoḥ indra agnyoḥ avaḥ vṛṇe
translated: I choose the favor of Sarasvati, of Indra and Agni,

analyzed: yābhyām gāyatram ṛcyate
translated: By whom the Gayatri is chanted in the Rigveda.

analyzed: agnim astoṣi ṛgmiyam agnimīḍā yajadhyai
translated: I will praise Agni, the worthy of praise, I will worship Agni with the Rig.

original: agnirdevānanaktu na ubhe hi vidathe kavirantaścarati dūtyaṃ nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: agniḥ devān anaktu naḥ ubhe hi vidathe kaviḥ antar carati dūtyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: May Agni announce us to the gods, for he is the wise one in both assemblies, moving between them as a messenger. Let the others perish in the conflict.

analyzed: nyagne navyasā vacaḥ tanūṣu śaṃsam eṣām
translated: O Agni, with the new hymn, spare their bodies,

original: nyarātī rarāvṇāṃ viśvā aryo arātīrito yuchantvāmuro nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: nyarātīḥ viśvāḥ aryaḥ arātīḥ itas yuchantu āmuraḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: spare the evil-hearted, all the wicked foes. Let the demons be destroyed. Let them perish in the other world.

original: agne manmāni tubhyaṃ kaṃ ghṛtaṃ na juhva āsani
analyzed: agne manmāni tubhyam kam ghṛtam na juhve āsani
translated: O Agni, I offer to thee in the flame the oblation of ghee according to thy wishes.

original: sa deveṣu pra cikiddhi tvaṃ hyasi pūrvyaḥ śivo dūto vivasvato nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa deveṣu pra cikiddhi tvam hi asi pūrvyaḥ śivaḥ dūtaḥ vivasvataḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: Do thou think upon the gods, for thou art the ancient, the auspicious messenger of Vivasvat. Let the demons be destroyed. Let them perish in the other world.

analyzed: tat tat agniḥ vayaḥ dadhe yathā yathā kṛpaṇyati
translated: This and that Agni takes to himself as he is worshipped.

original: ūrjāhutirvasūnāṃ śaṃ ca yośca mayo dadhe viśvasyai devahūtyai nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: ūrjā āhutiḥ vasūnām śam ca yoḥ ca mayaḥ dadhe viśvasyai deva hūtyai nabhantām anyake same
translated: He has taken the oblation of strength of the Vasus, and the welfare of men, for the invocation of all the gods. Let the demons be destroyed. Let them perish in the other world.

analyzed: sa ciketa sahīyasā agniḥ citreṇa karmaṇā
translated: He has thought with a greater thought, Agni, with his wondrous work.

original: sa hotā śaśvatīnāṃ dakṣiṇābhirabhīvṛta inoti ca pratīvyaṃ nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa hotā śaśvatīnām dakṣiṇābhiḥ abhīvṛtaḥ inoti ca pratīvyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the priest, is surrounded by the perpetual sacrificial fees. He wins the prize and the return. Let the demons be destroyed. Let them perish in the other world.

analyzed: agniḥ jātāḥ devānām agniḥ veda martānām apīcyam
translated: Agni is born as the god of the gods, Agni knows the mortal's secret.

original: agniḥsa draviṇodā agnirdvārā vyūrṇute svāhuto navīyasā nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: agniḥ sa draviṇaḥ dāḥ agniḥ dvārā vyūrṇute su āhutaḥ navīyasā nabhantām anyake same
translated: Agni is the giver of wealth, Agni opens the doors, well-offered, with the newer. Let the demons be destroyed. Let them perish in the other world.

analyzed: agniḥ deveṣu saṃvasuḥ sa vikṣu yajñiyāsu ā
translated: Agni among the gods is the possessor of wealth, he among the sacrificial clans.

original: sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvaṃ bhūmeva puṣyati devo deveṣu yajñiyo nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvam bhūmā iva puṣyati devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the wise one, nourishes all the people with joy, like the earth. Let the other gods perish in the assembly of the gods.

original: yo agniḥ saptamānuṣaḥ śrito viśveṣu sindhuṣu
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ sapta mānuṣaḥ śritaḥ viśveṣu sindhuṣu
translated: The Agni who is the seventh of men, who dwells in all the rivers,

original: tamāganma tripastyaṃ mandhāturdasyuhantamamagniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ nabhantāṃ anyake same
analyzed: tam āganma tri pastyam mandhātuḥ dasyu hantamam agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam nabhantām anyake same
translated: we have come to that Tripastya, the best slayer of the Dasyus of Mandhātṛ, to Agni, the ancient one, in the sacrifices. Let the other gods perish in the assembly of the gods.

original: agnistrīṇi tridhātūnyā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ sa trīnrekādaśāniha yakṣacca piprayacca no vipro dūtaḥ pariṣkṛto nabhantāmanyake
analyzed: agniḥ trīṇi tri dhātūni yā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ sa trīn rekādaśān iha yakṣat ca piprayat ca naḥ vipraḥ dūtaḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ nabhantām anyake
translated: Agni, the wise one, the knower of beings, dwells in three threefold abodes. He, the sage, the messenger, the purified one, should serve and favor us with three elevenfold (sacrifices). Let the other gods perish in the assembly of the gods.

original: tvaṃ no agna āyuṣu tvaṃ deveṣu pūrvya vasva eka irajyasi
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne āyuṣu tvam deveṣu pūrvya vasvaḥ ekaḥ irajyasi
translated: You, O Agni, among our lives, you, O ancient one, among the gods, rule alone over wealth.

original: tvāmāpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti svasetavo nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: tvām āpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti sva setavaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: The flowing waters go around you as your own servants. Let the other gods perish in the assembly of the gods.

original: indrāgnī yuvaṃ su naḥ sahantā dāsatho rayim
analyzed: indra agnī yuvam su naḥ sahantā dāsathaḥ rayim
translated: O Indra and Agni, you two, the strong ones, grant us wealth.

original: yena dṛḷhā samatsvā vīḷu cit sāhiṣīmahyagnirvaneva vāta in nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: yena dṛḍhā samatsva vīḍu cit sāhiṣīmahi agniḥ vanā iva vāte id nabhantām anyake same
translated: By which (wealth) we may conquer the strong in battles, even the powerful. Agni is like a forest fire. Let the other gods perish in the assembly of the gods.

original: nahi vāṃ vavrayāmahe 'thendramid yajāmahe śaviṣṭhaṃ nṛṇāṃ naram
analyzed: nahi vām thā indram id yajāmahe śaviṣṭham nṛṇām naram
translated: We do not choose you for our protection, but we worship Indra, the strongest man among men.

original: sa naḥ kadā cidarvatā gamadā vājasātayegamadā medhasātaye nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa naḥ kadā cit arvatā gamadāḥ vāja sātaye gamadāḥ medha sātaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: come to the winning of wisdom. Let the others perish in the conflict.

analyzed: tā hi madhyam bharāṇām indra agnī adhikṣitaḥ
translated: For these two are the middle of the burdens, O Indra and Agni, the overlords.

original: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛchyamānā sakhīyate saṃ dhītamaśnutaṃ narā nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛchyamānā sakhīyate sam dhītam aśnutam narā nabhantām anyake same
translated: These two, as poets, are to be asked by the poet, as friends, to remember the thought, O heroes. Let the others perish in the conflict.

analyzed: abhyarca nabhāka vat indra agnī yajasā girā
translated: With reverence I praise Indra and Agni, as a poet, with a hymn.

original: yayorviśvamidaṃ jagadiyaṃ dyauḥ pṛthivī mahyupasthe bibhṛto vasu nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: yayoḥ viśvam idam jagat iyam dyauḥ pṛthivī mahī upasthe bibhṛtaḥ vasu nabhantām anyake same
translated: By whom this whole world is held, this great heaven and earth, bearing treasures in their lap. Let the others perish in the conflict.

analyzed: pra brahmāṇi nabhāka vat indra agnibhyām irajyata
translated: The prayers are inclined to Indra and Agni, as a poet,

original: yā saptabudhnamarṇavaṃ jihmabāramaporṇuta indra īśāna ojasā nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: yā sapta budhnam arṇavam jihma bāram aporṇutaḥ indraḥ īśānaḥ ojasā nabhantām anyake same
translated: By whom the seven-bottomed ocean, with its crooked waves, is opened. Indra is the lord by his strength. Let the others perish in the conflict.

original: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratateriva guṣpitamojo dāsasya dambhaya
analyzed: api vṛśca purāṇa vat vratateḥ iva guṣpitam ojaḥ dāsasya dambhaya
translated: Cut it off as of old, as if from a rope that is twisted. Destroy the strength of the Dāsa.

original: vayaṃ tadasya sambhṛtaṃ vasvindreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: vayam tat asya sambhṛtam vasu indreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantām anyake same
translated: We will divide that wealth of his which is gathered together, with Indra. Let the others perish in the conflict.

original: yadindrāgnī janā ime vihvayante tanā girā
analyzed: yat indra agnī janāḥ ime vihvayante tanā girā
translated: If these people, O Indra and Agni, are eager with their body and hymn,

original: asmākebhirnṛbhirvayaṃ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyato nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: asmākebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ vayam sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ vanuyāma vanuṣyataḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: with our men may we conquer those who are on the other side, and those who are on this side may we overcome. Let them perish in a foreign land.

original: yā nu śvetāvavo diva uccarāta upa dyubhiḥ
analyzed: yā nu śvetau avaḥ divaḥ uccarātaḥ upa dyubhiḥ
translated: Those two white ones who have risen up to the sky with their lights

original: indrāgnyoranu vratamuhānā yanti sindhavo yān sīṃ bandhādamuñcatāṃ nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: indra agnyoḥ anu vratam uhānāḥ yanti sindhavaḥ yān sīm bandhāt amuñcatām nabhantām anyake same
translated: the rivers flow according to the rule of Indra and Agni, whom they have released from the bond. Let them perish in a foreign land.

original: pūrvīṣ ṭa indropamātayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ sūnohinvasya harivaḥ
analyzed: pūrvīḥ te indra upamātayaḥ pūrvīḥ uta praśastayaḥ sūnohinvasya harivas
translated: Many are the comparisons with Indra, many the praises, O son of Hinvān, O lord of bays.

original: vasvo vīrasyāpṛco yā nu sādhanta no dhiyo nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: vasvaḥ vīrasya āpṛcaḥ yāḥ nu sādhanta naḥ dhiyaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: The praises of the wealthy hero which we accomplish, O Indra. Let them perish in a foreign land.

analyzed: tam śiśīta suvṛktibhiḥ tveṣam satvānam ṛgmiyam
translated: Sharpen him with good hymns, the bright, strong one, worthy of praise,

original: uto nucid ya ojasā śuṣṇasyāṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: uta u nucit yaḥ ojasā śuṣṇasya aṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīḥ apaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: And if he will, with his might, break through the eggs of Ṣushṇa, and win the waters that lead to heaven. Let them perish in a foreign land.

original: taṃ śiśītā svadhvaraṃ satyaṃ satvānam ṛtviyam
analyzed: tam śiśīta su adhvaram satyam satvānam ṛtviyam
translated: Sharpen him, the self-controlled one, the true, strong one, the proper one,

original: uto nucid ya ohata āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedatyajaiḥ svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: uta u nucit yaḥ ohate āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedatyajaiḥ svarvatīḥ apaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: And if he will, break the eggs of Ṣushṇa with his wings, the waters that lead to heaven. Let them perish in a foreign land.

analyzed: eva indra agnibhyām pitṛ vat navīyaḥ mandhātṛ vat aṅgirasvat avāci
translated: Thus have I sung to Indra and Agni, more youthful than the fathers, like Mandhātṛ, like Aṅgiras.

original: tridhātunā śarmaṇā pātamasmān vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām
analyzed: tri dhātunā śarmaṇā pātam asmān vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Protect us with your threefold shelter, may we be lords of riches

original: asmā ū ṣu prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyo 'rcā viduṣṭarebhyaḥ
analyzed: asmai u su prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ rca viduṣṭarebhyaḥ
translated: To him, to Varuna, to the Maruts, to the most excellent ones, offer praise

original: yo dhītā mānuṣāṇāṃ paśvo gā iva rakṣati nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: yaḥ dhītā mānuṣāṇām paśvaḥ gāḥ iva rakṣati nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who guards the daughters of men like cattle, like cows, let them perish in the other's company

original: tamū ṣu samanā girā pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ nābhākasyapraśastibhiryaḥ sindhūnāmupodaye saptasvasā sa madhyamo nabhantāmanyake
analyzed: tamū su samanā girā pitṝṇām ca manmabhiḥ nābhākasya praśastibhiḥ yaḥ sindhūnām upodaye sapta svasā sa madhyamaḥ nabhantām anyake
translated: Him, O Samana, with the hymn, and with the thoughts of the fathers, and with the praises of Nabhaga, he who is at the rising of the seven rivers, the middle one with seven sisters, let them perish in the other's company

original: sa kṣapaḥ pari ṣasvaje nyusro māyayā dadhe sa viśvaṃ pari darśataḥ
analyzed: sa kṣapaḥ pari sasvaje nyusraḥ māyayā dadhe sa viśvam pari darśataḥ
translated: He, the night, has embraced, the swift one has laid down by his magic power, he who is all around to be seen

analyzed: tasya venīḥ anu vratam uṣaḥ tisraḥ avardhayan abhantām anyake same
translated: His three streams have increased with the hymn, let them perish in the other's company

analyzed: yaḥ kakubhaḥ nidhārayaḥ pṛthivyām adhi darśataḥ
translated: He who is the supporter of the directions, who is to be seen on the earth

original: sa mātā pūrvyaṃ padaṃ tad varuṇasya saptyaṃ sa hi gopā iveryonabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa mātā pūrvyam padam tat varuṇasya saptyam sa hi gopāḥ iva iryaḥ nabhantām anyake same
translated: He is the mother, the ancient place, that is Varuna's abode, for he is like a guardian of the womb, let them perish in the other's company

original: yo dhartā bhuvanānāṃ ya usrāṇāmapīcyā veda nāmāniguhyā
analyzed: yaḥ dhartā bhuvanānām yaḥ usrāṇām apīcyā veda nāmā aniguhyā
translated: He who is the supporter of the worlds, who is the swift one of the dawns, who knows the secret names

original: sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpaṃ dyauriva puṣyati nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpam dyauḥ iva puṣyati nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, the wise one, the poet, nourishes manifold beauty like the sky, let them perish in the other's company

original: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhiriva śritā
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhiḥ iva śritā
translated: In whom all the thoughts of the universe are fixed, as if resting on the navel

original: tritaṃ jūtī saparyata vraje gāvo na saṃyuje yuje aśvānayukṣata nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: tritam jūtī saparyata vraje gāvaḥ na saṃyuje yuje aśvān ayukṣata nabhantām anyake same
translated: They have served Trita with the two swift ones, as cows in a pen, as they yoke the horses to the yoke, let them neigh to each other in the same place.

analyzed: yaḥ āsvatkaḥ āśaye viśvā jātāni eṣām
translated: He who in his own abode has all the beings of these (worlds),

original: pari dhāmāni marmṛśad varuṇasya puro gaye viśve devā anu vrataṃ nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: pari dhāmāni marmṛśat varuṇasya puras gaye viśve devāḥ anu vratam nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who touches the spheres of Varuna, in front of Gaya, the All-gods follow his vow, let them neigh to each other in the same place.

original: sa samudro apīcyasturo dyāmiva rohati ni yadāsu yajurdadhe
analyzed: sa samudraḥ apīcyaḥ turaḥ dyām iva rohati ni yadāsu yajuḥ dadhe
translated: That ocean, which is full of water, rises like a horse to the sky, when he places the sacrificial formula in them.

original: sa māyā arcinā padāstṛṇān nākamāruhan nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: sa māyāḥ arcinā padā astṛṇāt nākam āruhat nabhantām anyake same
translated: He, with his radiant foot, has mounted the vault, the steps, the sky, let them neigh to each other in the same place.

analyzed: yasya śvetā vicakṣaṇā tisraḥ bhūmīḥ adhikṣitaḥ
translated: Of him, the discerning one, the three white (horses) are over the earth, the abode of beings.

original: triruttarāṇi papraturvaruṇasya dhruvaṃ sadaḥ sa saptānāmirajyati nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: tris uttarāṇi papratuḥ varuṇasya dhruvam sadaḥ sa saptānām irajyati nabhantām anyake same
translated: The three higher ones have gone forth to the firm abode of Varuna. He rules over the seven, let them neigh to each other in the same place.

original: yaḥ śvetānadhinirṇijaścakre kṛṣṇānanu vratā🔽sa dhāma pūrvyaṃ mame ya skambhena vi rodasī ajo na dyāmadhārayan nabhantāmanyake same
analyzed: yaḥ śvetān adhinirṇijaḥ cakre kṛṣṇān anu vratā  sa dhāma pūrvyam mame ya skambhena vi rodasī ajaḥ na dyām adhārayat nabhantām anyake same
translated: He who has made the white ones to be over the garment, the black ones to follow the vow,🔽He who has the ancient abode of mine, who has spread out the two worlds with the prop, who has held up the sky with the goat, let them neigh to each other in the same place.

original: astabhnād dyāmasuro viśvavedā amimīta varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: astabhnāt dyām asuraḥ viśva vedāḥ amimīta varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The Asura, the knower of all, has supported the sky, has measured the extent of the earth,

original: āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni
analyzed: āsīdat viśvā bhuvanāni samrāj viśvā id tāni varuṇasya vratāni
translated: He was the universal overlord of all existing things, and all of them are the ordinances of Varuṇa.

original: evā vandasva varuṇaṃ bṛhantaṃ namasyā dhīramamṛtasya gopām
analyzed: eva vandasva varuṇam bṛhantam namasya dhīram amṛtasya gopām
translated: Thus worship Varuṇa the great one, pay homage to the wise guardian of immortality.

original: sa naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsat pātaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe
analyzed: sa naḥ śarma tri varūtham vi yaṃsat pātam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe
translated: May he grant us threefold protection. May heaven and earth protect us in our abode.

original: imāṃ dhiyaṃ śikṣamāṇasya deva kratuṃ dakṣaṃ varuṇa saṃ śiśādhi
analyzed: imām dhiyam śikṣamāṇasya deva kratum dakṣam varuṇa sam śiśādhi
translated: O Varuṇa, sharpen the thought and the power of the one who is training in this meditation,

original: yayāti viśvā duritā tarema sutarmāṇamadhi nāvaṃ ruhema
analyzed: yayā ati viśvā duritā tarema su tarmāṇam adhi nāvam ruhema
translated: By which we may overcome all difficulties and ascend the well-constructed ship.

original: ā vāṃ grāvāṇo aśvinā dhībhirviprā acucyavuḥ
analyzed: ā vām grāvāṇaḥ aśvinā dhībhiḥ viprāḥ acucyavuḥ
translated: The priests, O Asvins, have urged you with their thoughts, the pressing-stones, O you of abundant wealth.

analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: O Nâsatyas, for the drinking of the Soma, let them be ready at the other libation.

analyzed: yathā vām atriḥ aśvinā gīrbhiḥ vipraḥ ajohavīt
translated: As the sage, O Asvins, has called you with his songs,

analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same
translated: O Nâsatyas, for the drinking of the Soma, let them be ready at the other libation.

analyzed: eva vāmahve ūtaye yathā ahuvanta medhirāḥ
translated: Thus have I called you for help, as the wise ones have called you,

original: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantāmanyake same🔽ime viprasya vedhaso 'gnerastṛtayajvanaḥ
analyzed: nāsatyā soma pītaye nabhantām anyake same  ime viprasya vedhasaḥ gneḥ astṛta yajvanaḥ
translated: O Nâsatyas, for the drinking of the Soma, let them be ready at the other libation.

original: giraḥ stomāsa īrate🔽asmai te pratiharyate jātavedo vicarṣaṇe
analyzed: giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate  asmai te pratiharyate jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: These songs and praises of the sage, the wise one, of Agni, the unsullied worshipper,🔽are raised up.🔽To you, O all-knowing one, O Agni, to whom the oblation is offered,

analyzed: agne janāmi suṣṭutim
translated: O wise one, I offer this praise.
