original: yasmā u śarma sapratha ādityāso arādhvamanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: yasmai u śarma saprathaḥ ādityāsaḥ arādhvam anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: Him whom ye have made the most propitious, the most bountiful, the most powerful, the most mighty, the most glorious, the most resplendent, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of honour, the most worthy of reverence, the most worthy of adoration, the most worthy of offering, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of honour, the most worthy of reverence, the most worthy of adoration, the most worthy of offering, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of honour, the most worthy of reverence, the most worthy of adoration, the most worthy of offering, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of honour, the most worthy of reverence, the most worthy of adoration, the most worthy of offering, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of honour, the most worthy of reverence, the most worthy of adoration, the most worthy of offering, the most worthy of sacrifice, the most worthy of worship, the most worthy of praise, the most worthy of

original: yuṣme devā api ṣmasi yudhyanta iva varmasu
analyzed: yuṣme devāḥ api smasi yudhyantaḥ iva varmasu
translated: Ye Gods, we are as it were contending in the fight for our armour

original: yūyaṃ maho na enaso yūyamarbhāduruṣyatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: yūyam mahaḥ naḥ enasaḥ yūyam arbhāt uruṣyata anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: Ye are great deliverers from sin, ye are easy to invoke, easy to invoke, from trouble.

analyzed: aditiḥ naḥ uruṣyatu aditiḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: May Aditi protect us, may Aditi give shelter.

original: mātā mitrasya revato 'ryamṇo varuṇasya cānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: mātā mitrasya revataḥ ryamṇaḥ varuṇasya ca anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: The mother of Mitra, of the wealthy, of Varuna, from trouble.

original: yad devāḥ śarma śaraṇaṃ yad bhadraṃ yadanāturam
analyzed: yat devāḥ śarma śaraṇam yat bhadram yat anāturam
translated: What shelter, O ye Gods, what protection, what is good, what is not painful,🔽What threefold shelter is, that do ye grant us.

original: tridhātu yad varūthyaṃ tadasmāsu vi yantanānehaso va utayaḥsuūtayo va ūtayaḥ🔽ādityā ava hi khyatādhi kūlādiva spaśaḥ🔽sutīrthamarvato yathānu no neṣathā sugamanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ🔽neha bhadraṃ rakṣasvine nāvayai nopayā uta
analyzed: tri dhātu yat varūthyam tat asmāsu vi yantana anehasaḥ vaḥ utayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ  ādityāḥ ava hi khyata adhi kūlāt iva spaśaḥ  su tīrtham arvataḥ yathā anu naḥ neṣatha sugama nehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ  na iha bhadram rakṣasvine na avayai na upayai uta
translated: O ye Âdityas, come hither, as it were, to the bank, O ye swift ones,🔽As it were to a good ford, so lead us, O ye of easy access.🔽Not here is good luck for the Raksas, nor for the one who is not of us, nor for the one who is not of us.

original: gave ca bhadraṃ dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate 'nehaso na ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: gave ca bhadram dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate nehasaḥ naḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: And good luck for the cow, for the milch cow, and for the hero who desires glory.

analyzed: yat āvis yat apīcyam devāsaḥ asti duṣkṛtam
translated: When, O Gods, there is anything wicked, anything contemptible, that we have done,

original: trite tad viśvamāptya āre asmad dadhātanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayova ūtayaḥ
analyzed: trite tat viśvam āptye āre asmat dadhātana anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: O Trita, bring that to us, O Aptîya, from afar, your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

analyzed: yat ca goṣu duṣvapnyam yat ca asme duhitar divaḥ
translated: And whatever evil dream is among our cattle, and whatever is among us, O Daughter of the Sky,

original: tritāya tad vibhāvaryāptyāya parā vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: tritāya tat vibhāvari āptyāya parā vaha anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: That evil dream we consign to Trita, to Vibhavarî, to Aptîya, to carry away from us. Your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

original: niṣkaṃ vā ghā kṛṇavate srajaṃ vā duhitardivaḥ
analyzed: niṣkam vā gha kṛṇavate srajam vā duhitar divaḥ
translated: Or he makes a necklace, or a garland, O Daughter of the Sky,

original: trite duṣvapnyaṃ sarvamāptye pari dadmasyanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: trite duṣvapnyam sarva māptye pari dadmasi anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To Trita, to Aptîya, we consign all the evil dream. Your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

analyzed: tad annāya tad apase tam bhāgam upaseduṣe
translated: That for food, that for drink, that portion to the guest who has come,

original: tritāya ca dvitāya coṣo duṣvapnyaṃ vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: tritāya ca dvitāya ca uṣaḥ duṣvapnyam vaha anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: To Trita and to Dvita, O Dawn, carry away the evil dream. Your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

original: yathā kalāṃ yathā śaphaṃ yatha ṛṇaṃ saṃnayāmasi
analyzed: yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam saṃnayāmasi
translated: As we settle a debt according to the scale, according to the balance,

original: evā duṣvapnyaṃ sarvamāptye saṃ nayāmasyanehaso va ūtayaḥsuūtayo va ūtayaḥ
analyzed: eva duṣvapnyam sarva māptye sam nayāmasi anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: So we settle all the evil dream on Aptîya. Your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

analyzed: ajaiṣma adya asanāma ca abhūma anāgasaḥ vayam
translated: We have conquered, we have gained, we have become free from sickness.

original: uṣo yasmād duṣvapnyādabhaiṣmāpa taduchatvanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayova ūtayaḥ
analyzed: uṣaḥ yasmāt duṣvapnyāt abhaiṣma apa tat uchatu anehasaḥ vaḥ ūtayaḥ su ūtayaḥ uvaḥ ūtayaḥ
translated: From whatever evil dream we have been afraid, O Dawn, may that pass away from us. Your aids that are free from sickness, your very helpful aids.

original: svādorabhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyo varivovittarasya🔽viśve yaṃ devā uta martyāso madhu bruvanto abhi saṃcaranti
analyzed: svādoḥ abhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyaḥ varivaḥ vittarasya  viśve yam devāḥ uta martyāsaḥ madhu bruvantaḥ abhi saṃcaranti
translated: I have eaten of the sweet food of the wise one, the one who grants wide room, the one with good thoughts🔽Whom all the gods and mortals approach, speaking of honey,

analyzed: antar ca prāgāḥ aditiḥ bhava asi avayātā harasaḥ daivyasya
translated: And Aditi, the one who goes within, the one who is in front, the one who is in the womb of the divine one

original: indavindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭīva dhuramanu rāya ṛdhyāḥ
analyzed: indo indrasya sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭī iva dhuram anu rāyaḥ ṛdhyāḥ
translated: O Soma, enjoying Indra's friendship, may you prosper with wealth, like the yoke of a hearer

analyzed: apāma somam amṛtāḥ abhūma aganma jyotiḥ avidāma devān
translated: We have become immortal through the water, Soma. We have come to the light, we have found the gods

original: kiṃ nūnamasmān kṛṇavadarātiḥ kimu dhūrtiramṛta martyasya
analyzed: kim nūnam asmān kṛṇavat arātiḥ kimu dhūrtiḥ amṛta martyasya
translated: What evil will the enemy do to us? What is the weapon of a mortal, O immortal one?

original: śaṃ no bhava hṛda ā pīta indo piteva soma sūnave suśevaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ bhava hṛde ā pītaḥ indo pitā iva soma sūnave su śevaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to our heart, O Soma, when drunk, like a father, O Soma, to his son, very gracious

original: sakheva sakhya uruśaṃsa dhīraḥ pra ṇa āyurjīvase somatārīḥ
analyzed: sakhā iva sakhye uru śaṃsa dhīraḥ pra naḥ āyuḥ jīvase somatārīḥ
translated: Like a friend, O you who are praised in many places, O wise one, like a friend, may you grant us long life, O you who are protected by Soma

original: ime mā pītā yaśasa uruṣyavo rathaṃ na gāvaḥ samanāhaparvasu
analyzed: ime mā pītāḥ yaśasaḥ uruṣyavaḥ ratham na gāvaḥ samanāha parvasu
translated: These, when drunk, may protect me, O you who are famous for great protection, like cows a chariot at the joints of the axles

original: te mā rakṣantu visrasaścaritrāduta mā srāmādyavayantvindavaḥ
analyzed: te mā rakṣantu visrasaḥ caritrāt uta mā srāmāt yavayantu indavaḥ
translated: May they protect me from the danger of wandering, or may the drops refresh me when exhausted

original: agniṃ na mā mathitaṃ saṃ didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyaso naḥ
analyzed: agnim na mā mathitam sam didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyasaḥ naḥ
translated: Do not inflame me like a rubbed fire, O Soma. Show us, do good for us

original: athā hi te mada ā soma manye revāniva pra carāpuṣṭimacha
analyzed: athā hi te made ā soma manye revān iva pra cara apuṣṭimacha
translated: Now, O Soma, I think of your intoxication, like a rich man, go for nourishment

original: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasyeva rāyaḥ
analyzed: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasya iva rāyaḥ
translated: With a mind that desires we will enjoy the Soma, as of a father's wealth.

original: soma rājan pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tārīrahānīva sūryo vāsarāṇi
analyzed: soma rājan pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tārīḥ ahāni iva sūryaḥ vāsarāṇi
translated: Soma, O King, extend our life-spans, as the sun the days and nights.

original: soma rājan mṛḷayā naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyāstasya viddhi
analyzed: soma rājan mṛḍaya naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyāḥ tasya viddhi
translated: Soma, O King, be gracious to us for our welfare. We are your obedient servants, know that.

original: alarti dakṣa uta manyurindo mā no aryo anukāmaṃ parādāḥ
analyzed: alarti dakṣaḥ uta manyuḥ indo mā naḥ aryaḥ anukāmam parādāḥ
translated: Let not thy strength fail, nor thy wrath, O Indu. Let not the foe surpass our desire.

original: tvaṃ hi nastanvaḥ soma gopā gātregātre niṣasatthā nṛcakṣāḥ
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ tanvaḥ soma gopāḥ gātre gātre niṣasattha nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: For thou, O Soma, art the guardian of our bodies, sitting in every limb, O man-beholding one.

original: yat te vayaṃ pramināma vratāni sa no mṛḷa suṣakhādeva vasyaḥ🔽ṛdūdareṇa sākhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ
analyzed: yat te vayam pramināma vratāni sa naḥ mṛḍa su sakhā adeva vasyaḥ  ṛdūdareṇa sākhyā saceya yaḥ mā na riṣyet hari aśva pītaḥ
translated: If we transgress thy ordinances, be gracious to us, O good friend, for our welfare.🔽With the one whose belly is tender, with the friend, may I live, whom thou, O Haryaśva, hast not injured, O Soma.

original: ayaṃ yaḥ somo nyadhāyyasme tasmā indraṃ pratiramemyāyuḥ
analyzed: ayam yaḥ somaḥ nyadhāyi asme tasmai indram pratiramemi āyuḥ
translated: This Soma which has been poured for us, for him may we obtain long life.

original: apa tyā asthuranirā amīvā niratrasan tamiṣīcīrabhaiṣuḥ
analyzed: apa tyāḥ asthuḥ anirāḥ amīvāḥ niratrasan tamiṣīcīḥ abhaiṣuḥ
translated: They have removed thy sicknesses, O Soma, they have frightened away thy terrors.

original: ā somo asmānaruhad vihāyā aganma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ
analyzed: ā somaḥ asmān aruhat vihāyāḥ aganma yatra pratirante āyuḥ
translated: Soma has raised us up from the pit. We have come to that place where they prolong life.

original: yo na induḥ pitaro hṛtsu pīto 'martyo martyānāviveśa
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ induḥ pitaraḥ hṛtsu pītaḥ martyaḥ martyān āviveśa
translated: This Indu, O fathers, who, drunk in the heart, has entered the mortals as an immortal,

original: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma
analyzed: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma
translated: To that Soma let us offer with oblation. May we enjoy his favour and his good will.

original: tvaṃ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno 'nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha
analyzed: tvam soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha
translated: Thou, O Soma, in accord with the Fathers, hast spread over the sky and earth.

original: tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām
analyzed: tasmai te indo haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: To thee, O Indu, let us offer with oblation; may we be lords of wealth.

original: trātāro devā adhi vocatā no mā no nidrā īśata mota jalpiḥ🔽vayaṃ somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamāvadema
analyzed: trātāraḥ devāḥ adhi vocata naḥ mā naḥ nidrā īśata mā uta jalpiḥ  vayam somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham āvadema
translated: May the protecting Gods grant us their favour; let not sleep or garrulity overcome us.🔽We, O Soma, all dear to thee, with brave sons, will speak in the assembly.

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato vayodhāstvaṃ svarvidā viśā nṛcakṣāḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma viśvatas vayaḥ dhāḥ tvam svar vidā viśa nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: Thou, O Soma, art our strength on every side; thou, O thou who findest the light, art the people, O thou who seest men.

original: tvaṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātāduta vā purastāt
analyzed: tvam naḥ indo ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātāt uta vā purastāt
translated: Thou, O Indra, in accord with thy aids, protect us from the rear and from the front.

original: abhi pra vaḥ surādhasamindramarca yathā vide🔽yo jaritribhyo maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇeva śikṣati
analyzed: abhi pra vaḥ su rādhasam indram arca yathā vide  yaḥ jaritribhyaḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇa iva śikṣati
translated: I will praise for you the good sacrificer Indra, as I know him,🔽The bountiful one, who for the singers, with a thousand (gifts), as it were, trains (himself).

original: śatānīkeva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe
analyzed: śata anīkā iva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe
translated: Like a hundred-leader he goes forth in his strength; he slays the Vr̥itras for the worshipper.

original: gireriva pra rasā asya pinvire datrāṇi purubhojasaḥ
analyzed: gireḥ iva pra rasāḥ asya pinvire datrāṇi puru bhojasaḥ
translated: Like the streams of a mountain, his gifts swell forth, the bountiful one's gifts.

original: ā tvā sutāsa indavo madā ya indra girvaṇaḥ
analyzed: ā tvā sutāsaḥ indavaḥ madāḥ ye indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: To thee, O Indra, the drops pressed out (are offered), the gladdening ones, O thou who lovest the song.

original: āpo na vajrinnanvokyaṃ saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase
analyzed: āpaḥ na vajrin anvokyam saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase
translated: The waters, O thou with the thunderbolt, the lake which is to be invoked, fill (thee) for the gift, O hero.

original: anehasaṃ prataraṇaṃ vivakṣaṇaṃ madhvaḥ svādiṣṭhamīṃ piba
analyzed: anehasam prataraṇam vivakṣaṇam madhvaḥ piba
translated: The guileless, the deliverer, the wide-ruling, the sweetest of the sweet, drink (of the Soma).

original: ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudreva tmanā dhṛṣat
analyzed: ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudrā iva tmanā dhṛṣat
translated: As you are gladdened, come to us, bold one, as if with hunger, by yourself

original: ā na stomamupa dravad dhiyāno aśvo na sotṛbhiḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ stomam upa dravat dhiyānaḥ aśvaḥ na sotṛbhiḥ
translated: Come to our praise, urged on by our thoughts, like a horse by charioteers

original: yaṃ tesvadhāvan svadayanti dhenava indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ
analyzed: yam tesvadhāvan svadayanti dhenavaḥ indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ
translated: O you of your own power, the milch-cows make sweet for you, O Indra, the gifts in the Kanvas

original: ugraṃ na vīraṃ namasopa sedima vibhūtimakṣitāvasum
analyzed: ugram na vīram namasā upa sedima vibhūtim akṣitāvasum
translated: We have approached the mighty hero with homage, the all-pervading one whose wealth is inexhaustible

original: udrīva vajrinnavato na siñcate kṣarantīndra dhītayaḥ
analyzed: udrī iva vajrin avataḥ na siñcate kṣaranti indra dhītayaḥ
translated: Like a swift one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, the inspirations flow to you, O Indra, the streams flow

original: yad dha nūnaṃ yad vā yajñe yad vā pṛthivyāmadhi
analyzed: yat ha nūnam yat vā yajñe yat vā pṛthivyām adhi
translated: Whether it be now, or at the sacrifice, or on the earth

original: ato no yajñamāśubhirmahemata ugra ugrebhirā gahi
analyzed: atas naḥ yajñam āśubhiḥ mahemate ugraḥ ugrebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: From there, O mighty one, with your swift ones, come to our sacrifice, O fierce one, with the fierce ones

original: ajirāso harayo ye ta āśavo vātā iva prasakṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: ajirāsaḥ harayaḥ ye te āśavaḥ vātāḥ iva prasakṣiṇaḥ
translated: The swift, the unwearied, the strong horses which are yours, which are like winds in their rush

analyzed: yebhiḥ apatyam manuṣaḥ parīyase yebhiḥ viśvam svar dṛśe
translated: With which you go around the offspring of Manu, with which you see the whole heaven

analyzed: etāvataḥ te īmahe indra sumnasya gomataḥ
translated: From you we seek this, O Indra, the bliss of possessing cattle

original: yathā prāvo maghavan medhyātithiṃ yathā nīpātithiṃ dhane
analyzed: yathā prāvaḥ maghavan medhyātithim yathā nīpātithim dhane
translated: As you helped Medhyātithi, O bountiful one, as you helped Nīpātithi in the contest

original: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje
analyzed: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje
translated: As you helped Kaṇva, O bountiful one, Trasadasyu, as you helped Paktha in the land of the Dashavṛhas

analyzed: yathā gośarye asanoḥ ṛjiśvani indra gomat hiraṇyavat
translated: As you helped Gośṛṅga, O Indra, in the land of Ṛjiśvan, with cattle and gold

analyzed: pra su śrutam su rādhasam arca śakram abhiṣṭaye
translated: Praise Śakra, well-known, the bestower of good things, for help,

original: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sahasreṇeva maṃhate🔽śatānīkā hetayo asya duṣṭarā indrasya samiṣo mahīḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyam vasu sahasreṇa iva maṃhate  śata anīkāḥ hetayaḥ asya duṣṭarāḥ indrasya samiṣaḥ mahīḥ
translated: Who bestows lovely wealth to the one who presses and praises, as if with a thousand (gifts).🔽His many and invincible weapons, his missiles, are like hundreds of armies,

original: girirna bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yadīṃ sutā amandiṣuḥ
analyzed: giriḥ na bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yadi īm sutāḥ amandiṣuḥ
translated: The bountiful Indra's abundant food. Like a mountain, he swells for the wealthy when the juices have gladdened him.

analyzed: yadi īm sutāsaḥ indavaḥ bhi priyam amandiṣuḥ
translated: When the juices, the drops, have gladdened his dear (drink),

original: āpo na dhāyi savanaṃ ma ā vaso dughā ivopa dāśuṣe
analyzed: āpaḥ na dhāyi savanam me ā vaso dughāḥ iva upa dāśuṣe
translated: O Vasu, he fills my libation as the clouds fill the rain-bearing (sky) for the worshipper.

original: anehasaṃ vo havamānamūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ
analyzed: anehasam vaḥ havamānam ūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ
translated: For your protection, O invincible one, the honey-sweet thoughts flow forth.

original: ā tvā vaso havamānāsa indava upa stotreṣu dadhire
analyzed: ā tvā vaso havamānāsaḥ indavaḥ upa stotreṣu dadhire
translated: O Vasu, the drops, being invoked, have placed you in the praises.

original: ā naḥ some svadhvara iyāno atyo na tośate
analyzed: ā naḥ some su adhvare iyānaḥ atyaḥ na tośate
translated: O Soma, come to us, invited, like a horse to the water-trough, to the sacrifice.

original: yaṃ te svadāvan svadanti gūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam
analyzed: yam te sva dāvan svadanti gūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam
translated: O you who delight in the sweet (drink), your praises delight you, O you who are to be praised in the morning. You accept the invocation of the one who offers.

original: pra vīramugraṃ viviciṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ vibhūtiṃ rādhaso mahaḥ
analyzed: pra vīram ugram vivicim dhana spṛtam vibhūtim rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The strong, the mighty, the discerning, the wealthy, the all-pervading, the great gift,

original: udrīva vajrinnavato vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe
analyzed: udrī iva vajrin avataḥ vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe
translated: Like a bull, O you who wield the thunderbolt, you always delight in the worshipper's wealth.

original: yad dha nūnaṃ parāvati yad vā pṛthivyāṃ divi
analyzed: yat ha nūnam parāvati yat vā pṛthivyām divi
translated: Whether you are far away or on earth or in the sky,

original: yujāna indra haribhirmahemata ṛṣva ṛṣvebhirā gahi
analyzed: yujānaḥ indra haribhiḥ mahemate ṛṣvaḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Indra, yoking your tawny (horses), come to us with your lofty and most lofty (gifts).

original: rathirāso harayo ye te asridha ojo vātasya piprati
analyzed: rathirāsaḥ harayaḥ ye te asridhaḥ ojaḥ vātasya piprati
translated: The swift, red horses that thou hast, O thou who art without guile, increase the strength of the wind

original: yebhirni dasyuṃ manuṣo nighoṣayo yebhiḥ svaḥ parīyase
analyzed: yebhiḥ ni dasyum manuṣaḥ nighoṣayaḥ yebhiḥ svar parīyase
translated: With which thou hast slain the Dasyu, O man, with which thou hast surrounded heaven

analyzed: etāvataḥ te vaso vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ
translated: So far, O Vasu, may we know thee, O hero, in thy new deeds

original: yathā prāva etaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśaṃ daśavraje
analyzed: yathā prāvaḥ etaśam kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśam daśavraje
translated: As thou hast helped Etaṣa in the contest, as thou hast helped Vaṣa in Daśavraja

original: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrghanīthe damūnasi
analyzed: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrgha nīthe damūnasi
translated: As thou hast helped Kaṇva, O Maghavan, in the sacrifice, in the long-lasting contest, O thou who art to be invoked

original: yathā gośarye asiṣāso adrivo mayi gotraṃ hariśriyam
analyzed: yathā gośarye asiṣāsaḥ adrivas mayi gotram hari śriyam
translated: As thou hast gained, O wielder of the thunderbolt, the cattle, the family, the tawny glory, in Gośṛṅga

analyzed: yathā manau sāṃvaraṇau somam indra apibaḥ sutam
translated: As thou hast drunk the Soma, O Indra, with Manu, the son of Sāṃvaraṇa, when it was pressed

original: nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭigau śruṣṭigau sacā
analyzed: nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭigau śruṣṭigau sacā
translated: With Nīpātithi, O Maghavan, with Medhyātithi, with Puṣṭi, with Śruṣṭi, together

analyzed: pārṣadvāṇaḥ praskaṇvam samasādayat śayānam jivrim uddhitam
translated: Pārṣadvaṇa has brought together Praskanva, who was lying down, wounded and lifted up

analyzed: sahasrāṇi asiṣāsat gavām ṛṣiḥ tvotaḥ dasyave vṛkaḥ
translated: The Ṛṣi, the impeller, has gained thousands of cattle for the Dasyu, the wolf

original: ya ukthebhirna vindhate cikid ya ṛṣicodanaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ukthebhiḥ na vindhate cikit yaḥ ṛṣi codanaḥ
translated: He whom the Ṛṣis do not restrain with praises, who is to be stirred by the Ṛṣis' urging

original: indraṃ tamachā vada navyasyā matyariṣyantaṃ na bhojase
analyzed: indram tam achā vada navyasyā matyā a riṣyantam na bhojase
translated: Him, O Indra, do thou favour with a new boon, him who is to be supported, not to be neglected

analyzed: yasmai arkam sapta śīrṣāṇam ānṛcuḥ tri dhātum uttame pade
translated: From whom they have sung the hymn with seven heads, in the highest place, of threefold nature

original: sa tvimā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradadādijjaniṣṭa pauṃsyam
analyzed: sa tu imā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradadāt id janiṣṭa pauṃsyam
translated: He hath roared out over all these worlds; may he be born anew with manly strength.

original: yo no dātā vasūnāmindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dātā vasūnām indram tam hūmahe vayam
translated: To him, the giver of treasures, to Indra, we offer our invocation.

original: vidmā hyasya sumatiṃ navīyasīṃ gamema gomati vraje
analyzed: vidma hi asya sumatim navīyasīm gamema gomati vraje
translated: For we know his most recent gracious favour: may we go to the fold with store of cattle.

original: yasmai tvaṃ vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyas poṣamaśnute
analyzed: yasmai tvam vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyaḥ poṣam aśnute
translated: To him whom thou, O Vasu, teachest to receive thy gifts, he obtaineth increase of wealth.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavannindra girvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe
analyzed: tam tvā vayam maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: To thee, O Indra, O Maghavan, O thou that lovest the song, we call with Soma juices.

original: kadā cana starīrasi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe
analyzed: kadā cana starīrasi na indra saścasi dāśuṣe
translated: Never art thou negligent, O Indra, never dost thou disappoint the worshipper.

original: upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate
analyzed: upa upa id nu maghavan bhūyaḥ id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate
translated: Again and yet again, O Maghavan, the gift of the God is stored up for thee.

original: pra yo nanakṣe abhyojasā kriviṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇaṃ nighoṣayan
analyzed: pra yaḥ nanakṣe abhyojasā krivim vadhaiḥ śuṣṇam nighoṣayan
translated: He who hath spread himself with might, slaying Kṛvi with his blows, and slaying Śuṣṇa,

original: yadedastambhīt prathayannamūṃ divamādijjaniṣṭa pārthivaḥ🔽yasyāyaṃ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ
analyzed: yadā id astambhīt prathayan amūm divam ādit janiṣṭa pārthivaḥ  yasya ayam viśvaḥ āryaḥ dāsaḥ śevadhi pāḥ ariḥ
translated: When he hath stood erect and extended this earth, the son of the earth hath been born.🔽Whose is this all-ruling sway, whose is this lordship over the Dāsa, whose is this over the Ari?

original: tiraścidarye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ
analyzed: tiraścit arye ruśame tubhya id saḥ ajyate rayiḥ
translated: The ruddy steed, O noble one, is girt about for thee: for thee is this wealth made ready.

analyzed: turaṇyavaḥ madhumantam ghṛtaścutam viprāsaḥ arkam ānṛcuḥ
translated: The sages have sung forth the hymn to him who is rich in sweetness, who drops with ghee.

original: asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo 'sme suvānāsa indavaḥ
analyzed: asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ sme suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Wealth hath been spread among us, manly strength: among us are the pressed Soma juices.

original: yathā manau vivasvati somaṃ śakrāpibaḥ sutam
analyzed: yathā manau vivasvati somam śakra apibaḥ sutam
translated: As you drank the Soma juice pressed out for you by Manu, Vivasvat, and Shakra

original: yathā trite chanda indra jujoṣasyāyau mādayase sacā
analyzed: yathā trite chandaḥ indra jujoṣasi āyau mādayase sacā
translated: As you rejoice together with Trita, Chanda, and Indra, O you who are to be praised

analyzed: pṛṣadhre medhye mātariśvani indra suvāne amandathāḥ

analyzed: yathā somam daśaśipre daśoṇye syūmaraśmau ṛjūnasi
translated: As you pressed out Soma for Dasha-shipra, Dasho-nya, and Syumarashmi, the righteous ones

translated: He who alone has received the hymns, he who boldly drank the Soma

analyzed: yasmai viṣṇuḥ trīṇi padā vicakrame upa mitrasya dharmabhiḥ  yasya tvam indra stomeṣu cākanaḥ vāje vājin śatakrato
translated: For whom Vishnu strode with three steps, with the laws of Mitra🔽You whom we desire, O Indra, in the hymns, for the sake of strength, O you of a hundred powers

translated: We invoke you, O Indra, like one who milks a cow well, for the sake of fame🔽He who gives to us is our great father, the benefactor, the lord who acts

analyzed: a yāman ugraḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ goḥ aśvasya pra dātu naḥ
translated: The generous one, the wealthy one, the one with many treasures, the one who gives us

translated: Come hither, O Indra, with the measured thoughts, with the aids

translated: With the most delightful, most delightful protections, with the most delightful, most delightful (aids)🔽Make him the winner, the lord of the people, the lord of creatures, the most prosperous

original: pra sū tirā śacībhirye ta ukthinaḥ kratuṃ punata ānuṣak
analyzed: pra su tira śacībhiḥ ye te ukthinaḥ kratum punate ānuṣak
translated: Those who, with their powers, with their hymns, renew thy rite in due order

original: yaste sādhiṣṭho 'vase te syāma bhareṣu te
analyzed: yaḥ te sādhiṣṭhaḥ vase te syāma bhareṣu te

analyzed: vayam hotrābhiḥ uta deva hūtibhiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ manāmahe
translated: With our offerings, with our invocations of the gods, we who have all things desirable think of thee

original: ahaṃ hi te harivo brahma vājayurājiṃ yāmi sadotibhiḥ
analyzed: aham hi te harivas brahma vājayuḥ ājim yāmi sadā ūtibhiḥ
translated: For I, O thou who hast bay steeds, bring thee, with the praises, the Brahman, the prize-winning race, the seat

analyzed: tvāmideva tam ame sam aśvayuḥ gavyuḥ agre mathīnām
translated: Thee, O god, most to be invoked, with the best horses, with cattle, first of the battles

original: etat ta indra vīryaṃ gīrbhirgṛṇanti kāravaḥ
analyzed: etat te indra vīryam gīrbhiḥ gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
translated: This, O Indra, is thy hero might which the singers praise with hymns

original: te stobhanta ūrjamāvan ghṛtaścutaṃ paurāso nakṣan dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: te stobhantaḥ ūrjamāvan ghṛtaścutam paurāsaḥ nakṣan dhītibhiḥ
translated: They, the sons of Pūrus, have obtained thee, the supporter of strength, the pourer of ghee, with their thoughts

original: nakṣanta indramavase sukṛtyayā yeṣāṃ suteṣu mandase
analyzed: nakṣante indram avase su kṛtyayā yeṣām suteṣu mandase
translated: They who have done good deeds seek Indra for help, in whose libations thou delightest

original: yathā saṃvarte amado yathā kṛśa evāsme indra matsva
analyzed: yathā saṃvarte amadaḥ yathā kṛśe eva asme indra matsva
translated: As in the Samvarta, as in the Kṛśa, so, O Indra, rejoice in us

original: ā no viśve sajoṣaso devāso gantanopa naḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ gantana upa naḥ
translated: All the gods who are of one mind, come to us, come to us for help

original: vasavo rudrāavase na ā gamañchṛṇvantu maruto havam
analyzed: vasavaḥ rudrāḥ avase naḥ ā gaman śṛṇvantu marutaḥ havam
translated: May the Vasus, the Rudras come to us for help. May the Maruts listen to the call

original: pūṣā viṣṇurhavanaṃ me sarasvatyavantu sapta sindhavaḥ
analyzed: pūṣā viṣṇuḥ havanam me sarasvatī avantu sapta sindhavaḥ
translated: May Pūṣan, Viṣṇu, Sarasvatī, the seven rivers accept my invocation

original: āpo vātaḥ parvatāso vanaspatiḥ śṛṇotu pṛthivī havam
analyzed: āpaḥ vātaḥ parvatāsaḥ vanaspatiḥ śṛṇotu pṛthivī havam
translated: May the waters, the wind, the mountains, the trees, the earth listen to the call

original: yadindra rādho asti te māghonaṃ maghavattama
analyzed: yat indra rādhaḥ asti te māghonam maghavattama
translated: If, O Indra, there is any wealth of thine, O most wealthy one, that is not to be given

original: tena no bodhi sadhamādyo vṛdhe bhago dānāya vṛtrahan
analyzed: tena naḥ bodhi sadhamādyaḥ vṛdhe bhagaḥ dānāya vṛtrahan
translated: Thereby, O best of givers, make us prosper. O Vrtra-slayer, for the gift of wealth

original: ājipate nṛpate tvamid dhi no vāja ā vakṣi sukrato
analyzed: āji pate nṛpate tvam id hi naḥ vāje ā vakṣi su krato
translated: O lord of the prize, O lord of men, for thou art able, O most wise one, to bring us

analyzed: vītīhotrābhiḥ uta deva vītibhiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ vi śṛṇvire
translated: The bountiful ones will listen with their offerings and with their divine ways

analyzed: santi hi aryaḥ āśiṣaḥ indre āyuḥ janānām
translated: For there are blessings for the noble one, O Indra, for the life of the people

analyzed: asmān nakṣasva maghavan upa avase dhukṣasva pipyuṣī imiṣam
translated: Protect us, O lord of bounty, help us. Milk forth the swelling food

original: vayaṃ ta indra stomebhirvidhema tvamasmākaṃ śatakrato
analyzed: vayam te indra stomebhiḥ vidhema tvam asmākam śatakrato
translated: We will serve thee, O Indra, with our praises. Thou, O Śatakratu, art ours

original: mahi sthūraṃ śaśayaṃ rādho ahrayaṃ praskaṇvāya ni tośaya
analyzed: mahi sthūram śaśayam rādhaḥ ahrayam praskaṇvāya ni tośaya
translated: Bestow upon Prṣaṇgavān the great, the firm, the lasting gift

analyzed: bhūri id indrasya vīryam vyakhyam abhyāyati
translated: The greatness of Indra's manly power hath been spread abroad

analyzed: rādhaḥ te dasyave vṛka
translated: Your gift to the Dasyu, O wolf,

original: śataṃ śvetāsa ukṣaṇo divi tāro na rocante
analyzed: śatam śvetāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ divi tāraḥ na rocante
translated: A hundred white oxen shine like stars in the sky.

analyzed: mahnā divam na tastabhuḥ
translated: With might you have filled the sky.

original: śataṃ veṇūñchataṃ śunaḥ śataṃ carmāṇi mlātāni
analyzed: śatam veṇūn śatam śunaḥ śatam carmāṇi mlātāni
translated: A hundred bamboos, a hundred dogs, a hundred hides are stretched out,

analyzed: śatam me balbaja stukāḥ aruṣīṇām catuḥśatam
translated: A hundred of my balbaja plants, four hundred red cows.

analyzed: su devāḥ stha kāṇvāyanāḥ vayaḥ vayaḥ vicarantaḥ
translated: You are the well-worshipped, the Kaṇva's descendants, moving in every place,

original: aśvāso nacaṅkramata🔽ādit sāptasya carkirannānūnasya mahi śravaḥ
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ nacaṅkramata  ādit sāptasya carkiran na anūnasya mahi śravaḥ
translated: Like horses, you have gone to the end.🔽They have proclaimed the great fame of the seven-fold, the unlimited one.

analyzed: śyāvīḥ atidhvasan pathaḥ cakṣuṣā cana saṃnaśe
translated: The dark one, the destroyer of the path, cannot be overcome even by the eye.

original: prati te dasyave vṛka rādho adarśyahrayam
analyzed: prati te dasyave vṛka rādhaḥ adarśya hrayam
translated: To you, the Dasyu, O wolf, I have shown my gift, my glory,

analyzed: dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ
translated: Like the vast sky.

original: daśa mahyaṃ pautakrataḥ sahasrā dasyave vṛkaḥ
analyzed: daśa mahyam pautakrataḥ sahasrā dasyave vṛkaḥ
translated: Ten thousand, O Pūtanakṛta, the Dasyu, the wolf,

analyzed: nityāt rāyaḥ amaṃhata
translated: Has gathered for me from eternal wealth.

analyzed: śatam me gardabhānām śatam ūrṇāvatīnām
translated: A hundred of my donkeys, a hundred of my woolen ones,

analyzed: śatam dāsān ati srajaḥ
translated: A hundred garlands of slaves.

analyzed: tatra u api prāṇīyata pūtakratāyai vyaktā
translated: There too, he was honored for the sake of Pūtanakṛta,

analyzed: aśvānāmin na yūthyām
translated: In the herd of horses.

analyzed: aceti agniḥ cikituḥ havyavāṭ sa sumat rathaḥ
translated: Agni, the knower, the carrier of oblations, he is the one with the good chariot.

original: agniḥ śukreṇa śociṣā bṛhat sūro arocata divi sūryo arocata
analyzed: agniḥ śukreṇa śociṣā bṛhat sūraḥ arocata divi sūryaḥ arocata
translated: Agni, with his bright flame, the sun, has shone forth, in the sky the sun has shone forth.

original: yuvaṃ devā kratunā pūrvyeṇa yuktā rathena taviṣaṃ yajatrā
analyzed: yuvam devā kratunā pūrvyeṇa yuktā rathena taviṣam yajatrā
translated: O you two, O you two gods, with your ancient power, yoked to the powerful chariot, O you two to be worshipped,

original: āgachataṃ nāsatyā śacībhiridaṃ tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ pibāthaḥ
analyzed: āgacchatam nāsatyā śacībhiḥ idam tṛtīyam savanam pibāthaḥ
translated: Come with your powers, O Nāsatyas, drink this third libation.

original: yuvāṃ devāstraya ekādaśāsaḥ satyāḥ satyasya dadṛśe purastāt
analyzed: yuvām devāḥ trayaḥ ekādaśāsaḥ satyāḥ satyasya dadṛśe purastāt
translated: You two, O gods, are the three and the eleven, the true ones, the true one is seen in front.

original: asmākaṃ yajñaṃ savanaṃ juṣāṇā pātaṃ somamaśvinā dīdyagnī
analyzed: asmākam yajñam savanam juṣāṇā pātam somam aśvinā dīdi agnī
translated: Accepting our sacrifice and libation, O Aśvins, protect the shining Soma.

original: panāyyaṃ tadaśvinā kṛtaṃ vāṃ vṛṣabho divo rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: panāyyam tat aśvinā kṛtam vām vṛṣabhaḥ divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: That which is to be honoured, O Aśvins, is done for you, the bull of the realm of heaven and earth.

original: sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvānit tānupa yātā pibadhyai
analyzed: sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvān id tān upa yāta pibadhyai
translated: All those who have praised you a thousand times at the cow-pen, come to them to drink.

original: ayaṃ vāṃ bhāgo nihito yajatremā giro nāsatyopa yātam
analyzed: ayam vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yajatrā imāḥ giraḥ nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: This is your share, O you two to be worshipped; come, O Nāsatyas, to these songs.

original: pibataṃ somaṃ madhumantamasme pra dāśvāṃsamavataṃ śacībhiḥ
analyzed: pibatam somam madhumantam asme pra dāśvāṃsam avatam śacībhiḥ
translated: Drink the sweet Soma for us; come to the generous one with your powers.

original: yam ṛtvijo bahudhā kalpayantaḥ sacetaso yajñamimaṃ vahanti
analyzed: yam ṛtvijaḥ bahudhā kalpayantaḥ sacetasaḥ yajñam imam vahanti
translated: Whom the priests, being of one mind, carry along in this sacrifice, dividing him in many ways,

original: yo anūcāno brāhmaṇo yukta āsīt kā svit tatra yajamānasya saṃvit
analyzed: yaḥ anūcānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yuktaḥ āsīt kā svid tatra yajamānasya saṃvid
translated: What is the sacrificer's thought there, if a learned brāhmaṇa is yoked?

original: eka evāgnirbahudhā samiddha ekaḥ sūryo viśvamanu prabhūtaḥ
analyzed: ekaḥ eva agniḥ bahudhā samiddhaḥ ekaḥ sūryaḥ viśvam anu prabhūtaḥ
translated: The one fire is kindled in many ways, the one sun pervades everything.

original: ekaivoṣāḥ sarvamidaṃ vi bhātyekaṃ vā idaṃvi babhūva sarvam
analyzed: ekā eva uṣāḥ sarvam idam vi bhāti ekam vai idam vi babhūva sarvam
translated: The one dawn shines over all this, or all this was indeed one in the beginning

original: jyotiṣmantaṃ ketumantaṃ tricakraṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ suṣadaṃ bhūrivāram
analyzed: jyotiṣmantam ketumantam tri cakram sukham ratham suṣadam bhūri vāram
translated: The radiant, bannered, three-wheeled, pleasant, well-seated, bountiful chariot

original: citrāmaghā yasya yoge 'dhijajñe taṃ vāṃ huveati riktaṃ pibadhyai
analyzed: citrāmaghā yasya yoge tam vām huve ati riktam pibadhyai
translated: Whose yoke was born with wondrous bounty, I invoke you to drink beyond the full

original: imāni vāṃ bhāgadheyāni sisrata indrāvaruṇā pra mahe suteṣu vām
analyzed: imāni vām bhāgadheyāni sisrate indrāvaruṇā pra mahe suteṣu vām
translated: These are your shares, O Indra-Varuṇa, flow on to the great ones in your libations

original: yajñeyajñe ha savanā bhuraṇyatho yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣathaḥ🔽niṣṣidhvarīroṣadhīrāpa āstāmindrāvaruṇā mahimānamāśata
analyzed: yajñeyajñe ha savanā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣathaḥ  niṣṣidhvarīḥ oṣadhīḥ āpaḥ āstām indrāvaruṇā mahimānam āśata
translated: In every sacrifice you hasten to the pressings, when you instruct the sacrificer who offers libations🔽The plants and waters are your restraining posts, O Indra-Varuṇa, you have attained greatness

original: yā sisratū rajasaḥ pāre adhvano yayoḥ śatrurnakirādeva ohate
analyzed: yā sisratuḥ rajasaḥ pāre adhvanaḥ yayoḥ śatruḥ nakirādevaḥ ohate
translated: You who are stretched out beyond the edge of the realm, on the path, whose enemy is never overcome by any foe

original: satyaṃ tadindrāvaruṇā kṛśasya vāṃ madhva ūrmiṃ duhate sapta vāṇīḥ
analyzed: satyam tat indrāvaruṇā kṛśasya vām madhvaḥ ūrmim duhate sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: That is true, O Indra-Varuṇa, the seven voices milk the wave of sweet drink for the weak one

original: tābhirdāśvāṃsamavataṃ śubhas patī yo vāmadabdho abhi pāti cittibhiḥ
analyzed: tābhiḥ dāśvāṃsam avatam śubhaḥ patī yaḥ vāmadabdhaḥ abhi pāti cittibhiḥ
translated: With them come to the worshipper, O lords of splendor, who, faithful, guards you with thoughts

original: ghṛtapruṣaḥ saumyā jīradānavaḥ sapta svasāraḥ sadana ṛtasya
analyzed: ghṛta pruṣaḥ saumyāḥ jīra dānavaḥ sapta svasāraḥ sadane ṛtasya
translated: The kindly ones, givers of ghee, of Soma, of the swift ones, the seven sisters, the seat of truth

original: yā ha vāmindrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutastābhirdhattaṃ yajamānāya śikṣatam
analyzed: yāḥ ha vām indrāvaruṇāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ tābhiḥ dhattam yajamānāya śikṣatam
translated: Those of you, O Indra-Varuṇa, who drip ghee, with them bestow (favors) on the sacrificer, instruct him

original: avocāma mahate saubhagāya satyaṃ tveṣābhyāṃ mahimānamindriyam
analyzed: avocāma mahate saubhagāya satyam tveṣābhyām mahimānam indriyam
translated: We have spoken for great good fortune, the truth of these two, the greatness, the power

original: asmān svindrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutastribhiḥ sāptebhiravataṃ śubhas patī
analyzed: asmān su indrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutaḥ tribhiḥ sāptebhiḥ avatam śubhaḥ patī
translated: Do you, O Indra and Varuna, come to us, the givers of ghee, with the three and seven, O lords of splendor

original: indrāvaruṇā yad ṛṣibhyo manīṣāṃ vāco matiṃ śrutamadattamagre
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā yat ṛṣibhyaḥ manīṣām vācaḥ matim śrutam adattam agre
translated: O Indra and Varuna, whatever thought, speech, and understanding you have given to the seers in the beginning

analyzed: yāni sthānāni asṛjanta dhīrāḥ yajñam tanvānāḥ tapasā abhyapaśyam
translated: The places which the wise ones have created, which they have seen with austerity while fashioning the sacrifice

original: indrāvaruṇā saumanasamadṛptaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhattam
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā saumanasam adṛptam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamāneṣu dhattam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, bestow upon the sacrificers the well-disposed favor, the increase of wealth

original: prajāṃ puṣṭiṃ bhūtimasmāsu dhattaṃ dīrghāyutvāya pra tirataṃ na āyuḥ🔽agna ā yāhyagnibhirhotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: prajām puṣṭim bhūtim asmāsu dhattam dīrgha āyu tvāya pra tiratam naḥ āyuḥ  agne ā yāhi agnibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: Bestow upon us offspring, prosperity, and well-being, extend our life for a long life🔽O Agni, come with the fires, we choose you as the Hotar

original: ā tvāmanaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭhaṃ barhirāsade🔽achā hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaścarantyadhvare🔽ūrjo napātaṃ ghṛtakeśamīmahe 'gniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam
analyzed: ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhiḥ āsade  achā hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaḥ caranti adhvare  ūrjaḥ napātam ghṛta keśam īmahe gnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam
translated: Let the well-prepared oblation consecrate you, best to be offered, to sit on the sacrificial grass🔽For you, O son of strength, O Angiras, the ladles move in the sacrifice🔽We invoke Agni, the son of strength, whose hair is ghee, the first in sacrifices

original: agne kavirvedhā asi hotā pāvaka yakṣyaḥ
analyzed: agne kaviḥ vedhāḥ asi hotā pāvaka yakṣyaḥ
translated: O Agni, you are the wise, the creator, the Hotar, the purifier, to be worshipped

original: mandro yajiṣṭho adhvareṣvīḍyo viprebhiḥ śukra manmabiḥ
analyzed: mandraḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ viprebhiḥ śukra manmabiḥ
translated: The delightful, best to be offered, to be praised in sacrifices, the pure one, O sage, with the hymns of the seers

analyzed: adroghamāḥ vaha uśataḥ yaviṣṭhya devān ajasra vītaye
translated: O most youthful one, bring the gods, who are not deceitful, in a hundred ways, O imperishable one, to the feast

original: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitā vaso gahi mandasva dhītibhirhitaḥ
analyzed: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitā vaso gahi mandasva dhītibhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: Accept, O good one, the well-prepared offerings; rejoice with the hymns, being helped

analyzed: tvam id saprathāḥ asi agne trātar ṛtaḥ kaviḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the protector of this spreading, truthful sage

original: tvāṃ viprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdiva ā vivāsanti vedhasaḥ🔽śocā śociṣṭha dīdihi viśe mayo rāsva stotre mahānasi
analyzed: tvām viprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdivas ā vivāsanti vedhasaḥ  śoca śociṣṭha dīdihi viśe mayaḥ rāsva stotre mahān asi
translated: You, O wise one, the priests kindle and illuminate, the seers invoke🔽Shine, O most radiant one, shine for the people with your splendor; give wealth; you are great in the hymns

original: devānāṃ śarman mama santu sūrayaḥ śatrūṣāhaḥ svagnayaḥ
analyzed: devānām śarman mama santu sūrayaḥ śatrūṣāhaḥ su agnayaḥ
translated: May my princes be in the protection of the gods, victorious over enemies, with their own fires

analyzed: yathā cit vṛddha matasam agne saṃjūrvasi kṣami
translated: Just as, O Agni, you roar over the old and new, O all-knower

original: evā dahamitramaho yo asmadhrug durmanmā kaśca venati
analyzed: eva daha mitra mahas yaḥ asmadhruk durmanmā kaḥ ca venati
translated: So burn up the enemy, O Agni, whoever hates us with evil thoughts

original: mā no martāya ripave rakṣasvine māghaśaṃsāya rīradhaḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ martāya ripave rakṣasvine mā agha śaṃsāya rīradhaḥ
translated: Do not give up to the mortal foe, the Raksas, the slanderer

analyzed: a sredhadbhiḥ taraṇibhiḥ yaviṣṭhya śivebhiḥ pāhi pāyubhiḥ
translated: With the most youthful, the most powerful, the most impetuous, O most youthful one, protect with your auspicious protections

original: pāhi no agna ekayā pāhyuta dvitīyayā
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne ekayā pāhi uta dvitīyayā
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with one (protection), protect us with a second

analyzed: pāhi gīrbhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ ūrjām pate pāhi catasṛbhiḥ vaso
translated: Protect us with three hymns, O lord of strength, protect us with four, O good one

original: pāhi viśvasmād rakṣaso arāvṇaḥ pra sma vājeṣu no 'va
analyzed: pāhi viśvasmāt rakṣasaḥ arāvṇaḥ pra sma vājeṣu naḥ va
translated: Protect us from every Raksas, from the one with no eyes; be gracious to us in battles

original: tvāmid dhi nediṣṭhaṃ devatātaya āpiṃ nakṣāmahe vṛdhe
analyzed: tvām id hi nediṣṭham devatātaye āpim nakṣāmahe vṛdhe
translated: We implore thee, O Agni, as the nearest deity, for prosperity

original: ā no agne vayovṛdhaṃ rayiṃ pāvaka śaṃsyam🔽rāsvā ca na upamāte puruspṛhaṃ sunītī svayaśastaram
analyzed: ā naḥ agne vayaḥ vṛdham rayim pāvaka śaṃsyam  rāsvā ca naḥ upamāte puruspṛham su nītī sva yaśastaram
translated: O Agni, O purifier, grant us wealth that increases our life-span, that is praiseworthy🔽And be thou our nearest friend, most famous through good conduct, much desired by many

original: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śardhatastaranto arya ādiśaḥ
analyzed: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śardhataḥ tarantaḥ aryaḥ ādiśaḥ
translated: By which (wealth) we may conquer in battles, overcoming the enemies' directions

original: sa tvaṃ no vardha prayasā śacīvaso jinvā dhiyo vasuvidaḥ
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ vardha prayasā śacī vaso jinva dhiyaḥ vasu vidaḥ
translated: Do thou, O Agni, increase us with hero strength, inspire our thoughts that find wealth

analyzed: śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yathā agniḥ śṛṅge davidhvat
translated: Blazing like a bull, O Agni, with two horns

original: tigmā asya nanavo na pratidhṛṣe sujambhaḥ sahaso yahuḥ
analyzed: tigmāḥ asya nanavaḥ na pratidhṛṣe su jambhaḥ sahasaḥ yahuḥ
translated: His sharp teeth are irresistible, he is well-jawed, swift to act

original: nahi te agne vṛṣabha pratidhṛṣe jambhāso yad vitiṣṭase
analyzed: nahi te agne vṛṣabha pratidhṛṣe jambhāsaḥ yat vitiṣṭase
translated: For thy jaws, O Agni, O bull, are irresistible when thou dost move about

original: satvaṃ no hotaḥ suhutaṃ haviṣ kṛdhi vaṃsvā no vāryā puru
analyzed: satvam naḥ hotar su hutam haviḥ kṛdhi vaṃsva naḥ vāryā puru
translated: Make our oblation well-offered, O Hotar, grant us choice boons, O rich one

original: śeṣe vaneṣu mātroḥ saṃ tvā martāsa indhate
analyzed: śeṣe vaneṣu mātroḥ sam tvā martāsaḥ indhate
translated: Thou residest in the woods, in the lap of the mother, the mortals kindle thee

original: atandro havyā vahasi haviṣkṛta ādid deveṣu rājasi🔽sapta hotārastamidīḷate tvāgne sutyajamahrayam
analyzed: atandraḥ havyā vahasi haviṣkṛtaḥ ādid deveṣu rājasi  sapta hotāraḥ tam id īḍate tvā agne sutyajam ahrayam
translated: Unwearied, thou carriest the oblations, thou shinest among the gods as the first🔽The seven Hotars praise thee, O Agni, the easily kindled one

original: bhinatsyadriṃ tapasā vi śociṣā prāgne tiṣṭha janānati
analyzed: bhinatsi adrim tapasā vi śociṣā pra agne tiṣṭha janān ati
translated: With heat and flame thou breakest the rock, O Agni, standest in front of the people

original: agnimagniṃ vo adhriguṃ huvema vṛktabarhiṣaḥ🔽agniṃ hitaprayasaḥ śaśvatīṣvā hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: agnim agnim vaḥ adhrigum huvema vṛkta barhiṣaḥ  agnim hita prayasaḥ śaśvatī iṣvā hotāram carṣaṇīnām
translated: We will invoke Agni, Agni, the impeller, with strewn sacred grass🔽We will invoke Agni, the one with good offerings, in all our sacrifices, as the priest of the people

original: ketena śarman sacate suṣāmaṇyagne tubhyaṃ cikitvanā
analyzed: ketena śarman sacate suṣāmaṇi agne tubhyam cikitvanā
translated: By what, O Agni, do you attend with protection, O you of good gifts, for the sake of your discernment?

original: iṣaṇyayā naḥ pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye🔽agne jaritarviśpatistepāno deva rakṣasaḥ
analyzed: iṣaṇyayā naḥ puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye  agne jaritar viśpatiḥ tepānaḥ deva rakṣasaḥ
translated: Bring us the most desirable wealth by your impulse, for the sake of our protection🔽O Agni, the singer, the lord of the people, the one to be worshipped, O god, the protector from demons

analyzed: a proṣivān gṛhapatiḥ mahānasi divaḥ pāyuḥ duroṇayuḥ
translated: The one who does not go away, the lord of the house, you are great, the protector of heaven, the one who dwells in the house

original: mā no rakṣa ā veśīdāghṛṇīvaso mā yāturyātumāvatām
analyzed: mā naḥ rakṣaḥ ā veśīda aghṛṇīvaso mā yātuḥ yātumāvatām
translated: Do not let the Raksas come to us, O you whose wealth is not to be taken away, do not let the Yātudhāna come to us, O you who are to be worshipped

analyzed: kṣudham agne sedha rakṣasvinaḥ
translated: Drive away, O Agni, the Raksases, the hungry ones, from afar, with your arrow

original: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavacca na indro arvāgidaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ
translated: Listen to both of us, O Indra, to this word

original: satrācyāmaghavā somapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā gamat
analyzed: satrācyā maghavā soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat
translated: Come hither, O you who love the Soma, O you who are most powerful by your thought, for the sake of drinking the Soma

original: taṃ hi svarājaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tamojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ
analyzed: tam hi sva rājam vṛṣabham tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ
translated: For the self-ruling bull, him they have fashioned for strength, the two bowls

original: utopamānāṃ prathamo ni ṣīdasi somakāmaṃ hi te manaḥ
analyzed: uta upamānām prathamaḥ ni sīdasi soma kāmam hi te manaḥ
translated: You sit down as the first of the comparable ones, for your mind is set on the Soma

analyzed: ā vṛṣasva purūvaso sutasya indra andhasaḥ
translated: Be strong, O you of much wealth, for the pressed Soma, O Indra

original: vidmā hi tvā harivaḥ pṛtsu sāsahimadhṛṣṭaṃ cid dadhṛṣvaṇim
analyzed: vidma hi tvā harivas pṛtsu sāsahim adhṛṣṭam cit dadhṛṣvaṇim
translated: We know you, O you who love the tawny (horses), as the one who conquers in battles, as the bold one, the daring one

original: aprāmisatya maghavan tathedasadindra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ🔽sanema vājaṃ tava śiprinnavasā makṣū cid yanto adrivaḥ
analyzed: aprāmisatya maghavan tathā id asat indra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ  sanema vājam tava śiprin navasā makṣū cit yantaḥ adrivas
translated: O Maghavan, this is not a false statement, O Indra, as you know, O powerful one,🔽May we obtain strength, O you with beautiful lips, through your favor, O you who wield the thunderbolt, while we are striving.

original: śagdhyū ṣu śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ🔽bhagaṃna hi tvā yaśasaṃ vasuvidamanu śūra carāmasi
analyzed: śagdhi u su śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  bhagaṃna hi tvā yaśasam vasu vidam anu śūra carāmasi
translated: Be pleased, O lord of power, O Indra, with all your aids.🔽For we follow you, O hero, as one who brings glory and wealth.

analyzed: ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajram mimikṣatuḥ

analyzed: ayujaḥ asamaḥ nṛbhiḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīrayāsyaḥ

analyzed: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire ruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi
translated: The ruddy mares have been let loose upon the sacred grass,

analyzed: yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe
translated: Where we shall meet together.

original: indrāya gāva āśiraṃ duduhre vajriṇe madhu /
analyzed: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu
translated: To Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the cows have yielded the sweet drink, the milk,

analyzed: yat sīm upahvare vidat
translated: When he hath found it on the sloping (mountains).

original: ud yad bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ gṛham indraś ca ganvahi /
analyzed: ud yat bradhnasya viṣṭapam gṛham indraḥ ca ganvahi
translated: When he hath mounted the ridge of the vault, Indra and Vâyu have gone to the house,

original: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi triḥ sapta sakhyuḥ pade //
analyzed: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi tris sapta sakhyuḥ pade
translated: Having drunk the sweet drink, they have gone together to the friend's place, thrice seven times.

analyzed: arcata prārcata priyamedhāsaḥ arcata
translated: Praise ye, praise well the Priyamedhas, praise them.

original: arcantu putrakā uta puraṃ na dhṛṣṇv arcata //
analyzed: arcantu putrakāḥ uta puram na dhṛṣṇu arcata
translated: Let the sons praise, let the bold one praise the fort.

original: ava svarāti gargaro godhā pari saniṣvaṇat /
analyzed: ava svarāti gargaraḥ godhā pari saniṣvaṇat
translated: The frog hath croaked aloud, the lizard hath hissed around,

analyzed: piogā pari caniṣkadat indrāya brahma udyatam
translated: The Pinga hath hissed around, the Brahman hath been raised for Indra.

original: ā yat patanty enyaḥ sudughā anapasphuraḥ /
analyzed: ā yat patanti enyaḥ su dughāḥ an apasphuraḥ
translated: When the birds fly down, the well-milking (cows), not dribbling,

analyzed: apasphuram gṛbhāyata somam indrāya pātave
translated: Seize the dribbling one: take the Soma for Indra to drink.

original: apād indro apād agnir viśve devā amatsata /
analyzed: apāt indraḥ apāt agniḥ viśve devāḥ amatsata
translated: Indra hath limped, Agni hath limped, all the Gods have limped.

original: varuṇa id iha kṣayat tam āpo abhy anūṣata vatsaṃ saṃśiśvarīr iva //
analyzed: varuṇe id iha kṣayat tam āpaḥ abhī anūṣata vatsam saṃśiśvarīḥ iva
translated: Varuna, who rules here, the waters have sung to him,🔽As a loving mother to her child.

original: sudevo asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: su devaḥ asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ
translated: Thou art a good god, O Varuna, whose seven rivers

analyzed: anukṣaranti kākudam sūrmyam suṣirām iva
translated: Flow down to the bubbling cauldron, like a sieve.

original: yo vyatīṃr aphāṇayat suyuktāṃ upa dāśuṣe /🔽takvo netā tad id vapur upamā yo amucyata //
analyzed: yaḥ vyatīn aphāṇayat su yuktām upa dāśuṣe  takvaḥ netā tat id vapuḥ upamā yaḥ amucyata
translated: He who has loosed the well-yoked teams for the worshipper,🔽The leader, the swift one, that is his wondrous form, he who was set free.

original: atīd u śakra ohata indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ati id u śakraḥ ohate indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Indra, the mighty one, has overcome all enmities,

original: bhinat kanīna odanam pacyamānam paro girā //
analyzed: bhinat kanīnaḥ odanam pacyamānam paras girā
translated: The youngling has burst the pot that was being cooked, with a loud voice.

original: arbhako na kumārako 'dhi tiṣṭhan navaṃ ratham /
analyzed: arbhakaḥ na kumārakaḥ dhi tiṣṭhat navam ratham
translated: Like a boy, like a youth, standing on a new chariot,

original: sa pakṣan mahiṣam mṛgam pitre mātre vibhukratum //
analyzed: sa pakṣat mahiṣam mṛgam pitre mātre vibhu kratum
translated: He has killed the mighty buffalo for his father and mother.

original: ā tū suśipra dampate rathaṃ tiṣṭhā hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: ā tu su śipra dampate ratham tiṣṭha hiraṇyayam
translated: O thou of beautiful face, O lord of the house, mount thy golden chariot,

original: adha dyukṣaṃ sacevahi sahasrapādam aruṣaṃ svastigām anehasam //
analyzed: adha dyukṣam sacevahi sahasra pādam aruṣam svasti gām anehasam
translated: And then thou shalt travel with the heavenly one, the red one with a thousand feet, who goes to bliss, who is faultless.

original: taṃ ghem itthā namasvina upa svarājam āsate /
analyzed: tam gha īm itthā namasvinaḥ upa svarājam āsate
translated: To him, indeed, in this way, the worshippers sit down near the self-ruler,

original: arthaṃ cid asya sudhitaṃ yad etava āvartayanti dāvane //
analyzed: artham cit asya sudhitam yat etave āvartayanti dāvane
translated: Even to obtain his well-ordered wealth, which they turn back for the sake of giving.

analyzed: anu pratnasya okasaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ eṣām
translated: The ancient ones, the dear ones, the wise ones of these (people),

original: pūrvām anu prayatiṃ vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa āśata //
analyzed: pūrvām anu prayatim vṛkta barhiṣaḥ hita prayasaḥ āśata
translated: The first, the last, the middle (priests) have come to the sacrifice, the priests whose task is appointed, who have attained their object.

original: yo rājā carṣaṇīnāṃ yātā rathebhir adhriguḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ
translated: He who is the king of men, who moves on with his swift chariots,

original: viśvāsāṃ tarutā pṛtanānāṃ jyeṣṭho yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe //
analyzed: viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe
translated: The conqueror of all battles, the eldest, the Vr̥itra-slayer, whom I praise.

original: indraṃ taṃ śumbha puruhanmann avase yasya dvitā vidhartari /
analyzed: indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari
translated: That Indra, O Sumbha, the slayer of many, for help, whose two arms, O supporter,

original: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśato maho dive na sūryaḥ //
analyzed: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ
translated: The wondrous thunderbolt is laid to the hand, as the great heaven to the sun.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ karmaṇā naśad yaś cakāra sadāvṛdham /
analyzed: nakir tam karmaṇā naśat yaḥ cakāra sadāvṛdham
translated: No one by work shall find him who hath made him to wax ever strong,

original: indraṃ na yajñair viśvagūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭaṃ dhṛṣṇvjasam //
analyzed: indram na yajñaiḥ viśva gūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭam dhṛṣṇvjasam
translated: Indra, whom all must laud, the mighty, the daring, the irresistible, the bold.

original: aṣāḷham ugram pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ yasmin mahīr urujrayaḥ /
analyzed: aṣāḍham ugram pṛtanāsu sāsahim yasmin mahīḥ urujrayaḥ
translated: The irresistible, the strong, the conqueror in battles, in whom are great and far-extending powers,

original: saṃ dhenavo jāyamāne anonavur dyāvaḥ kṣāmo anonavuḥ //
analyzed: sam dhenavaḥ jāyamāne anonavuḥ dyāvaḥ kṣāmaḥ anonavuḥ
translated: The milch-kine lowed to him when he was born, the heavens and the earth lowed to him.

original: yad dyāva indra te śataṃ śatam bhūmīr uta syuḥ /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmīḥ uta syuḥ
translated: If, O Indra, the heavens were thine, a hundred times a hundred, and the earths were so,

original: na tvā vajrin sahasraṃ sūryā anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī //
analyzed: na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī
translated: Not a thousand suns, O wielder of the thunderbolt, could equal thee at birth, O thou of wondrous deeds.

original: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā /
analyzed: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā
translated: Thou, O bull, hast extended thyself with might and with strength, O strongest, over all things.

original: asmāṃ ava maghavan gomati vraje vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: O bountiful one, with your wondrous aids, O wielder of the thunderbolt, come to us in the pasture rich in cows.

original: na sīm adeva āpad iṣaṃ dīrghāyo martyaḥ /
analyzed: na sīm adevaḥ āpat iṣam dīrgha āyo martyaḥ
translated: No mortal, O Godless one, has obtained food for a long life.

original: etagvā cid ya etaśā yuyojate harī indro yuyojate //
analyzed: etagvā cit yaḥ etaśā yuyojate harī indraḥ yuyojate
translated: Even the swift one who yokes the swift ones, Indra yokes the two bays.

original: taṃ vo maho mahāyyam indraṃ dānāya sakṣaṇim /
analyzed: tam vaḥ mahāyyam indram dānāya sakṣaṇim
translated: Him, your great, very mighty Indra, the swift one, for the gift,

original: yo gādheṣu ya āraṇeṣu havyo vājeṣv asti havyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ gādheṣu yaḥ āraṇeṣu havyaḥ vājeṣu asti havyaḥ
translated: Who is to be invoked in the deep places, in the Aryan lands, who is to be invoked in the battles.

original: ud ū ṣu ṇo vaso mahe mṛśasva śūra rādhase /
analyzed: ud u su naḥ vaso mahe mṛśasva śūra rādhase
translated: O Vasu, O hero, think of us for the great gift.

original: ud ū ṣu mahyai maghavan maghattaya ud indra śravase mahe //
analyzed: ud u su mahyai maghavan maghattaye ud indra śravase mahe
translated: O magnanimous one, for the great lordship, O Indra, for the great glory.

original: tvaṃ na indra ṛtayus tvānido ni tṛmpasi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indraḥ ṛtayuḥ tvānidaḥ ni tṛmpasi
translated: You, O Indra, are the righteous one, the one without hatred, you satisfy.

original: madhye vasiṣva tuvinṛmṇorvor ni dāsaṃ śiśnatho hathaiḥ //
analyzed: madhye vasiṣva tuvi nṛmṇa ūrvoḥ ni dāsam śiśnathaḥ hathaiḥ
translated: Sit in the middle of your two invincible arms, crush the Dāsa with your hands.

analyzed: anya vratam a mānuṣam a yajvānam a devayum
translated: The one with a different vow, the non-human one, the one who does not sacrifice, the one who is not devoted to the gods,

original: ava svaḥ sakhā dudhuvīta parvataḥ sughnāya dasyum parvataḥ //
analyzed: ava svaḥ sakhā dudhuvīta parvataḥ su ghnāya dasyum parvataḥ
translated: May the mountain, the friend of heaven, shake for easy passage, the mountain for the passage of the Dāsa.

original: tvaṃ na indrāsāṃ haste śaviṣṭha dāvane /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra āsām haste śaviṣṭha dāvane
translated: You, O Indra, in the hand of these, O most powerful one, for the giving,

original: dhānānāṃ na saṃ gṛbhāyāsmayur dviḥ saṃ gṛbhāyāsmayuḥ //
analyzed: dhānānām na sam gṛbhāya asmayuḥ dvis sam gṛbhāya asmayuḥ
translated: Of the roasted grains, as if to grasp them twice, as if to grasp them twice.

original: sakhāyaḥ kratum ichata kathā rādhāma śarasya /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ kratum ichata kathā rādhāma śarasya
translated: O friends, seek the resolve, how we may obtain the food of the autumn.

analyzed: upastutim bhojaḥ sūriḥ yaḥ ahrayaḥ
translated: The generous one, the lord, who is not to be deceived, is praised.

analyzed: bhūribhiḥ samaha ṛṣibhiḥ barhiṣmadbhiḥ staviṣyase
translated: You will be praised by many great sages who sit on sacred grass,

original: yad ittham ekamekam ic chara vatsān parādadaḥ //
analyzed: yat ittham ekam ekam id śara vatsān parādadaḥ
translated: When you thus give away the calves one by one, like arrows.

original: karṇagṛhyā maghavā śauradevyo vatsaṃ nas tribhya ānayat /
analyzed: karṇa gṛhya maghavā śauradevyaḥ vatsam naḥ tribhyaḥ ānayat
translated: Maghavan, having seized them by the ears, brought our calf to the three Shuradevis.

analyzed: ajām sūriḥ na dhātave
translated: The lord brought the goat for the sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ no agne mahobhiḥ pāhi viśvasyā arāteḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne mahobhiḥ pāhi viśvasyāḥ arāteḥ
translated: O Agni, protect us with your great powers from all hostility,

analyzed: uta dviṣaḥ martyasya
translated: And from the enmity of mortal men.

original: nahi manyuḥ pauruṣeya īśe hi vaḥ priyajāta /
analyzed: nahi manyuḥ pauruṣeyaḥ īśe hi vaḥ priya jāta
translated: For human anger does not rule over you, O you who are born of what is dear.

analyzed: tvam id asi kṣapāvān
translated: You are indeed the protector.

original: sa no viśvebhir devebhir ūrjo napād bhadraśoce /
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ ūrjaḥ napāt bhadra śoce
translated: With all the gods, O Agni, with the foot of strength, O you who are radiant with splendor,

analyzed: rayim dehi viśva vāram
translated: Give us wealth that is good in every way.

original: na tam agne arātayo martaṃ yuvanta rāyaḥ /
analyzed: na tam agne arātayaḥ martam yuvanta rāyaḥ
translated: O Agni, the evil spirits do not afflict that mortal man,

analyzed: yam trāyase dāśvāṃsam
translated: Whom you protect, the one who offers.

original: yaṃ tvaṃ vipra medhasātāv agne hinoṣi dhanāya /
analyzed: yam tvam vipra medha sātau agne hinoṣi dhanāya
translated: O Agni, whom you urge on to the sacrifice with your wisdom, O sage, for the sake of wealth,

analyzed: sa tava ūtī goṣu gantā
translated: He goes to you for the sake of cattle.

original: tvaṃ rayim puruvīram agne dāśuṣe martāya /
analyzed: tvam rayim puru vīram agne dāśuṣe martāya
translated: O Agni, give to the mortal man who offers you wealth with many heroes.

analyzed: pra naḥ naya vasyaḥ acha
translated: Lead us to what is better.

original: uruṣyā ṇo mā parā dā aghāyate jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: uruṣya naḥ mā parā dāḥ aghāyate jātavedaḥ
translated: Protect us, do not abandon us to the sinner, O all-knowing one,

analyzed: durādhye martāya
translated: To the mortal one who is difficult to subdue.

original: agne mākiṣ ṭe devasya rātim adevo yuyota /🔽tvam īśiṣe vasūnām //
analyzed: agne mākir te devasya rātim adevaḥ yuyota  tvam īśiṣe vasūnām
translated: O Agni, let no god hinder the gift of the god to thee.🔽For thou art the lord of treasures.

original: sa no vasva upa māsy ūrjo napān māhinasya /
analyzed: sa naḥ vasvaḥ upa māsi ūrjaḥ napāt māhinasya
translated: Come to us, O son of strength, O son of strength, for our portion of wealth, for our share of food,

original: sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ //🔽achā naḥ śīraśociṣaṃ giro yantu darśatam /
analyzed: sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ  achā naḥ śīra śociṣam giraḥ yantu darśatam
translated: O friend, O Vasu, for the worshippers.🔽Let our songs go forth to the lovely one, to the radiant one,

original: achā yajñāso namasā purūvasum purupraśastam ūtaye //
analyzed: achā yajñāsaḥ namasā purūvasum puru praśastam ūtaye
translated: To the sacrifice, with homage, to the one rich in treasures, to the one praised by many, for help.

original: agniṃ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ dānāya vāryāṇām /
analyzed: agnim sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam dānāya vāryāṇām
translated: Agni, the son of strength, the all-knower, for the bestowal of precious things,

original: dvitā yo bhūd amṛto martyeṣv ā hotā mandratamo viśi //🔽agniṃ vo devayajyayāgnim prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: dvitā yaḥ bhūt amṛtaḥ martyeṣu ā hotā mandratamaḥ viśi  agnim vaḥ deva yajyayā agnim prayati adhvare
translated: Who has become the immortal one among mortals, the priest, the most delightful one in the assembly.🔽Agni, by worshipping the gods, Agni, when starting the sacrifice,

original: agniṃ dhīṣu prathamam agnim arvaty agniṃ kṣaitrāya sādhase //
analyzed: agnim dhīṣu prathamam agnim arvati agnim kṣaitrāya sādhase
translated: Agni in the prayers, Agni in the race, Agni for the sake of the contest for land.

original: agnir iṣāṃ sakhye dadātu na īśe yo vāryāṇām /🔽agniṃ toke tanaye śaśvad īmahe vasuṃ santaṃ tanūpām //🔽agnim īḷiṣvāvase gāthābhiḥ śīraśociṣam /
analyzed: agniḥ iṣām sakhye dadātu naḥ īśe yaḥ vāryāṇām  agnim toke tanaye śaśvat īmahe vasum santam tanū pām  agnim īḍiṣva avase gāthābhiḥ śīra śociṣam
translated: May Agni, the lord of food, bestow upon us the treasures,🔽We always invoke Agni, the good one, the protector of the body, in childbirth and in offspring.🔽Worship Agni for the sake of help with songs, the radiant one,

original: agniṃ rāye purumīḷha śrutaṃ naro 'gniṃ sudītaye chardiḥ //
analyzed: agnim rāye purumīḷha śrutam naraḥ gnim sudītaye chardiḥ
translated: Agni for wealth, O you who possess much, O you who are famous, O Agni, for the sake of a good dwelling, for the sake of a house.

original: agniṃ dveṣo yotavai no gṛṇīmasy agniṃ śaṃ yoś ca dātave /
analyzed: agnim dveṣaḥ yotavai naḥ gṛṇīmasi agnim śam yos ca dātave
translated: We praise Agni to remove our hatred, we praise Agni to give us peace and prosperity.

original: viśvāsu vikṣv aviteva havyo bhuvad vastur ṛṣūṇām //
analyzed: viśvāsu vikṣu avitā iva havyaḥ bhuvat vastuḥ ṛṣūṇām
translated: To be worshipped in all the worlds, as if he were the all-pervading one, he has become the lord of the people.

analyzed: haviḥ kṛṇudhvam ā gamat adhvaryuḥ vanate punar
translated: Make the offering! Let the Adhvaryu go again to invite him.

analyzed: vidvān asya praśāsanam
translated: The wise one knows the rule of this (sacrifice).

analyzed: ni tigmam abhyaṃśum sīdat hotā manau adhi
translated: Let the Hotri sit down on the sharp-edged altar, according to the mind (of the sacrificer),

analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ oasya sakhyam
translated: Delighting in his friendship.

original: antarichanti taṃ jane rudraṃ paro manīṣayā
analyzed: antar ichanti tam jane rudram paras manīṣayā
translated: They seek him in the people, Rudra, with thought beyond (the reach of thought).

analyzed: gṛbhṇanti jihvayā sasam
translated: They seize him with the tongue, together.

analyzed: jāmī atītape dhanuḥ vayodhāḥ aruhat vanam
translated: In the burning heat, the bow-bearer climbed the tree.

analyzed: dṛṣadam jihvayā avadhīt
translated: He struck the stone with his tongue.

original: caran vatso ruśanniha nidātāraṃ na vindate🔽veti stotavāmbyam
analyzed: caran vatsaḥ ruśan iha nidātāram na vindate  vā iti stotavāmbyam
translated: The young ruddy one wanders here, the calf finds not the one who hides him.🔽He goes to the one who is to be praised with the waters.

original: uto nvasya yan mahadaśvāvad yojanaṃ bṛhad
analyzed: uta u nu asya yat mahat aśvāvat yojanam bṛhat
translated: And now, his great yoke with horses, his great yoke,

analyzed: dāmā rathasya dadṛśe
translated: The yoke of the chariot is seen.

analyzed: duhanti sapta ekām upa dvā pañca sṛjataḥ
translated: They milk the one seven times. Two let loose the five.

analyzed: tīrthe sindhoḥ adhi svare
translated: In the ford of the river, on the sound (of the milking).

analyzed: ā daśabhiḥ vivasvataḥ indraḥ kośam acucyavīt
translated: With ten (verses) to Vivasvan, Indra has loosened the reservoir.

analyzed: khedayā trivṛtā divaḥ
translated: With the three-versed (hymn) he has shaken heaven.

analyzed: pari tri dhātuḥ adhvaram jūrṇiḥ eti navīyasī
translated: The three-formed one goes around the sacrifice, the new one, the more recent.

analyzed: madhvā hotāraḥ añjate
translated: The Hotars anoint themselves with the sweet (Soma).

analyzed: siñcanti namasā avatam uccācakram parijmānam
translated: They pour down the one who is worshipped with homage, the one with the high wheel, the one who goes around,

analyzed: nīcīna bāram akṣitam
translated: The one with the low pole, the imperishable one.

analyzed: niṣiktam puṣkare madhu
translated: The honey has been pressed out for the enemy, poured into the lotus.

analyzed: avatasya visarjane
translated: At the sending forth of the one who has gone away.

analyzed: gāvaḥ upāvata avatam mahī yajñasya rapsu dā
translated: The cows have gone away to the one who has gone away, the great one to the impurities of the sacrifice.

analyzed: ubhā karṇā ahiraṇyayā
translated: Both ears are made of gold.

analyzed: ā sute siñcata śriyam rodasyoḥ abhiśriyam
translated: Pour out the glory, the ornament of the two worlds, into the pressed (juice).

original: rasā dadhītavṛṣabham🔽te jānata svamokyaṃ saṃ vatsāso na mātṛbhiḥ
analyzed: rasāḥ dadhītavṛṣabham  te jānata svam okyam sam vatsāsaḥ na mātṛbhiḥ
translated: Let the juices hold the bull.🔽They, knowing their own place, unite like calves with their mothers.

original: mitho nasanta jāmibhiḥ🔽upa srakveṣu bapsataḥ kṛṇvate dharuṇaṃ divi
analyzed: mithas nasanta jāmibhiḥ  upa srakveṣu bapsataḥ kṛṇvate dharuṇam divi
