translated: Whose most delightful favour is like a father's. Do not forsake us, do not abandon us in our friendship.

original: ṛtena devaḥ savitā śamāyata ṛtasya śṛṅgamurviyā vi paprathe
analyzed: ṛtena devaḥ savitā śamāyate ṛtasya śṛṅgam urviyā vi paprathe
translated: By truth the god Savitar has been appeased. The horn of truth spreads out far and wide.

original: ṛtaṃ sāsāha mahi cit pṛtanyato mā no vi yauṣṭaṃ sakhyā mumocatam🔽dyumnī vāṃ stomo aśvinā krivirna seka ā gatam🔽madhvaḥsutasya sa divi priyo narā pātaṃ gaurāviveriṇe
analyzed: ṛtam sāsāha mahi cit pṛtanyataḥ mā naḥ vi yauṣṭam sakhyā mumocatam  dyumnī vām stomaḥ aśvinā kriviḥ na seke ā gatam  madhvaḥsutasya sa divi priyaḥ narā pātam gaurau iva iriṇe
translated: Truth has overcome even the great enemy. Do not forsake us, do not abandon us in our friendship.🔽Your glorious praise, O Aśvins, is like a ladle. Come to the juice that is pressed.🔽Be dear, O heroes, to the juice that is pressed in heaven. Drink for the one who is free from enemies.

original: pibataṃ gharmaṃ madhumantamaśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā
analyzed: pibatam gharmam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdatam narā
translated: Drink the sweet Soma, O Aśvins. Sit on the sacrificial grass, O heroes.

original: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā ni pātaṃ vedasā vayaḥ
analyzed: tā mandasānā manuṣaḥ duroṇe ā ni pātam vedasā vayaḥ
translated: Being gladdened, come to the house of Manu, O you who are to be worshipped, for strength.

analyzed: ā vām viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ priyamedhāḥ ahūṣata
translated: The singers of beautiful hymns have invoked you with all their help.

original: tā vartiryātamupa vṛktabarhiṣo juṣṭaṃ yajñaṃ diviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: tā vartiḥ yātam upa vṛkta barhiṣaḥ juṣṭam yajñam diviṣṭiṣu
translated: Come to that place, to the sacrifice with strewn grass, which is dear to you in the heavenly rites.

original: pibataṃ somaṃ madhumantamaśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ sumat
analyzed: pibatam somam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdatam sumat
translated: Drink the sweet Soma, O Aśvins. Sit on the well-prepared sacrificial grass.

original: tā vāvṛdhānā upa suṣṭutiṃ divo gantaṃ gaurāviveriṇam
analyzed: tā vāvṛdhānau upa suṣṭutim divaḥ gantam gaurau iva iriṇam
translated: Those two, waxing great, have gone to the praise of heaven, to the fair-shining one

analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā aśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ
translated: Now come, O Aśvins, with your horses, with your rain-filled clouds

original: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī śubhas patī pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā
analyzed: dasrā hiraṇya vartanī śubhaḥ patī pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: O wondrous ones, guiding the golden chariot, lords of splendor, drink the Soma, you who strengthen the rite

original: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmahe vipanyavo viprāso vājasātaye🔽tāvalgū dasrā purudaṃsasā dhiyāśvinā śruṣṭyā gatam🔽taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṃ vasormandānamandhasaḥ🔽abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhirnavāmahe
analyzed: vayam hi vām havāmahe vipanyavaḥ viprāsaḥ vājasātaye  tāvalgū dasrā puru daṃsasā dhiyā aśvinā śruṣṭyā gatam  tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ  abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe
translated: For we invoke you, O you who are far away, the sages, for the winning of strength🔽Come, O you two wondrous, bountiful ones, O Aśvins, to the invocation with your mind🔽We will praise that wondrous Indra of yours, who delights in the juice, who conquers with the law,🔽Like cows to their calves in the stalls, with songs we praise Indra

original: dyukṣaṃ sudānuṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtaṃ giriṃ na purubhojasam
analyzed: dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam
translated: The glorious one, the bountiful one, surrounded with powers, like a mountain, the very hospitable one

original: kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ makṣū gomantamīmahe
analyzed: kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: We eagerly desire the strength that satisfies, the hundredfold, the thousandfold, the one rich in cattle

original: na tvā bṛhanto adrayo varanta indra vīḷavaḥ
analyzed: na tvā bṛhantaḥ adrayaḥ varante indra vīḍavaḥ
translated: The great mountains do not hold you back, O Indra, the spacious ones

original: yad ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakiṣ ṭadā mināti te
analyzed: yat ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakir tadā mināti te
translated: When you wish to give wealth to the one who praises you, no one transgresses that of yours

original: yoddhāsi kratvā śavasota daṃsanā viśvā jātābhi majmanā
analyzed: yoddhā asi kratvā śavasā uta daṃsanā viśvā jātā abhi majmanā
translated: You who fight with wisdom and with power, with splendor, all beings with your majesty

original: ā tvāyamarka ūtaye vavartati yaṃ gotamā ajījanan
analyzed: ā tvā ayam arkaḥ ūtaye vavartati yam gotamāḥ ajījanan
translated: This Ṛk has turned to you for help, which the Gotamas have produced

original: pra hi ririkṣa ojasā divo antebhyas pari🔽na tvā vivyācaraja indra pārthivamanu svadhāṃ vavakṣitha
analyzed: pra hi ririkṣe ojasā divaḥ antebhyaḥ pari  na tvā vivyāca rajaḥ indra pārthivam anu svadhām vavakṣitha
translated: For he is about to spread out with might from the ends of the sky🔽No one can surpass you, O Indra, in the earthly realm. You have extended your own power.

original: nakiḥ pariṣṭirmaghavan maghasya te yad dāśuṣe daśasyasi
analyzed: nakir pariṣṭiḥ maghavan maghasya te yat dāśuṣe daśasyasi
translated: O bountiful one, there is no obstacle to your bounty when you favor the worshiper.

analyzed: asmākam bodhi ucathasya coditā maṃhiṣṭhaḥ vāja sātaye
translated: Be our impeller, O most bountiful one, for the sake of gaining strength.

analyzed: bṛhat indrāya gāyata marutaḥ vṛtra hantamam
translated: Sing to Indra, O Maruts, the hymn of praise to the best slayer of Vrtra,

analyzed: yena jyotiḥ ajanayan ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devam devāya jāgṛvi
translated: By whom they produced the light, the righteous ones, the god for the god, the watchful one.

original: apādhamadabhiśastīraśastihāthendro dyumnyābhavat🔽devāsta indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhadbhāno marudgaṇa
analyzed: apādhamat abhiśastīḥ aśasti hā atha indraḥ dyumnyā abhavat  devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhat bhāno marut gaṇa
translated: He has driven away the curses, the curse-destroyer, then Indra became glorious.🔽The gods, O Indra, have sought you for friendship, O you of great light, O you of the Marut host.

original: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya bṛhate marutaḥ brahma arcata
translated: Sing forth to Indra, the great one, O Maruts, a hymn of praise.

analyzed: vṛtram hanati vṛtrahā śatakratuḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: The Vrtra-slayer, of a hundred sacrifices, with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt, slays Vrtra.

original: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣanmanaḥ śravaścit te asad bṛhat🔽arṣantvāpo javasā vi mātaro hano vṛtraṃ jayā svaḥ
analyzed: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣat manaḥ śravaḥ cit te asat bṛhat  arṣantu āpaḥ javasā vi mātaraḥ hanaḥ vṛtram jaya svar
translated: Bring forth with boldness, O bold one, the thought, let your glory be great.🔽Let the waters flow with speed, the mothers. Slay Vrtra, win the heaven.

analyzed: yat jāyathāḥ apūrvya maghavan vṛtra hatyāya
translated: When you were born, O incomparable one, O bountiful one, for the slaying of Vrtra,

analyzed: tat pṛthivīm aprathayaḥ tat astabhnāḥ uta dyām
translated: Then you spread out the earth, then you established the sky.

original: tat te yajño ajāyata tadarka uta haskṛtiḥ
analyzed: tat te yajñaḥ ajāyata tat arkaḥ uta haskṛtiḥ
translated: From that your sacrifice was born, that light and that joy.

original: tad viśvamabhibhūrasi yajjātaṃ yacca jantvam🔽āmāsu pakvamairaya ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi
analyzed: tat viśvam abhibhūḥ asi yat jātam yat ca jantvam  āmāsu pakvam airayaḥ ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: You are the overlord of all that is born and that which is to be born.🔽You have brought the ripe fruit from the unripe, you have raised the sun in the sky.

original: gharmaṃ na sāman tapatā suvṛktibhirjuṣṭaṃ girvaṇase bṛhat
analyzed: gharmam na sāman tapata suvṛktibhiḥ juṣṭam girvaṇase bṛhat
translated: Like the hot-rayed one, with good hymns, I warm the beloved one, the great one, for the lover of praise.

original: ā no viśvāsu havya indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvāsu havyaḥ indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu
translated: May Indra be with us in all battles, to be invoked.

original: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyā ṛcīṣamaḥ
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyāḥ ṛcīṣamaḥ
translated: The Vrtra-slayer, the most distant one, is present at the prayers and libations, the one who delights in praise.

original: tvaṃ dātā prathamo rādhasāmasyasi satya īśānakṛt
analyzed: tvam dātā prathamaḥ rādhasām asyasi satyaḥ īśāna kṛt
translated: You are the first giver of these gifts, you are the true one who makes the lord.

original: tuvidyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavaso mahaḥ🔽brahmā ta indra girvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā
analyzed: tuvi dyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavasaḥ mahaḥ  brahmā te indra girvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā
translated: We choose the yoke of the mighty one, the son of strength, of great power.🔽O Indra, lover of praise, the prayers are made to you, the unconquered one.

original: imā juṣasvaharyaśva yojanendra yā te amanmahi
analyzed: imā juṣasva aharyaśva yojanā indra yā te amanmahi
translated: O you with tawny horses, accept these offerings, O Indra, which we have thought of.

original: tvaṃ hi satyo maghavannanānato vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase🔽satvaṃ śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe 'rvāñcaṃ rayimā kṛdhi
analyzed: tvam hi satyaḥ maghavan anānataḥ vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase  satvam śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe rvāñcam rayimā kṛdhi
translated: For you, O truthful one, O bountiful one, overcome many forts.🔽O mightiest one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, bring wealth to the worshipper.

original: tvamindra yaśā asy ṛjīṣī śavasas pate
analyzed: tvam indra yaśāḥ asi ṛjīṣī śavasaḥ pate
translated: You, O Indra, are the glorious one, the impetuous one, the lord of strength.

analyzed: tvam vṛtrāṇi haṃsi apratīni ekaḥ id anuttā carṣaṇī dhṛtā
translated: You alone, O unvanquished one, supporting men, slay the unconquerable forts.

original: tamu tvā nūnamasura pracetasaṃ rādho bhāgamivemahe
analyzed: tam u tvā nūnam asura pracetasam rādhaḥ bhāgam iva īmahe
translated: We implore thee, O Asura, the far-seeing one, as a portion of bounty,

original: mahīva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā ta indra pra te sumnā no aśnavan
analyzed: mahī iva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā te indra pra te sumnā naḥ aśnavan
translated: Like a great shield, O Indra, are thy protections. May thy favors reach us.

analyzed: kanyā vāravāyatī somam api srutā avidat
translated: A maiden, weaving, has found the Soma in the flowing stream.

original: astaṃ bharantyabravīdindrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā
analyzed: astam bharantī abravīt indrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā
translated: They carry it to the west. She said, I shall press thee for Indra, I shall press thee for Shakra.

original: asau ya eṣi vīrako gṛhaṃgṛhaṃ vicākaśad
analyzed: asau yaḥ eṣi vīrakaḥ gṛhaṃgṛham vicākaśat
translated: He who goes about as a young man, looking into every house,

analyzed: imam jambha sutam piba dhānāvantam karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam
translated: Drink this son of Jambha, rich in milk, full of curds, with cakes, with praises.

original: ā cana tvā cikitsāmo 'dhi cana tvā nemasi
analyzed: ā cana tvā cikitsāmaḥ dhi cana tvā na imasi
translated: We will think of thee, and we will strive for thee.

original: śanairiva śanakairivendrāyendo pari srava🔽kuvicchakat kuvit karat kuvin no vasyasas karat
analyzed: śanais iva śanakais iva indrāya indo pari srava  kuvid śakat kuvid karat kuvid naḥ vasyasaḥ karat
translated: Slowly, as it were, gently, O Indu, flow for Indra.🔽Will he give? Will he do? Will he do what is good for us?

analyzed: kuvid pati dviṣaḥ yatīḥ indreṇa saṃgamāmahai
translated: Will we go to the wives of our enemies, to meet with Indra?

original: imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tānīndra vi rohaya
analyzed: imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tāni indra vi rohaya
translated: These three layers, O Indra, do thou spread out.

analyzed: śiraḥ tatasya urvarā māt idam me upa udare
translated: The head of that one, the furrow, is here in my belly.

original: asau ca yā na urvarādimāṃ tanvaṃ mama
analyzed: asau ca yā naḥ urvarā āt imām tanvam mama
translated: And that furrow which is yonder, and this body of mine,

original: atho tatasya yacchiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi
analyzed: atha u tatasya yat śiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi
translated: And also the head of that one, make them all hairy.

original: khe rathasya khe 'nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato
analyzed: khe rathasya khe nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato
translated: In the space of the chariot, in the space of the yoke, O Shatakratu,

analyzed: apālām indra tris pūtvī akṛṇoḥ sūrya tvacam
translated: You have made the three-fold skin of Indra, the protector, the sun

original: pāntamā vo andhasa indramabhi pra gāyata🔽viśvāsāhaṃśatakratuṃ maṃhiṣṭhaṃ carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: pāntamāḥ vaḥ andhasaḥ indram abhi pra gāyata  viśvāsāham śatakratum maṃhiṣṭham carṣaṇīnām
translated: Sing forth to Indra, the protector of your drink,🔽The all-conquering, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the most bountiful among men

analyzed: puruhūtam puruṣṭutam gāthānyam sana śrutam
translated: The much-invoked, the much-praised, the singer of hymns, the widely renowned

analyzed: indraḥ iti bravītana
translated: Call him by the name of Indra

original: indra in no mahānāṃ dātā vājānāṃ nṛtuḥ
analyzed: indraḥ id naḥ mahānām dātā vājānām nṛtuḥ
translated: Indra is the great giver of strength, the dancer, to us men

analyzed: mahān abhijñvā yamat
translated: Let him be exalted by me

analyzed: apādu śipri andhasaḥ su dakṣasya prahoṣiṇaḥ
translated: The swift, the handsome, the very skillful, the impetuous ones

analyzed: indoḥ indraḥ yava āśiraḥ
translated: Of Indra, the lord of barley

analyzed: tam vabhi prārcata indram somasya pītaye
translated: Him I praise, Indra, for the drinking of Soma

analyzed: tat id hi asya vardhanam
translated: For that is his exaltation

analyzed: asya pītvā madānām devaḥ devasya ojasā
translated: Having drunk of his gladdening drinks, the god with the god's strength

original: viśvābhi bhuvanā bhuvat🔽tyamu vaḥ satrāsāhaṃ viśvāsu gīrṣvāyatam
analyzed: viśvā abhi bhuvanā bhuvat  tyamu vaḥ satrāsāham viśvāsu gīrṣu āyatam
translated: May he rule over all the worlds🔽That Indra, the fearless one, is extended over all the people

analyzed: ā cyāvayasi ūtaye
translated: And may he lead you to deliverance

analyzed: yudhmam santam anarvāṇam soma pām an apacyutam
translated: The warrior who is irresistible, who drinks Soma, who is unshaken

analyzed: naram avārya kratum
translated: The man whose resolve is unassailable

original: śikṣā ṇa indra rāya ā puru vidvān ṛcīṣama
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā puru vidvān ṛcīṣama
translated: Teach us, O Indra, to gain wealth, O you who know many things, O you who are eager for praise

analyzed: avā naḥ pārye dhane
translated: In our last possession

analyzed: atas cit indra naḥ upa ā yāhi śata vājayā
translated: From there, O Indra, come to us with the hundred-powered one

analyzed: iṣā sahasra vājayā
translated: With the thousand-powered one for food

analyzed: ayāma dhīvataḥ dhiyaḥ rvadbhiḥ śakra godare
translated: We have come, O wise one, with our thoughts, O Shakra, with our horses in the cowpen

analyzed: jayema pṛtsu vajrivas
translated: To win battles, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: vayamu tvā śatakrato gāvo na yavaseṣvā
analyzed: vayam u tvā śatakrato gāvaḥ na yavasa iṣvā
translated: We, O Shatakratu, like cows in the pastures

analyzed: uktheṣu raṇayāmasi
translated: In the hymns, we delight you.

analyzed: viśvā hi martyatvanā anukāmā śatakrato
translated: For all mortal beings desire you, O Shatakratu,

analyzed: aganma vajrin āśasaḥ
translated: We have come, O wielder of the thunderbolt, to the slaughter.

analyzed: tve su putra śavasaḥ vṛtran kāma kātayaḥ
translated: In you, O good son, the desires have found rest, O you who fulfill desires,

analyzed: na tvām indra atiricyate
translated: No one surpasses you, O Indra.

original: sa no vṛṣan saniṣṭhayā saṃ ghorayā dravitnvā
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣan saniṣṭhayā sam ghorayā dravitnvā
translated: O bull, with your most bountiful, terrible, and swift

analyzed: dhiyā aviḍḍhi purandhyā
translated: Thought and wisdom, favor us.

analyzed: yaḥ te nūnam śatakrato indra dyumnitamaḥ madaḥ
translated: O Indra, that most glorious and powerful joy of yours, O Shatakratu,

analyzed: tena nūnam made madeḥ
translated: By which you become intoxicated, even now,

original: yaste citraśravastamo ya indra vṛtrahantamaḥ🔽ya ojodātamomadaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ te citra śravastamaḥ yaḥ indra vṛtra hantamaḥ  yaḥ ojaḥ dātamaḥ omadaḥ
translated: That most famous, O Indra, that which is best at slaying Vrtra,🔽That most powerful joy of yours,

original: vidmā hi yaste adrivastvādattaḥ satya somapāḥ
analyzed: vidma hi yaḥ te adrivastva ādattaḥ satya soma pāḥ
translated: We know that which is yours, O wielder of the thunderbolt, that which you have taken, O true one, O drinker of Soma,

analyzed: viśvāsudasma kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: In all the battles.

original: indrāya madvane sutaṃ pari ṣṭobhantu no giraḥ
analyzed: indrāya madvane sutam pari stobhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: Let our songs resound for Indra, the one pressed in the forest of the maddening drink.

analyzed: arkam arcantu kāravaḥ
translated: Let the singers sing the hymn.

original: yasmin viśvā adhi śriyo raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ
analyzed: yasmin viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ
translated: In whom all the glories and seven assemblies resound,

analyzed: indraṃsute havāmahe
translated: We invoke Indra, the one pressed.

analyzed: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata
translated: The gods have made the sacrifice ready for the one who is aware in the Trikadrukas.

analyzed: tam id giraḥ
translated: Let our songs of praise exalt him

analyzed: ā tvā viśantu indavaḥ samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Let the drops enter into thee as the rivers into the ocean

analyzed: na tvām indra ati ricyate
translated: No one surpasses thee, O Indra

original: vivyaktha mahinā vṛṣan bhakṣaṃ somasya jāgṛve
analyzed: vivyaktha mahinā vṛṣan bhakṣam somasya jāgṛve
translated: Thou hast been disclosed by thy greatness, O bull, for the enjoyment of the watchful Soma

analyzed: yaḥ indra jaṭhareṣu te
translated: That which, O Indra, is in thy belly

original: araṃ ta indra kukṣaye somo bhavatu vṛtrahan
analyzed: aram te indra kukṣaye somaḥ bhavatu vṛtrahan
translated: May Soma, O Indra, be easy for thee in thy belly, O Vr̥itra-slayer

analyzed: aram
translated: Easy for the abode of the moon

original: aramaśvāya gāyati śrutakakṣo araṃ gave🔽aramindrasya dhāmne
analyzed: aram aśvāya gāyati śrutakakṣaḥ aram gave  aram indrasya dhāmne
translated: Easy for the horse to sing, easy for the cow for Indra's abode

original: araṃ hi ṣma suteṣu ṇaḥ someṣvindra bhūṣasi
analyzed: aram hi sma suteṣu naḥ someṣu indra bhūṣasi
translated: Easy, indeed, art thou for us in our pressed (juices), O Indra, in our Soma-offerings

analyzed: aram teśakra dāvane
translated: Easy, O Sakra, for giving

analyzed: parākāt tāt cit adrivas tvām nakṣanta naḥ giraḥ

analyzed: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathāt īṣamāṇāḥ viśve devāḥ ajahuḥ ye sakhāyaḥ
translated: The All-gods, your friends, have left you, seeking the abode of Vritra.

original: marudbhirindra sakhyaṃ te astvathemā viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāsi
analyzed: marudbhiḥ indra sakhyam te astu atha imāḥ viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayāsi
translated: Let your friendship with the Maruts be, O Indra, and so you will conquer all these battles.

original: triḥ ṣaṣṭistvā maruto vāvṛdhānā usrā iva rāśayo yajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: tris ṣaṣṭiḥ tvā marutaḥ vāvṛdhānāḥ usrāḥ iva rāśayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: The sixty-three Maruts, waxing great, like the rays of the sun, are worthy of sacrifice.

original: upa tvemaḥ kṛdhi no bhāgadheyaṃ śuṣmaṃ ta enā haviṣā vidhema
analyzed: upa tvā imaḥ kṛdhi naḥ bhāgadheyam śuṣmam te enā haviṣā vidhema
translated: Come to thee, make our portion for us, with that strength we will serve thee with oblation

original: tigmamāyudhaṃ marutāmanīkaṃ kasta indra prati vajraṃ dadharṣa
analyzed: tigmam āyudham marutām anīkam kaḥ te indra prati vajram dadharṣa
translated: The sharp-weaponed host of the Maruts, who dares to resist Indra's thunderbolt?

original: anāyudhāso asurā adevāścakreṇa tānapa vapa ṛjīṣin
analyzed: an āyudhāsaḥ asurāḥ a devāḥ cakreṇa tān apa vapa ṛjīṣin
translated: The Asuras, weaponless, godless, O thou of the wheel, cast them off, O active one!

original: maha ugrāya tavase suvṛktiṃ preraya śivatamāya paśvaḥ🔽girvāhase gira indrāya pūrvīrdhehi tanve kuvidaṅga vedat
analyzed: mahe ugrāya tavase suvṛktim preraya śivatamāya paśvaḥ  gir vāhase giraḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ dhehi tanve kuvid aṅga vedat
translated: Send forth the most auspicious hymn to the mighty, strong one, to the most auspicious one, O animal!🔽Give to Indra, the bearer of songs, many songs, O thou of body, who knowest how to find him.

original: ukthavāhase vibhve manīṣāṃ druṇā na pāramīrayā nadīnām
analyzed: uktha vāhase vibhve manīṣām druṇā na pāram īraya nadīnām
translated: To the all-pervading one who bears the hymn, like a boat on the rivers, O thou of body, who knowest how to find him.

original: ni spṛśa dhiyā tanvi śrutasya juṣṭatarasya kuvidaṅga vedat
analyzed: ni spṛśa dhiyā tanvi śrutasya juṣṭatarasya kuvidaṅga vedat
translated: Touch with the thought the body of the renowned one, who knowest how to find him, more acceptable.

original: tad viviḍḍhi yat ta indro jujoṣat stuhi suṣṭutiṃ namasāvivāsa
analyzed: tat viviḍḍhi yat te indraḥ jujoṣat stuhi suṣṭutim namasā āvivāsa
translated: Do that which Indra approves of, praise with adoration, O thou of body, who knowest how to find him.

original: upa bhūṣa jaritarmā ruvaṇyaḥ śrāvayā vācaṃ kuvidaṅga vedat🔽ava drapso aṃśumatīmatiṣṭhadiyānaḥ kṛṣṇo daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
analyzed: upa bhūṣa jaritar mā ruvaṇyaḥ śrāvaya vācam kuvidaṅga vedat  ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat iyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: Be ready, O singer, to roar, make the voice resound, O thou of body, who knowest how to find him.🔽The drop has settled in the plant, the black one, borne by the ten thousand, going by thought

original: āvat tamindraḥ śacyā dhamantamapa snehitīrnṛmaṇā adhatta
analyzed: āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīḥ nṛmaṇāḥ adhatta
translated: As far as Indra with Śacī blew it, Nṛman, he placed the oiliness of the drop.

analyzed: drapsam apaśyam viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ
translated: I saw the drop moving in the entrails, on the slope of the river Aṃśumatī.

original: nabho na kṛṣṇamavatasthivāṃsamiṣyāmi vo vṛṣaṇo yudhyatājau
analyzed: nabhaḥ na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yudhyata ājau
translated: I will not go to the sky, O you who are powerful, while you are fighting in the battle.

original: adha drapso aṃśumatyā upasthe 'dhārayat tanvaṃ titviṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: adha drapsaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ upasthe dhārayat tanvam titviṣāṇaḥ
translated: Then the drop, shining, placed his body in the lap of Amshumati.

analyzed: viśaḥ adevīḥ abhyācarantīḥ bṛhaspatinā yujā indraḥ sasāhe
translated: Indra, yoked with Brihaspati, conquered the godless tribes that attacked the people.

original: tvaṃ ha tyat saptabhyo jāyamāno 'śatrubhyo abhavaḥ śatrurindra
analyzed: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra
translated: You, indeed, when born from the seven, became the enemy of the enemies, O Indra.

original: gūḷhe dyāvāpṛthivī anvavindo vibhumadbhyo bhuvanebhyo raṇaṃ dhāḥ🔽tvaṃ ha tyadapratimānamojo vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣito jaghantha🔽tvaṃ śuṣṇasyāvātiro vadhatraistvaṃ gā indra śacyedavindaḥ
analyzed: gūḷhe dyāvāpṛthivī anvavindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ  tvam ha tyad a pratimānam ojaḥ vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣitaḥ jaghantha  tvam śuṣṇasya avātiraḥ vadhatraiḥ tvam gāḥ indra śacyā id avindaḥ
translated: You found the hidden heaven and earth, and give room to the extensive worlds.🔽You, indeed, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with the thunderbolt, boldly struck down the matchless strength.🔽You, O Indra, with the three-killing blows, struck down the wicked Shushna, and found the cows.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnāṃ ghano vṛtrānāṃ taviṣobabhūtha🔽tvaṃ sindhūnrasṛjastastabhānān tvamapo ajayodāsapatnīḥ
analyzed: tvam ha tyad vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām ghanaḥ vṛtrānām taviṣaḥ ubabhūtha  tvam sindhūn rasṛjaḥ stastabhānān tvam apaḥ ajayaḥ udāsa patnīḥ
translated: You, indeed, O bull of men, became the mighty crusher of the forts of the foes.🔽You let loose the roaring rivers, and won the waters for the wives of the Dasa.

original: sa sukratū raṇitā yaḥ suteṣvanuttamanyuryo aheva revān🔽ya eka in naryapāṃsi kartā sa vṛtrahā pratīdanyamāhuḥ
analyzed: sa su kratuḥ raṇitā yaḥ suteṣu anutta manyuḥ yaḥ ahā iva revān  yaḥ ekaḥ id narya apāṃsi kartā sa vṛtrahā pratīdanyam āhuḥ
translated: He is the two good friends who, in the libations, is of irrepressible wrath, and is like a rich man.🔽He alone is called the Vr̥itra-slayer, the doer of manly deeds, the one who looks to the foe.

original: sa vṛtrahendraścarṣaṇīdhṛt taṃ suṣṭutyā havyaṃ huvema
analyzed: sa vṛtrahā indraḥ carṣaṇī dhṛt tam suṣṭutyā havyam huvema
translated: That Vr̥itra-slayer, Indra, the supporter of men, let us invoke with fair praise as an object of worship.

original: sa prāvitā maghavā no 'dhivaktā sa vājasya śravasyasyadātā
analyzed: sa prāvitā maghavā naḥ dhivaktā sa vājasya śravasyasya dātā
translated: He is the impeller, the bountiful one, our overseer, he is the giver of strength and glory.

original: sa vṛtrahendra ṛbhukṣāḥ sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūva
analyzed: sa vṛtrahā indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ sadyas jajñānaḥ havyaḥ babhūva
translated: He is the powerful Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, immediately upon birth he became worthy of oblations.

original: kṛṇvannapāṃsi naryā purūṇi somo na pīto havyaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: kṛṇvan napāṃsi naryā purūṇi somaḥ na pītaḥ havyaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Performing many manly deeds, Soma, when drunk, is worthy of oblations from friends.

original: yā indra bhuja ābharaḥ svarvānasurebhyaḥ🔽stotāramin maghavannasya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ svarvān asurebhyaḥ  stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O Indra, the heaven which you brought from the Asuras,🔽O Maghavan, increase the worshipper of this (sacrifice), and those who spread out the sacrificial grass for you.

analyzed: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvam gām bhāgam avyayam
translated: O Indra, the horse, the cow, the unchanging portion which you enjoy,

original: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin taṃ dhehi mā paṇau
analyzed: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin tam dhehi mā paṇau
translated: Place it in the sacrificer who presses (Soma) and gives gifts, not in the miser.

analyzed: yaḥ indra sastya vrataḥ nuṣva apama devayuḥ
translated: O Indra, he who is faithful to his vow, who sleeps peacefully, who is devoted to the gods,

original: svaiḥ ṣa evairmumurat poṣyaṃ rayiṃ sanutardhehi taṃ tataḥ
analyzed: svaiḥ saḥ evaiḥ mumurat poṣyam rayim sanutardhehi tam tatas
translated: With your own, O Indra, rejoice in the nourishing wealth which you have gained, give it to him from there.

analyzed: yat śakra asi parāvati yat arvāvati vṛtrahan
translated: If you, O Shakra, are far away, if you, O Vrtra-killer, are near,

analyzed: atas tvā gīrbhiḥ dyugat indra keśibhiḥ sutāvānā vivāsati
translated: From there, O Indra, the Soma-pressers with their guiding songs invite you to the sky.

original: yad vāsi rocane divaḥ samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi
analyzed: yat vā asi rocane divaḥ samudrasya adhi viṣṭapi
translated: If you are in the light of heaven, on the ridge of the ocean,

original: yat pārthive sadane vṛtrahantama yadantarikṣa ā gahi
analyzed: yat pārthive sadane vṛtra hantama yat antarikṣe ā gahi
translated: If, O best slayer of Vrtra, in the earthly abode, if in the atmosphere, come!

original: sa naḥ someṣu somapāḥ suteṣu śavasas pate
analyzed: sa naḥ someṣu soma pāḥ suteṣu śavasaḥ pate
translated: You, the drinker of Soma among our Soma offerings, O lord of strength,

analyzed: mādayasva rādasā sūnṛtāvatā indra rāyā parīṇasā
translated: Delight thyself, O Indra, with the gifts of him who is righteous, with wealth and abundant food

original: mā na indra parā vṛṇag bhavā naḥ sadhamādyaḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak bhava naḥ sadhamādyaḥ
translated: Do not forsake us, O Indra, be our best protector

original: tvaṃ na ūtī tvamin na āpyaṃ mā na indra parā vṛṇak
analyzed: tvam naḥ ūtī tvam id naḥ āpyam mā naḥ indra parā vṛṇak
translated: Thou art our helper, thou our protector, do not forsake us, O Indra

original: asme indra sacā sute ni ṣadā pītaye madhu
analyzed: asme indra sacā sute ni sada pītaye madhu
translated: Sit with us, O Indra, by the pressed (Soma) to drink the sweet (juice)

original: kṛdhī jaritremaghavannavo mahadasme indra sacā sute
analyzed: kṛdhi jaritre maghavan avaḥ mahat asme indra sacā sute
translated: Make great for the singer, O bountiful one, O Indra, by the pressed (Soma)

original: na tvā devāsa āśata na martyāso adrivaḥ
analyzed: na tvā devāsaḥ āśata na martyāsaḥ adrivas
translated: Neither the gods nor the mortal men, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: viśvā jātāniśavasābhibhūrasi na tvā devāsa āśata🔽viśvāḥ pṛtanā abhibhūtaraṃ naraṃ sajūstatakṣurindraṃjajanuśca rājase
analyzed: viśvā jātāni śavasā abhibhūḥ asi na tvā devāsaḥ āśata  viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhibhūtaram naram sajūs tatakṣuḥ indram jajanuḥ ca rājase
translated: Have attained to thee, who art mighty by thy power over all beings. Neither the gods nor the mortal men have attained to thee🔽The Maruts, the creators, have fashioned Indra, the hero who conquers all armies, as a king

original: kratvā varuṣṭhaṃ vara āmurimutogramojiṣṭhaṃ tavasaṃ tarasvinam🔽samīṃ rebhāso asvarannindraṃ somasya pītaye
analyzed: kratvā varuṣṭham vare āmurim uta ugram ojiṣṭham tavasam tarasvinam  samīm rebhāsaḥ asvaran indram somasya pītaye
translated: By wisdom the best, the most manly, the most powerful, the strongest, the most impetuous🔽The singers have sung to Indra to drink the Soma

analyzed: svarpatiṃyadīm vṛdhe dhṛtavrataḥ hi ojasā samūtibhiḥ
translated: To him who is the lord of heaven, to him who is firm in his vow, for increase (of his power), for he is mighty by his help

original: nemiṃ namanti cakṣasā meṣaṃ viprā abhisvarā
analyzed: nemim namanti cakṣasā meṣam viprāḥ abhisvarā
translated: The sages with their eye worship him, the ram, with their hymns

original: sudītayo vo adruho 'pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ
analyzed: su dītayaḥ vaḥ adruhaḥ pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: Your very active, guileless (helpers), O ye rich in wealth, have sung well to you, with the Rik-verses

original: tamindraṃ johavīmi maghavānamugraṃ satrā dadhānamapratiṣkutaṃ śavāṃsi
analyzed: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutam śavāṃsi
translated: I invoke that Indra, the bountiful, the mighty one, who always possesses unconquerable powers,

original: maṃhiṣṭho gīrbhirā ca yajñiyo vavartad rāye no viśvā supathā kṛṇotu vajrī
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhirā ca yajñiyaḥ vavartat rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī
translated: The most generous one, to be worshipped with songs, may he turn to us. May the wielder of the thunderbolt make all paths easy for us to obtain wealth.

original: tvaṃ pura indra cikidenā vyojasā śaviṣṭha śakra nāśayadhyai
analyzed: tvam puras indra vyojasā śaviṣṭha śakra nāśayadhyai
translated: O Indra, you have shattered the forts with your strength, O mightiest one, O Shakra, to be destroyed.

original: tvad viśvāni bhuvanāni vajrin dyāvā rejete pṛthivī ca bhīṣā
analyzed: tvat viśvāni bhuvanāni vajrin dyāvā rejete pṛthivī ca bhīṣā
translated: O wielder of the thunderbolt, all the worlds, through your fear, the sky and the earth shine forth.

original: tan ma ṛtamindra śūra citra pātvapo na vajrin duritāti parṣi bhūri
analyzed: tat me ṛtam indra śūra citra pātu apaḥ na vajrin duritā ati parṣi bhūri
translated: O Indra, O hero, protect that truth of mine, O wondrous one, as the wielder of the thunderbolt the waters. You carry us over many dangers.

original: kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyerviśvapsnyasya spṛhayāyyasya rājan
analyzed: kadā naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā daśasyeḥ viśvapsnyasya spṛhayāyyasya rājan
translated: O Indra, when will you favor us with wealth, O king, of all kinds, to be desired?

original: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat
analyzed: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat
translated: Sing a Saman to Indra, to the great, to the inspired one,

analyzed: dharma kṛte vipaścite panasyave
translated: To the creator of order, the wise one, the one who deserves praise.

analyzed: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi tvam sūryam arocayaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, are the overlord. You have caused Surya to shine.

analyzed: viśvakarmā viśva devaḥ mahān asi
translated: You are the all-creating, all-god, the great one.

original: vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svaragacho rocanaṃ divaḥ🔽devāsta indra sakhyāya yemire
analyzed: vibhrājam jyotiṣā svara gachaḥ rocanam divaḥ  devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire
translated: Shining with light, you have gone to the shining realm of the sky.🔽The gods have turned to you, O Indra, for friendship.

analyzed: ā indra naḥ gadhi priyaḥ satrājit agohyaḥ
translated: O Indra, be our dear guest, the ever-victorious one, the one who cannot be hidden,

analyzed: giriḥ na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: Like a mountain, all-pervading, the lord of heaven.

original: abhi hi satya somapā ubhe babhūtha rodasī
analyzed: abhi hi satya soma pāḥ ubhe babhūtha rodasī
translated: For thou hast become, O true Soma-drinker, the lord of both worlds.

analyzed: indra asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: Thou art the increaser of the presser, O Indra, the lord of heaven.

analyzed: tvam hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi
translated: For thou, O Indra, art the breaker of the forts of all the ancient ones.

analyzed: hantā dasyoḥ manoḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: The slayer of the Dasyus, the increaser of men, the lord of heaven.

original: adhā hindra girvaṇa upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe
analyzed: adha hi indra girvaṇaḥ upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe
translated: Now, O Indra, lover of the song, we have created for thee great desires.

analyzed: udevayantaḥ udabhiḥ
translated: The waters have been made to swell.

original: vārṇa tvā yavyābhirvardhanti śūra brahmāṇi🔽vāvṛdhvāṃsaṃ cidadrivo divedive
analyzed: vārṇa tvā yavyābhiḥ vardhanti śūra brahmāṇi  vāvṛdhvāṃsam cit adrivas dive dive
translated: They strengthen thee, O hero, with the waters and the barley, O thou who art to be praised with hymns.🔽Even him who is to be strengthened, O thou who art to be praised with hymns, day by day.

original: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayorau ratha uruyuge🔽indravāhā vacoyujā
analyzed: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayā urau rathe uru yuge  indra vāhā vacaḥ yujā
translated: They yoke the two Bay Steeds of the swift one with a song, the chariot with the wide yoke.🔽Drawn by speech, O Indra, thou art to be borne.

original: tvaṃ na indrā bharanojo nṛmṇaṃ śatakrato vicarṣaṇe
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ā bharan ojaḥ nṛmṇam śatakrato vicarṣaṇe
translated: O Indra, O thou of a hundred powers, O thou who art very active, grant us strength and heroism.

analyzed: ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham
translated: Bring us a hero who conquers in battle.

original: tvaṃ hi naḥ pitā vaso tvaṃ mātā śatakrato babhūvitha
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha
translated: For thou hast become, O good one, O thou of a hundred powers, our father and mother.

analyzed: adhā te sumnamīmahe
translated: Now we long for thy bliss.

original: tvāṃ śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantamupa bruve śatakrato
analyzed: tvām śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato
translated: To thee, O mighty one, O thou who art invoked by many, O thou who sendest strength, O thou of a hundred powers, I speak.

analyzed: sa naḥ urāsva su vīryam
translated: Grant us good heroism.

analyzed: tvāmidāḥ hyas naraḥ pīpyan vajrin bhūrṇayaḥ
translated: The men, O thou who hast the thunderbolt, the impetuous ones, have pressed thee today.

original: sa indra stomavāhasāmiha śrudhyupa svasaramā gahi
analyzed: saḥ indra stoma vāhasām iha śrudhi upa svasaramā gahi
translated: O Indra, be thou here the bearer of the praise and the song. Come to thy own abode.

original: matsvā suśipra harivastadīmahe tve ā bhūṣanti vedhasaḥ
analyzed: matsva su śipra harivastadīmahe tve ā bhūṣanti vedhasaḥ
translated: O you with beautiful eyebrows, O you whose wealth is in the bay steeds, we desire you. The creators delight in you.

analyzed: tava śravāṃsi upamāni ukthyā suteṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Your glories are worthy of praise and lauds in the pressed (Soma). O Indra, lover of praise,🔽All men enjoy Indra's gifts,

analyzed: śrāyantaḥ iva sūryam viśve dindrasya bhakṣata
translated: As if longing for the sun.

original: vasūni jāte janamāna ojasā prati bhāgaṃ na dīdhima
analyzed: vasūni jāte janamāne ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhima
translated: The bountiful one, the bestower of wealth, whom all men praise at birth with might,🔽As if allotting a share to the wise one.

original: anarśarātiṃ vasudāmupa stuhi bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ
analyzed: anarśarātim vasu dām upa stuhi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ
translated: Praise him, the giver of treasures, the bestower of goods. Blessed are Indra's gifts.

original: so asya kāmaṃ vidhato na roṣati mano dānāya codayan
analyzed: saḥ asya kāmam vidhataḥ na roṣati manaḥ dānāya codayan
translated: He does not restrain his will, the impeller, when he is minded to give.

original: tvamindra pratūrtiṣvabhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ🔽aśastihā janitā viśvatūrasi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ
analyzed: tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ  aśasti hā janitā viśvatūrasi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ
translated: You, O Indra, in your impetuosities, are over all the enemies.🔽You are the begetter, the conqueror of all, the slayer of the reviler. You are the overcomer of the overcomer.

original: anu te śuṣmaṃ turayantamīyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśuṃ na mātarā
analyzed: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā
translated: The two worlds follow your impetuous strength, as two mothers their child.

original: viśvāste spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtraṃ yadindratūrvasi
analyzed: viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indratūrvasi
translated: All your enemies you crush in your wrath, if you, O Indra, hasten to the foe.

analyzed: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram a prahitam
translated: From this side we invoke your undecaying leader, the unerring one,

analyzed: āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam atūrtam tugryāvṛdham
translated: The swift one, the conqueror, the goader, the best charioteer, the unerring one, the strengthener of Tugrya.

analyzed: iṣkartāram aniṣkṛtam sahaskṛtam śatamūtim śatakratum
translated: The unerring one, the doer of what is to be done, the performer of a hundred deeds, the protector of a hundred, the performer of a hundred sacrifices.

analyzed: samānam indram avase havāmahe vasavānam vasūjuvam
translated: We invoke the one Indra for help, the possessor of wealth, the impeller of the possessors of wealth.

original: ayaṃ ta emi tanvā purastād viśve devā abhi mā yanti paścāt
analyzed: ayam te emi tanvā purastāt viśve devāḥ abhi mā yanti paścāt
translated: I go forth with this body in front, all the gods come to me from behind.

original: yadā mahyaṃ dīdharo bhāgamindrādin mayā kṛṇavo vīryāṇi
analyzed: yadā mahyam dīdharaḥ bhāgam indra adit mayā kṛṇavaḥ vīryāṇi
translated: When you have given me a share, O Indra, then you will accomplish your manly deeds with me.

original: dadhāmi te madhuno bhakṣamagre hitaste bhāgaḥ suto astu somaḥ
analyzed: dadhāmi te madhunaḥ bhakṣam agre hitaḥ te bhāgaḥ sutaḥ astu somaḥ
translated: I place before you a portion of honey; may the pressed Soma be your share.

original: asaśca tvaṃ dakṣiṇataḥ sakhā me 'dhā vṛtrāṇijaṅghanāva bhūri
analyzed: asaḥ ca tvam dakṣiṇatas sakhā me dhāḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri
translated: Be you an unfailing friend on my right hand, and give me strength to crush many foes.

original: pra su stomaṃ bharata vājayanta indrāya satyaṃ yadi satyamasti
analyzed: pra su stomam bharata vājayantaḥ indrāya satyam yadi satyam asti
translated: Bring forth the hymn that gives strength, if truth is in Indra, to him who is true.

original: nendro astīti nema u tva āha ka īṃ dadarśa kamabhiṣṭavāma
analyzed: na indraḥ asti iti nemaḥ u tve āha kaḥ īm dadarśa kam abhiṣṭavāma
translated: No one says to you, Indra does not exist. Who has seen him? Whom have you pleased?

original: ayamasmi jaritaḥ paśya meha viśvā jātānyabhyasmi mahnā
analyzed: ayam asmi jaritar paśya mā iha viśvā jātāni abhi asmi mahnā
translated: Here I am, O singer, behold me. By my greatness I am over all beings.

original: ṛtasya mā pradiśo vardhayantyādardiro bhuvanā dardarīmi
analyzed: ṛtasya mā pradiśaḥ vardhayanti ādardiraḥ bhuvanā dardarīmi
translated: May the directions of truth increase me. I, the crusher, crush the worlds.

original: ā yan mā venā aruhannṛtasyanekamāsīnaṃ haryatasya pṛṣṭhe
analyzed: ā yat mā venāḥ āsīnam haryatasya pṛṣṭhe
translated: When the veins have mounted me, seated on the back of the tawny one of truth,

original: manaścin me hṛda ā pratyavocadacikradañchiśumantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: manaḥ cit me hṛde ā pratyavocat acikradan śiśumantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
translated: My mind has spoken to me from the heart. The young ones have bellowed, the friends.

original: viśvet tā te savaneṣu pravācyā yā cakartha maghavannindra sunvate
analyzed: viśvā id tā te savaneṣu pravācyā yā cakartha maghavan indra sunvate
translated: All that you have done, O bountiful Indra, for the presser at the libations, that must be told at your festivals.

original: pārāvataṃ yat purusambhṛtaṃ vasvapāvṛṇoḥ śarabhāya ṛṣibandhave
analyzed: pārāvatam yat puru sambhṛtam vasu apāvṛṇoḥ śarabhāya ṛṣi bandhave
translated: The wealth that was gathered by the people, the pigeon, thou openest for the lion, for the friend of the Rishis.

original: pra nūnaṃ dhāvatā pṛthaṃ neha yo vo avāvarīt
analyzed: pra nūnam dhāvata pṛtham na iha yaḥ vaḥ avāvarīt
translated: Now run ye forth, O ye two, to the wide place, he who hath turned to you here.

original: ni ṣīṃ vṛtrasya marmaṇi vajramindro apīpatat
analyzed: ni sīm vṛtrasya marmaṇi vajram indraḥ apīpatat
translated: Indra hath hurled his thunderbolt into the heart of Vritra.

analyzed: manaḥ javāḥ ayamānaḥ āyasīm atarat puram
translated: Swift as thought, he hath come, and hath cleft the iron fortress.

original: divaṃ suparṇo gatvāya somaṃ vajriṇa ābharat
analyzed: divam suparṇaḥ gatvāya somam vajriṇe ābharat
translated: The eagle, having gone to the sky, hath brought the Soma to the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: samudre antaḥ śayata udnā vajro abhīvṛtaḥ
analyzed: samudre antar śayate udnā vajraḥ abhīvṛtaḥ
translated: He lieth within the ocean, the thunderbolt is covered by the flood.

analyzed: bharanti asmai saṃyataḥ puras prasravaṇāḥ balim
translated: They bring him the oblation, the forts with the outpourings in front, are bound to him.

original: yad vāg vadantyavicetanāni rāṣṭrī devānāṃ niṣasādamandrā
analyzed: yat vāc vadantī avicetanāni rāṣṭrī devānām niṣasāda mandrā
translated: What the insentient things say, the queen of the gods hath sat down, the slow one.

original: catasra ūrjaṃ duduhe payāṃsi kva svidasyāḥ paramaṃ jagāma
analyzed: catasraḥ ūrjam duduhe payāṃsi kva svid asyāḥ paramam jagāma
translated: She hath milked out four kinds of strength and milk. Where hath she gone, that highest one?

original: devīṃ vācamajanayanta devāstāṃ viśvarūpāḥ paśavo vadanti🔽sā no mandreṣamūrjaṃ duhānā dhenurvāgasmānupa suṣṭutaitu🔽sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva dyaurdehi lokaṃ vajrāya viṣkabhe
analyzed: devīm vācam ajanayanta devāḥ tām viśva rūpāḥ paśavaḥ vadanti  sā naḥ mandrā iṣam ūrjam duhānā dhenuḥ vāc asmān upa suṣṭutā etu  sakhe viṣṇo vitaram vi kramasva dyauḥ dehi lokam vajrāya viṣkabhe
translated: The gods have generated the divine speech. The animals of all forms speak it.🔽May that speech come to us, the milch cow, the cow that milks out strength for us, the slow one, may it come to us with good praises.🔽O friend Vishnu, spread out the expanse, give room to the sky for the thunderbolt to strike.

original: hanāva vṛtraṃ riṇacāva sindhūnindrasya yantu prasave visṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: hanāva vṛtram riṇacāva sindhūn indrasya yantu prasave visṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Let them go forth, sent by the impulse of Indra, to slay Vritra and to bind the rivers.

analyzed: ṛdhak itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye
translated: That mortal who has served the gods with his whole being

analyzed: yaḥ nūnam mitrāvaruṇau abhiṣṭaye ācakre havya dātaye
translated: Who has brought you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, to the worshipper's aid

analyzed: varṣiṣṭha kṣatrau uru cakṣasā narā rājānā dīrgha śruttamā
translated: Kings with the most extensive rule, far-seeing, most renowned,

original: tā bāhutā na daṃsanā ratharyataḥ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
analyzed: tā bāhutā na daṃsanā ratharyataḥ sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
translated: You who are powerful, who move on with your chariot, together with the rays of the sun

original: pra yo vāṃ mitrāvaruṇājiro dūto adravat
analyzed: pra yaḥ vām mitrāvaruṇā ajiraḥ dūtaḥ adravat
translated: He who has run as your messenger, O Mitra-Varuṇa, the priest

analyzed: ayaḥ śīrṣā maderaghuḥ
translated: With an iron head, has become weary

original: na yaḥ sampṛche na punarhavītave nasaṃvādāya ramate
analyzed: na yaḥ sampṛcche na punarhavītave na saṃvādāya ramate
translated: Who does not seek to be questioned again for a burnt offering, who does not delight in conversation

original: tasmān no adya samṛteruruṣyataṃ bāhubhyāṃ na uruṣyatam
analyzed: tasmāt naḥ adya samṛteḥ uruṣyatam bāhubhyām naḥ uruṣyatam
translated: From that, O ye who are prosperous, protect us today, protect us with your arms

original: pra mitrāya prāryamṇe sacathyam ṛtāvaso🔽varūthyaṃ varuṇe chandyaṃ vaca stotraṃ rājasu gāyata
analyzed: pra mitrāya pra aryamṇe sacathyam ṛtāvaso  varūthyam varuṇe chandyam vacaḥ stotram rājasu gāyata
translated: Go to Mitra, to Aryaman, to the truthful one, O ye of true ordinances🔽To Varuṇa, to the one who is to be sought for protection, to the one who is to be delighted with the hymn, sing the praise among the kings

original: te hinvire aruṇaṃ jenyaṃ vasvekaṃ putraṃ tisṝṇām
analyzed: te hinvire aruṇam jenyam vasu ekam putram tisṝṇām
translated: They impel the red one, the noble one, the single son of the three, the wealth

analyzed: tedhāmāni amṛtā martyānām adabdhā abhi cakṣate
translated: The immortal ones look on the abodes of mortals, the undaunted ones

analyzed: ā me vacāṃsi udyatā dyumattamāni kartvā
translated: My uplifted words, most glorious, to be done

original: ubhā yātaṃ nāsatyā sajoṣasā prati havyāni vītaye
analyzed: ubhā yātam nāsatyā sajoṣasā prati havyāni vītaye
translated: Come both of you, O Nāsatyas, in harmony, to the offerings to be enjoyed

original: rātiṃ yad vāmarakṣasaṃ havāmahe yuvābhyāṃ vājinīvasū
analyzed: rātim yat vāmarakṣasam havāmahe yuvābhyām vājinīvasū
translated: When we invoke your favour, your protection, O you two rich in treasure

original: prācīṃ hotrāṃ pratirantāvitaṃ narā gṛṇānā jamadagninā
analyzed: prācīm hotrām pratirantau itam narā gṛṇānā jamadagninā
translated: O heroes, you two have accepted this eastern oblation, praised by Jamadagni.

original: ā no yajñaṃ divispṛśaṃ vāyo yāhi sumanmabhiḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam divispṛśam vāyo yāhi su manmabhiḥ
translated: Come to our sacrifice, O Vayu, which touches the sky, with your well-disposed thoughts.

original: antaḥ pavitra upari śrīṇāno 'yaṃ śukro ayāmi te
analyzed: antar pavitre upari śrīṇānaḥ yam śukraḥ ayāmi te
translated: Flowing within the pure filter, above, this bright one is coming to you.

original: vetyadhvaryuḥ pathibhī rajiṣṭhaiḥ prati havyāni vītaye
analyzed: veti adhvaryuḥ pathibhiḥ rajiṣṭhaiḥ prati havyāni vītaye
translated: The Adhvaryu, by the most direct paths, has come to the offerings for the feast.

original: adhā niyutva ubhayasya naḥ piba śuciṃ somaṃ gavāśiram
analyzed: adha niyutvas ubhayasya naḥ piba śucim somam gavāśiram
translated: Now, O lord of the chariot team, drink of both ours, the pure Soma, the head of the cow.

original: baṇ mahānasi sūrya baḷ āditya mahānasi
analyzed: baṭ mahānasi sūrya baṭ āditya mahānasi
translated: O Sun, you are great; O Aditya, you are great.

original: mahaste sato mahimā panasyate 'ddhā deva mahānasi🔽baṭ surya śravasā mahānasi satrā deva mahānasi
analyzed: mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā panasyate ddhā deva mahān asi  baṭ surya śravasā mahānasi satrā deva mahānasi
translated: The greatness of your being is praised; indeed, O god, you are great.🔽O Sun, you are great by fame; you are always great, O god.

analyzed: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam
translated: The lord, the great light of the gods, the priest of the Asuras, is all-pervading and invincible.

original: iyaṃ yā nīcyarkiṇī rūpā rohiṇyā kṛtā
analyzed: iyam yā nīcī arkiṇī rūpā rohiṇyā kṛtā
translated: This low-lying, reddish form, made by Rohini,

analyzed: citrā iva pratyadarśyā āyatī antar daśasu bāhuṣu
translated: appears like a picture, shining among the ten fingers.

original: prajā ha tisro atyāyamīyurnyanyā arkamabhito viviśre
analyzed: prajāḥ ha tisraḥ atyāyam īyuḥ ni anyāḥ arkam abhitas viviśre
translated: Three kinds of offspring have passed beyond; others have entered around the sun.

original: bṛhad dha tasthau bhuvaneṣvantaḥ pavamāno harita ā viveśa
analyzed: bṛhat ha tasthau bhuvaneṣu antar pavamānaḥ haritaḥ ā viveśa
translated: The great one has stood in the worlds; Pavamana has entered the green ones.

original: mātā rudrāṇāṃ duhitā vasūnāṃ svasādityānāmamṛtasya nābhiḥ
analyzed: mātā rudrāṇām duhitā vasūnām svasā ādityānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: Mother of the Rudras, daughter of the Vasus, sister of the Adityas, navel of immortality,

original: pra nu vocaṃ cikituṣe janāya mā gāmanāgāmaditiṃ vadhiṣṭa
analyzed: pra nu vocam cikituṣe janāya mā gām anāgām aditim vadhiṣṭa
translated: Now I will speak to the people who seek knowledge, do not kill the cow who does not come, Aditi

original: vacovidaṃ vācamudīrayantīṃ viśvābhirdhībhirupatiṣṭhamānām🔽devīṃ devebhyaḥ paryeyuṣīṃ gāmā māvṛkta martyo dabhracetāḥ
analyzed: vacaḥ vidam vācam udīrayantīm viśvābhiḥ dhībhiḥ upatiṣṭhamānām  devīm devebhyaḥ paryeyuṣīm gām ā mā avṛkta martyaḥ dabhra cetāḥ
translated: The one who knows speech, uttering speech, approaching with all thoughts🔽The divine cow who goes around to the gods, let no mortal of feeble mind deceive

original: tvamagne bṛhad vayo dadhāsi deva dāśuṣe
analyzed: tvam agne bṛhat vayaḥ dadhāsi deva dāśuṣe
translated: You, O Agni, O god, bestow great life upon the worshipper

analyzed: kaviḥ gṛhapatiḥ yuvā
translated: The sage, the lord of the house, the young one

original: sa na īḷānayā saha devānagne duvasyuvā🔽cikid vibhānavā vaha
analyzed: sa naḥ īḍānayā saha devān agne duvasyuvā  cikit vibhānavā vaha
translated: With her who invites, O Agni, with the worshipper, the gods🔽Do you, O you who shine, carry (them)

original: tvayā ha svid yujā vayaṃ codiṣṭhena yaviṣṭhya
analyzed: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam codiṣṭhena yaviṣṭhya
translated: By you, O most youthful one, we, with the most powerful one,

analyzed: abhi sma u vājasātaye
translated: We will go forth for the sake of gaining booty

analyzed: aurva bhṛguvat śuci mapnavāna vadāḥ huve
translated: Like Aurva and Bhrigu, I invoke the pure one, the son of Apnavana,

analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni, clothed in the ocean

analyzed: huve vāta svanam kavim parjanya krandyam sahaḥ
translated: I invoke the one whose voice is like the wind, the strength that resounds like Parjanya,

analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni, clothed in the ocean

original: ā savaṃ savituryathā bhagasyeva bhujiṃ huve
analyzed: ā savam savituḥ yathā bhagasya iva bhujim huve
translated: I invoke the impulse of Savitar, like the enjoyment of Bhaga,

analyzed: agnim samudra vāsasam
translated: Agni, clothed in the ocean

analyzed: agnim vaḥ vṛdhantam adhvarāṇām purūtamam
translated: Agni, your most prosperous one, the best of sacrifices,

analyzed: achā naptre sahasvate
translated: To the grandson, the mighty one

original: ayaṃ yathā na ābhuvat tvaṣṭā rūpeva takṣyā
analyzed: ayam yathā naḥ ābhuvat tvaṣṭā rūpā iva takṣyā
translated: May he be like Tvastr to us, like a sculptor to a form,

analyzed: asya kratvā yaśasvataḥ
translated: By his wisdom, of the glorious one

original: ayaṃ viśvā abhi śriyo 'gnirdeveṣu patyate🔽ā vājairupa no gamat
analyzed: ayam viśvāḥ abhi śriyaḥ gniḥ deveṣu patyate  ā vājaiḥ upa naḥ gamat
translated: This Agni rules over all the glories among the gods.🔽May he come to us with his strength.

analyzed: viśveṣām iha stuhi hotṝṇām yaśastamam
translated: Here praise the most glorious of all the Hotars,

analyzed: agnim yajñeṣupūrvyam
translated: Agni, the foremost in sacrifices.

analyzed: śīram pāvaka śociṣam jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ dama iṣvā
translated: The radiant one with purifying radiance, the eldest in the houses,

analyzed: dīdāya dīrghaśruttamaḥ
translated: Who shines with the most far-reaching light.

original: tamarvantaṃ na sānasiṃ gṛṇīhi vipra śuṣmiṇam
analyzed: tam arvantam na sānasim gṛṇīhi vipra śuṣmiṇam
translated: Sing to him, O sage, the swift one who brings good things, the mighty one,

analyzed: mitraṃna yātayat janam
translated: The friend who guides the people to be sacrificed to.

analyzed: upa tvā jāmayaḥ giraḥ dediśatīḥ haviṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The songs of the kinsmen are offered to you, O Agni, the makers of oblations,

analyzed: vāyoḥ anīke asthiran
translated: They have settled in the presence of Vayu.

analyzed: yasya tri dhātu avṛtam barhiḥ tasthau asat dinam
translated: Whose threefold sacred grass is spread out, well-covered,

analyzed: dadhā padaā
translated: He has placed his foot.

analyzed: padam devasya mīḍhuṣaḥ na adhṛṣṭābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: The foot of the bountiful god, with his unassailable aids,

analyzed: bhadrāsūryaḥ iva upadṛś
translated: Like a well-seeing one with a bright sun.

analyzed: agne ghṛtasya dhītibhiḥ tepānaḥ deva śociṣā
translated: O Agni, with the thoughts of ghee, being purified, O god, with your radiance,

analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: Carry the gods and worship them.

original: taṃ tvājananta mātaraḥ kaviṃ devāso aṅgiraḥ
analyzed: tam tvā ajananta mātaraḥ kavim devāsaḥ aṅgiraḥ
translated: The mothers have generated you, the wise one, O divine Angiras,

analyzed: havyavāham amartyam
translated: The bearer of oblations, the immortal one.

analyzed: pracetasam tvā kave gne dūtam vareṇyam
translated: The wise ones have seated you, O Agni, the foreseer, the messenger, the excellent one,

analyzed: havyavāham ni sedire
translated: The bearer of oblations.

analyzed: nahi me asti aghnyā na svadhitiḥ vananvati
translated: For I have no sacrificial cow, no axe to cut down the forest,

analyzed: atha etādṛś bharāmi te
translated: Yet I bring you this kind of offering.

original: yadagne kāni kāni cidā te dārūṇi dadhmasi
analyzed: yat agne kāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi
translated: Whatever kinds of wood we put into thee, O Agni,

analyzed: tā juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: Accept them, O youngest one.

analyzed: yat atti upajihvikā yat vamraḥ atisarpati
translated: What the tongue-licking (disease) eats, what the creeping eruption crawls over,

analyzed: sarvam tat astu te ghṛtam
translated: Let all that be ghee for thee.

analyzed: agnim indhānaḥ manasā dhiyam saceta martyaḥ
translated: Kindling Agni in his mind, the mortal one should think of the thought,

analyzed: agnim īdhe vivasvabhiḥ  adarśi gātu vittamaḥ yasmin vratāni ādadhuḥ
translated: Agni should be kindled with the rays of the sun.🔽He has appeared, the best finder of room, in whom they have placed the observances.

original: upo ṣu jātamāryasya vardhanamagniṃ nakṣanta no giraḥ
analyzed: upa u su jātam āryasya vardhanam agnim nakṣanta naḥ giraḥ
translated: To the newly born Agni, the augmenter of the noble one, our songs of praise go forth.

analyzed: pra daivodāsaḥ agniḥ devān achā na majmanā
translated: Agni, the servant of the gods, has gone to the gods by his might.

original: anu mātarampṛthivīṃ vi vāvṛte tasthau nākasya sānavi
analyzed: anu mātarampṛthivīm vi vāvṛte tasthau nākasya sānavi
translated: He spreads out over his mother earth, he stands on the ridge of the vault.

analyzed: yasmāt rejanta kṛṣṭayaḥ carkṛtyāni kṛṇvataḥ
translated: From whom the people tremble, who performs the deeds to be done,

analyzed: sahasra sām medha sātau iva tmanā agnim dhībhiḥ saparyata
translated: Like the one who wins a thousand, serve Agni with your thoughts, with your own selves.

original: pra yaṃ rāye ninīṣasi marto yaste vaso dāśat🔽sa vīraṃ dhatte agna ukthaśaṃsinaṃ tmanā sahasrapoṣiṇam
analyzed: pra yam rāye ninīṣasi martaḥ yaḥ te vaso dāśat  sa vīram dhatte agne uktha śaṃsinam tmanā sahasra poṣiṇam
translated: The man who wishes to lead you to wealth, O Vasu Agni, who wishes to give to you,🔽He begets a heroic son who praises with hymns, with his own self, who has a thousandfold nourishment.

original: sa dṛḷhe cidabhi tṛṇatti vājamarvatā sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ
analyzed: sa dṛḷhe cit abhi tṛṇatti vājam arvatā sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ
translated: He breaks through even strong wealth with his horse, he bestows imperishable fame.

original: tve devatrā sadā purūvaso viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
analyzed: tve devatrā sadā purūvaso viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
translated: In you, O god, we always, O you of much wealth, wish to possess all good things.

original: yo viśvā dayate vasu hotā mandro janānām
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā dayate vasu hotā mandraḥ janānām
translated: He who bestows all wealth, the delightful Hotar of the people

original: madhorna pātrā prathamānyasmai pra stomā yantyagnaye
analyzed: madhoḥ na pātrā prathamāni asmai pra stomāḥ yanti agnaye
translated: For whom the first vessels of honey are prepared, to whom the praises go, to Agni

original: aśvaṃ na gīrbhī rathyaṃ sudānavo marmṛjyante devayavaḥ
analyzed: aśvam na gīrbhiḥ rathyam sudānavaḥ marmṛjyante devayavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones, the devotees, adorn him like a horse for a chariot with their songs

original: ubhe toke tanaye dasma viśpate parṣi rādho maghonām
analyzed: ubhe toke tanaye dasma viśpate parṣi rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: O wondrous lord of the people, you support both the born and the unborn, the bounty of the generous ones

original: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya gāyata ṛtāvne bṛhate śukraśociṣe
analyzed: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya gāyata ṛtāvne bṛhate śukra śociṣe
translated: Sing to the most bountiful one, to the one who follows the truth, to the great one with pure and shining flames

analyzed: upastutāsaḥ agnaye
translated: We have been praised by Agni

original: ā vaṃsate maghavā vīravad yaśaḥ samiddho dyumnyāhutaḥ
analyzed: ā vaṃsate maghavā vīravat yaśaḥ samiddhaḥ dyumnya āhutaḥ
translated: May the generous one come to us with heroic fame, kindled, offered to with splendor

analyzed: kuvid naḥ asya sumatiḥ navīyasī achā vājebhiḥ āgamat
translated: Will his most recent good will come to us with strength?

analyzed: preṣṭham u priyāṇām stuhi asau ātithim
translated: Sing to him, the most beloved of the dear ones, the Atithi,

analyzed: agnim rathānām yamam
translated: Agni, the controller of chariots

original: uditā yo niditā veditā vasvā yajñiyo vavartati
analyzed: uditā yaḥ niditā veditā vasvā yajñiyaḥ vavartati
translated: He who is risen, set, and known, the one who is worthy of sacrifice turns to wealth

original: duṣṭarā yasya pravaṇe normayo dhiyā vājaṃ siṣāsataḥ
analyzed: duṣṭarāḥ yasya pravaṇe na ūrmayaḥ dhiyā vājam siṣāsataḥ
translated: Whose waves on the sloping plain are hard to cross, striving with thought for strength

analyzed: mā naḥ hṛṇītām atithiḥ vasuḥ agniḥ puru praśastaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: May the guest, the good Vasu Agni, praised by many, not be angry with us

analyzed: yaḥ su hotā su adhvaraḥ
translated: Who is a good host, one who offers well

original: mo te riṣan ye achoktibhirvaso 'gne kebhiścidevaiḥ
analyzed: mā u te riṣan ye achoktibhiḥ vaso gne kebhiścid devaiḥ
translated: Let not your anger, O Vasu Agni, be with any of us, with whomsoever it may be

original: kīriścid dhi tvāmīṭṭe dūtyāya rātahavyaḥ svadhvaraḥ🔽āgne yāhi marutsakhā rudrebhiḥ somapītaye
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvāmīṭṭe dūtyāya rāta havyaḥ su adhvaraḥ  ā agne yāhi marut sakhā rudrebhiḥ soma pītaye
translated: For even Kirin has chosen thee for his envoy, Rathavyu, the righteous🔽O Agni, come with the Maruts as friends, with the Rudras, to drink the Soma

analyzed: sobharyai upa suṣṭutim mādayasva svarṇare
translated: Rejoice in the praise of Sobhari, in the good laud, O thou of golden locks
